71 // #include "mio/page.hpp"

73  *

78  * permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following
79  * conditions:

82  * or substantial portions of the Software.

92 #ifndef MIO_PAGE_HEADER
93 #define MIO_PAGE_HEADER
94 
95 #ifdef _WIN32
96 # include <windows.h>
97 #else
98 # include <unistd.h>
99 #endif
100 
101 namespace mio {
102 
107 enum class access_mode
108 {
109  read,
110  write
111 };
112 
120 inline size_t page_size()
121 {
122  static const size_t page_size = []
123  {
124 #ifdef _WIN32
125  SYSTEM_INFO SystemInfo;
126  GetSystemInfo(&SystemInfo);
127  return SystemInfo.dwAllocationGranularity;
128 #else
129  return sysconf(_SC_PAGE_SIZE);
130 #endif
131  }();
132  return page_size;
133 }
134 
140 inline size_t make_offset_page_aligned(size_t offset) noexcept
141 {
142  const size_t page_size_ = page_size();
143  // Use integer division to round down to the nearest page alignment.
144  return offset / page_size_ * page_size_;
145 }
146 
147 } // namespace mio
148 
149 #endif // MIO_PAGE_HEADER
150 
151 
152 #include <iterator>
153 #include <string>
154 #include <system_error>
155 #include <cstdint>
156 
157 #ifdef _WIN32
158 # ifndef WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
159 # define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
160 # endif // WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
161 # include <windows.h>
162 #else // ifdef _WIN32
163 # define INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE -1
164 #endif // ifdef _WIN32
165 
166 namespace mio {
167 
168 // This value may be provided as the `length` parameter to the constructor or
169 // `map`, in which case a memory mapping of the entire file is created.
170 enum { map_entire_file = 0 };
171 
172 #ifdef _WIN32
173 using file_handle_type = HANDLE;
174 #else
175 using file_handle_type = int;
176 #endif
177 
178 // This value represents an invalid file handle type. This can be used to
179 // determine whether `basic_mmap::file_handle` is valid, for example.
180 const static file_handle_type invalid_handle = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
181 
182 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
183 struct basic_mmap
184 {
185  using value_type = ByteT;
186  using size_type = size_t;
187  using reference = value_type&;
188  using const_reference = const value_type&;
189  using pointer = value_type*;
190  using const_pointer = const value_type*;
191  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
192  using iterator = pointer;
193  using const_iterator = const_pointer;
194  using reverse_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<iterator>;
195  using const_reverse_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<const_iterator>;
196  using iterator_category = std::random_access_iterator_tag;
197  using handle_type = file_handle_type;
198 
199  static_assert(sizeof(ByteT) == sizeof(char), "ByteT must be the same size as char.");
200 
201 private:
202  // Points to the first requested byte, and not to the actual start of the mapping.
203  pointer data_ = nullptr;
204 
205  // Length--in bytes--requested by user (which may not be the length of the
206  // full mapping) and the length of the full mapping.
207  size_type length_ = 0;
208  size_type mapped_length_ = 0;
209 
210  // Letting user map a file using both an existing file handle and a path
211  // introcudes some complexity (see `is_handle_internal_`).
212  // On POSIX, we only need a file handle to create a mapping, while on
213  // Windows systems the file handle is necessary to retrieve a file mapping
214  // handle, but any subsequent operations on the mapped region must be done
215  // through the latter.
216  handle_type file_handle_ = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
217 #ifdef _WIN32
218  handle_type file_mapping_handle_ = INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE;
219 #endif
220 
221  // Letting user map a file using both an existing file handle and a path
222  // introcudes some complexity in that we must not close the file handle if
223  // user provided it, but we must close it if we obtained it using the
224  // provided path. For this reason, this flag is used to determine when to
225  // close `file_handle_`.
226  bool is_handle_internal_;
227 
228 public:
234  basic_mmap() = default;
235 
236 #ifdef __cpp_exceptions
242  template<typename String>
243  basic_mmap(const String& path, const size_type offset = 0, const size_type length = map_entire_file)
244  {
245  std::error_code error;
246  map(path, offset, length, error);
247  if(error) { throw std::system_error(error); }
248  }
249 
255  basic_mmap(const handle_type handle, const size_type offset = 0, const size_type length = map_entire_file)
256  {
257  std::error_code error;
258  map(handle, offset, length, error);
259  if(error) { throw std::system_error(error); }
260  }
261 #endif // __cpp_exceptions
262 
267  basic_mmap(const basic_mmap&) = delete;
268  basic_mmap(basic_mmap&&);
269  basic_mmap& operator=(const basic_mmap&) = delete;
270  basic_mmap& operator=(basic_mmap&&);
271 
276  ~basic_mmap();
277 
283  handle_type file_handle() const noexcept { return file_handle_; }
284  handle_type mapping_handle() const noexcept;
285 
287  bool is_open() const noexcept { return file_handle_ != invalid_handle; }
288 
294  bool empty() const noexcept { return length() == 0; }
295 
297  bool is_mapped() const noexcept;
298 
305  size_type size() const noexcept { return length(); }
306  size_type length() const noexcept { return length_; }
307  size_type mapped_length() const noexcept { return mapped_length_; }
308 
310  size_type mapping_offset() const noexcept
311  {
312  return mapped_length_ - length_;
313  }
314 
319  template<
320  access_mode A = AccessMode,
321  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
322  > pointer data() noexcept { return data_; }
323  const_pointer data() const noexcept { return data_; }
324 
329  template<
330  access_mode A = AccessMode,
331  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
332  > iterator begin() noexcept { return data(); }
333  const_iterator begin() const noexcept { return data(); }
334  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept { return data(); }
335 
340  template<
341  access_mode A = AccessMode,
342  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
343  > iterator end() noexcept { return data() + length(); }
344  const_iterator end() const noexcept { return data() + length(); }
345  const_iterator cend() const noexcept { return data() + length(); }
346 
352  template<
353  access_mode A = AccessMode,
354  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
355  > reverse_iterator rbegin() noexcept { return reverse_iterator(end()); }
356  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept
357  { return const_reverse_iterator(end()); }
358  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept
359  { return const_reverse_iterator(end()); }
360 
365  template<
366  access_mode A = AccessMode,
367  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
368  > reverse_iterator rend() noexcept { return reverse_iterator(begin()); }
369  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept
370  { return const_reverse_iterator(begin()); }
371  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept
372  { return const_reverse_iterator(begin()); }
373 
379  reference operator[](const size_type i) noexcept { return data_[i]; }
380  const_reference operator[](const size_type i) const noexcept { return data_[i]; }
381 
402  template<typename String>
403  void map(const String& path, const size_type offset,
404  const size_type length, std::error_code& error);
405 
418  template<typename String>
419  void map(const String& path, std::error_code& error)
420  {
421  map(path, 0, map_entire_file, error);
422  }
423 
443  void map(const handle_type handle, const size_type offset,
444  const size_type length, std::error_code& error);
445 
457  void map(const handle_type handle, std::error_code& error)
458  {
459  map(handle, 0, map_entire_file, error);
460  }
461 
471  void unmap();
472 
473  void swap(basic_mmap& other);
474 
476  template<access_mode A = AccessMode>
477  typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write, void>::type
478  sync(std::error_code& error);
479 
485 private:
486  template<
487  access_mode A = AccessMode,
488  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
489  > pointer get_mapping_start() noexcept
490  {
491  return !data() ? nullptr : data() - mapping_offset();
492  }
493 
494  const_pointer get_mapping_start() const noexcept
495  {
496  return !data() ? nullptr : data() - mapping_offset();
497  }
498 
504  template<access_mode A = AccessMode>
505  typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write, void>::type
506  conditional_sync();
507  template<access_mode A = AccessMode>
508  typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::read, void>::type conditional_sync();
509 };
510 
511 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
512 bool operator==(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
513  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b);
514 
515 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
516 bool operator!=(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
517  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b);
518 
519 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
520 bool operator<(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
521  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b);
522 
523 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
524 bool operator<=(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
525  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b);
526 
527 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
528 bool operator>(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
529  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b);
530 
531 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
532 bool operator>=(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
533  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b);
534 
539 template<typename ByteT>
540 using basic_mmap_source = basic_mmap<access_mode::read, ByteT>;
541 
546 template<typename ByteT>
547 using basic_mmap_sink = basic_mmap<access_mode::write, ByteT>;
548 
553 using mmap_source = basic_mmap_source<char>;
554 using ummap_source = basic_mmap_source<unsigned char>;
555 
556 using mmap_sink = basic_mmap_sink<char>;
557 using ummap_sink = basic_mmap_sink<unsigned char>;
558 
563 template<
564  typename MMap,
565  typename MappingToken
566 > MMap make_mmap(const MappingToken& token,
567  int64_t offset, int64_t length, std::error_code& error)
568 {
569  MMap mmap;
570  mmap.map(token, offset, length, error);
571  return mmap;
572 }
573 
581 template<typename MappingToken>
582 mmap_source make_mmap_source(const MappingToken& token, mmap_source::size_type offset,
583  mmap_source::size_type length, std::error_code& error)
584 {
585  return make_mmap<mmap_source>(token, offset, length, error);
586 }
587 
588 template<typename MappingToken>
589 mmap_source make_mmap_source(const MappingToken& token, std::error_code& error)
590 {
591  return make_mmap_source(token, 0, map_entire_file, error);
592 }
593 
601 template<typename MappingToken>
602 mmap_sink make_mmap_sink(const MappingToken& token, mmap_sink::size_type offset,
603  mmap_sink::size_type length, std::error_code& error)
604 {
605  return make_mmap<mmap_sink>(token, offset, length, error);
606 }
607 
608 template<typename MappingToken>
609 mmap_sink make_mmap_sink(const MappingToken& token, std::error_code& error)
610 {
611  return make_mmap_sink(token, 0, map_entire_file, error);
612 }
613 
614 } // namespace mio

638 #define MIO_BASIC_MMAP_IMPL

644 // #include "mio/detail/string_util.hpp"

664 
665 #ifndef MIO_STRING_UTIL_HEADER
666 #define MIO_STRING_UTIL_HEADER
667 
668 #include <type_traits>
669 
670 namespace mio {
671 namespace detail {
672 
673 template<
674  typename S,
675  typename C = typename std::decay<S>::type,
676  typename = decltype(std::declval<C>().data()),
677  typename = typename std::enable_if<
678  std::is_same<typename C::value_type, char>::value
679 #ifdef _WIN32
680  || std::is_same<typename C::value_type, wchar_t>::value
681 #endif
682  >::type
683 > struct char_type_helper {
684  using type = typename C::value_type;
685 };
686 
687 template<class T>
688 struct char_type {
689  using type = typename char_type_helper<T>::type;
690 };
691 
692 // TODO: can we avoid this brute force approach?
693 template<>
694 struct char_type<char*> {
695  using type = char;
696 };
697 
698 template<>
699 struct char_type<const char*> {
700  using type = char;
701 };
702 
703 template<size_t N>
704 struct char_type<char[N]> {
705  using type = char;
706 };
707 
708 template<size_t N>
709 struct char_type<const char[N]> {
710  using type = char;
711 };
712 
713 #ifdef _WIN32
714 template<>
715 struct char_type<wchar_t*> {
716  using type = wchar_t;
717 };
718 
719 template<>
720 struct char_type<const wchar_t*> {
721  using type = wchar_t;
722 };
723 
724 template<size_t N>
725 struct char_type<wchar_t[N]> {
726  using type = wchar_t;
727 };
728 
729 template<size_t N>
730 struct char_type<const wchar_t[N]> {
731  using type = wchar_t;
732 };
733 #endif // _WIN32
734 
735 template<typename CharT, typename S>
736 struct is_c_str_helper
737 {
738  static constexpr bool value = std::is_same<
739  CharT*,
740  // TODO: I'm so sorry for this... Can this be made cleaner?
741  typename std::add_pointer<
742  typename std::remove_cv<
743  typename std::remove_pointer<
744  typename std::decay<
745  S
746  >::type
747  >::type
748  >::type
749  >::type
750  >::value;
751 };
752 
753 template<typename S>
754 struct is_c_str
755 {
756  static constexpr bool value = is_c_str_helper<char, S>::value;
757 };
758 
759 #ifdef _WIN32
760 template<typename S>
761 struct is_c_wstr
762 {
763  static constexpr bool value = is_c_str_helper<wchar_t, S>::value;
764 };
765 #endif // _WIN32
766 
767 template<typename S>
768 struct is_c_str_or_c_wstr
769 {
770  static constexpr bool value = is_c_str<S>::value
771 #ifdef _WIN32
772  || is_c_wstr<S>::value
773 #endif
774  ;
775 };
776 
777 template<
778  typename String,
779  typename = decltype(std::declval<String>().data()),
780  typename = typename std::enable_if<!is_c_str_or_c_wstr<String>::value>::type
781 > const typename char_type<String>::type* c_str(const String& path)
782 {
783  return path.data();
784 }
785 
786 template<
787  typename String,
788  typename = decltype(std::declval<String>().empty()),
789  typename = typename std::enable_if<!is_c_str_or_c_wstr<String>::value>::type
790 > bool empty(const String& path)
791 {
792  return path.empty();
793 }
794 
795 template<
796  typename String,
797  typename = typename std::enable_if<is_c_str_or_c_wstr<String>::value>::type
798 > const typename char_type<String>::type* c_str(String path)
799 {
800  return path;
801 }
802 
803 template<
804  typename String,
805  typename = typename std::enable_if<is_c_str_or_c_wstr<String>::value>::type
806 > bool empty(String path)
807 {
808  return !path || (*path == 0);
809 }
810 
811 } // namespace detail
812 } // namespace mio
813 
814 #endif // MIO_STRING_UTIL_HEADER
815 
816 
817 #include <algorithm>
818 
819 #ifndef _WIN32
820 # include <unistd.h>
821 # include <fcntl.h>
822 # include <sys/mman.h>
823 # include <sys/stat.h>
824 #endif
825 
826 namespace mio {
827 namespace detail {
828 
829 #ifdef _WIN32
830 namespace win {
831 
833 inline DWORD int64_high(int64_t n) noexcept
834 {
835  return n >> 32;
836 }
837 
839 inline DWORD int64_low(int64_t n) noexcept
840 {
841  return n & 0xffffffff;
842 }
843 
844 template<
845  typename String,
846  typename = typename std::enable_if<
847  std::is_same<typename char_type<String>::type, char>::value
848  >::type
849 > file_handle_type open_file_helper(const String& path, const access_mode mode)
850 {
851  return ::CreateFileA(c_str(path),
852  mode == access_mode::read ? GENERIC_READ : GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE,
853  FILE_SHARE_READ | FILE_SHARE_WRITE,
854  0,
855  OPEN_EXISTING,
856  FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL,
857  0);
858 }
859 
860 template<typename String>
861 typename std::enable_if<
862  std::is_same<typename char_type<String>::type, wchar_t>::value,
863  file_handle_type
864 >::type open_file_helper(const String& path, const access_mode mode)
865 {
866  return ::CreateFileW(c_str(path),
867  mode == access_mode::read ? GENERIC_READ : GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE,
868  FILE_SHARE_READ | FILE_SHARE_WRITE,
869  0,
870  OPEN_EXISTING,
871  FILE_ATTRIBUTE_NORMAL,
872  0);
873 }
874 
875 } // win
876 #endif // _WIN32
877 
882 inline std::error_code last_error() noexcept
883 {
884  std::error_code error;
885 #ifdef _WIN32
886  error.assign(GetLastError(), std::system_category());
887 #else
888  error.assign(errno, std::system_category());
889 #endif
890  return error;
891 }
892 
893 template<typename String>
894 file_handle_type open_file(const String& path, const access_mode mode,
895  std::error_code& error)
896 {
897  error.clear();
898  if(detail::empty(path))
899  {
900  error = std::make_error_code(std::errc::invalid_argument);
901  return invalid_handle;
902  }
903 #ifdef _WIN32
904  const auto handle = win::open_file_helper(path, mode);
905 #else // POSIX
906  const auto handle = ::open(c_str(path),
907  mode == access_mode::read ? O_RDONLY : O_RDWR);
908 #endif
909  if(handle == invalid_handle)
910  {
911  error = detail::last_error();
912  }
913  return handle;
914 }
915 
916 inline size_t query_file_size(file_handle_type handle, std::error_code& error)
917 {
918  error.clear();
919 #ifdef _WIN32
920  LARGE_INTEGER file_size;
921  if(::GetFileSizeEx(handle, &file_size) == 0)
922  {
923  error = detail::last_error();
924  return 0;
925  }
926  return static_cast<int64_t>(file_size.QuadPart);
927 #else // POSIX
928  struct stat sbuf;
929  if(::fstat(handle, &sbuf) == -1)
930  {
931  error = detail::last_error();
932  return 0;
933  }
934  return sbuf.st_size;
935 #endif
936 }
937 
938 struct mmap_context
939 {
940  char* data;
941  int64_t length;
942  int64_t mapped_length;
943 #ifdef _WIN32
944  file_handle_type file_mapping_handle;
945 #endif
946 };
947 
948 inline mmap_context memory_map(const file_handle_type file_handle, const int64_t offset,
949  const int64_t length, const access_mode mode, std::error_code& error)
950 {
951  const int64_t aligned_offset = make_offset_page_aligned(offset);
952  const int64_t length_to_map = offset - aligned_offset + length;
953 #ifdef _WIN32
954  const int64_t max_file_size = offset + length;
955  const auto file_mapping_handle = ::CreateFileMapping(
956  file_handle,
957  0,
958  mode == access_mode::read ? PAGE_READONLY : PAGE_READWRITE,
959  win::int64_high(max_file_size),
960  win::int64_low(max_file_size),
961  0);
962  if(file_mapping_handle == invalid_handle)
963  {
964  error = detail::last_error();
965  return {};
966  }
967  char* mapping_start = static_cast<char*>(::MapViewOfFile(
968  file_mapping_handle,
969  mode == access_mode::read ? FILE_MAP_READ : FILE_MAP_WRITE,
970  win::int64_high(aligned_offset),
971  win::int64_low(aligned_offset),
972  length_to_map));
973  if(mapping_start == nullptr)
974  {
975  // Close file handle if mapping it failed.
976  ::CloseHandle(file_mapping_handle);
977  error = detail::last_error();
978  return {};
979  }
980 #else // POSIX
981  char* mapping_start = static_cast<char*>(::mmap(
982  0, // Don't give hint as to where to map.
983  length_to_map,
984  mode == access_mode::read ? PROT_READ : PROT_WRITE,
985  MAP_SHARED,
986  file_handle,
987  aligned_offset));
988  if(mapping_start == MAP_FAILED)
989  {
990  error = detail::last_error();
991  return {};
992  }
993 #endif
994  mmap_context ctx;
995  ctx.data = mapping_start + offset - aligned_offset;
996  ctx.length = length;
997  ctx.mapped_length = length_to_map;
998 #ifdef _WIN32
999  ctx.file_mapping_handle = file_mapping_handle;
1000 #endif
1001  return ctx;
1002 }
1003 
1004 } // namespace detail
1005 
1006 // -- basic_mmap --
1007 
1008 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1009 basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::~basic_mmap()
1010 {
1011  conditional_sync();
1012  unmap();
1013 }
1014 
1015 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1016 basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::basic_mmap(basic_mmap&& other)
1017  : data_(std::move(other.data_))
1018  , length_(std::move(other.length_))
1019  , mapped_length_(std::move(other.mapped_length_))
1020  , file_handle_(std::move(other.file_handle_))
1021 #ifdef _WIN32
1022  , file_mapping_handle_(std::move(other.file_mapping_handle_))
1023 #endif
1024  , is_handle_internal_(std::move(other.is_handle_internal_))
1025 {
1026  other.data_ = nullptr;
1027  other.length_ = other.mapped_length_ = 0;
1028  other.file_handle_ = invalid_handle;
1029 #ifdef _WIN32
1030  other.file_mapping_handle_ = invalid_handle;
1031 #endif
1032 }
1033 
1034 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1035 basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>&
1036 basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::operator=(basic_mmap&& other)
1037 {
1038  if(this != &other)
1039  {
1040  // First the existing mapping needs to be removed.
1041  unmap();
1042  data_ = std::move(other.data_);
1043  length_ = std::move(other.length_);
1044  mapped_length_ = std::move(other.mapped_length_);
1045  file_handle_ = std::move(other.file_handle_);
1046 #ifdef _WIN32
1047  file_mapping_handle_ = std::move(other.file_mapping_handle_);
1048 #endif
1049  is_handle_internal_ = std::move(other.is_handle_internal_);
1050 
1051  // The moved from basic_mmap's fields need to be reset, because
1052  // otherwise other's destructor will unmap the same mapping that was
1053  // just moved into this.
1054  other.data_ = nullptr;
1055  other.length_ = other.mapped_length_ = 0;
1056  other.file_handle_ = invalid_handle;
1057 #ifdef _WIN32
1058  other.file_mapping_handle_ = invalid_handle;
1059 #endif
1060  other.is_handle_internal_ = false;
1061  }
1062  return *this;
1063 }
1064 
1065 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1066 typename basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::handle_type
1067 basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::mapping_handle() const noexcept
1068 {
1069 #ifdef _WIN32
1070  return file_mapping_handle_;
1071 #else
1072  return file_handle_;
1073 #endif
1074 }
1075 
1076 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1077 template<typename String>
1078 void basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::map(const String& path, const size_type offset,
1079  const size_type length, std::error_code& error)
1080 {
1081  error.clear();
1082  if(detail::empty(path))
1083  {
1084  error = std::make_error_code(std::errc::invalid_argument);
1085  return;
1086  }
1087  const auto handle = detail::open_file(path, AccessMode, error);
1088  if(error)
1089  {
1090  return;
1091  }
1092 
1093  map(handle, offset, length, error);
1094  // This MUST be after the call to map, as that sets this to true.
1095  if(!error)
1096  {
1097  is_handle_internal_ = true;
1098  }
1099 }
1100 
1101 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1102 void basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::map(const handle_type handle,
1103  const size_type offset, const size_type length, std::error_code& error)
1104 {
1105  error.clear();
1106  if(handle == invalid_handle)
1107  {
1108  error = std::make_error_code(std::errc::bad_file_descriptor);
1109  return;
1110  }
1111 
1112  const auto file_size = detail::query_file_size(handle, error);
1113  if(error)
1114  {
1115  return;
1116  }
1117 
1118  if(offset + length > file_size)
1119  {
1120  error = std::make_error_code(std::errc::invalid_argument);
1121  return;
1122  }
1123 
1124  const auto ctx = detail::memory_map(handle, offset,
1125  length == map_entire_file ? (file_size - offset) : length,
1126  AccessMode, error);
1127  if(!error)
1128  {
1129  // We must unmap the previous mapping that may have existed prior to this call.
1130  // Note that this must only be invoked after a new mapping has been created in
1131  // order to provide the strong guarantee that, should the new mapping fail, the
1132  // `map` function leaves this instance in a state as though the function had
1133  // never been invoked.
1134  unmap();
1135  file_handle_ = handle;
1136  is_handle_internal_ = false;
1137  data_ = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(ctx.data);
1138  length_ = ctx.length;
1139  mapped_length_ = ctx.mapped_length;
1140 #ifdef _WIN32
1141  file_mapping_handle_ = ctx.file_mapping_handle;
1142 #endif
1143  }
1144 }
1145 
1146 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1147 template<access_mode A>
1148 typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write, void>::type
1149 basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::sync(std::error_code& error)
1150 {
1151  error.clear();
1152  if(!is_open())
1153  {
1154  error = std::make_error_code(std::errc::bad_file_descriptor);
1155  return;
1156  }
1157 
1158  if(data())
1159  {
1160 #ifdef _WIN32
1161  if(::FlushViewOfFile(get_mapping_start(), mapped_length_) == 0
1162  || ::FlushFileBuffers(file_handle_) == 0)
1163 #else // POSIX
1164  if(::msync(get_mapping_start(), mapped_length_, MS_SYNC) != 0)
1165 #endif
1166  {
1167  error = detail::last_error();
1168  return;
1169  }
1170  }
1171 #ifdef _WIN32
1172  if(::FlushFileBuffers(file_handle_) == 0)
1173  {
1174  error = detail::last_error();
1175  }
1176 #endif
1177 }
1178 
1179 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1180 void basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::unmap()
1181 {
1182  if(!is_open()) { return; }
1183  // TODO do we care about errors here?
1184 #ifdef _WIN32
1185  if(is_mapped())
1186  {
1187  ::UnmapViewOfFile(get_mapping_start());
1188  ::CloseHandle(file_mapping_handle_);
1189  }
1190 #else // POSIX
1191  if(data_) { ::munmap(const_cast<pointer>(get_mapping_start()), mapped_length_); }
1192 #endif
1193 
1194  // If `file_handle_` was obtained by our opening it (when map is called with
1195  // a path, rather than an existing file handle), we need to close it,
1196  // otherwise it must not be closed as it may still be used outside this
1197  // instance.
1198  if(is_handle_internal_)
1199  {
1200 #ifdef _WIN32
1201  ::CloseHandle(file_handle_);
1202 #else // POSIX
1203  ::close(file_handle_);
1204 #endif
1205  }
1206 
1207  // Reset fields to their default values.
1208  data_ = nullptr;
1209  length_ = mapped_length_ = 0;
1210  file_handle_ = invalid_handle;
1211 #ifdef _WIN32
1212  file_mapping_handle_ = invalid_handle;
1213 #endif
1214 }
1215 
1216 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1217 bool basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::is_mapped() const noexcept
1218 {
1219 #ifdef _WIN32
1220  return file_mapping_handle_ != invalid_handle;
1221 #else // POSIX
1222  return is_open();
1223 #endif
1224 }
1225 
1226 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1227 void basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::swap(basic_mmap& other)
1228 {
1229  if(this != &other)
1230  {
1231  using std::swap;
1232  swap(data_, other.data_);
1233  swap(file_handle_, other.file_handle_);
1234 #ifdef _WIN32
1235  swap(file_mapping_handle_, other.file_mapping_handle_);
1236 #endif
1237  swap(length_, other.length_);
1238  swap(mapped_length_, other.mapped_length_);
1239  swap(is_handle_internal_, other.is_handle_internal_);
1240  }
1241 }
1242 
1243 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1244 template<access_mode A>
1245 typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write, void>::type
1246 basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::conditional_sync()
1247 {
1248  // This is invoked from the destructor, so not much we can do about
1249  // failures here.
1250  std::error_code ec;
1251  sync(ec);
1252 }
1253 
1254 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1255 template<access_mode A>
1256 typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::read, void>::type
1257 basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>::conditional_sync()
1258 {
1259  // noop
1260 }
1261 
1262 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1263 bool operator==(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
1264  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b)
1265 {
1266  return a.data() == b.data()
1267  && a.size() == b.size();
1268 }
1269 
1270 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1271 bool operator!=(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
1272  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b)
1273 {
1274  return !(a == b);
1275 }
1276 
1277 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1278 bool operator<(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
1279  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b)
1280 {
1281  if(a.data() == b.data()) { return a.size() < b.size(); }
1282  return a.data() < b.data();
1283 }
1284 
1285 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1286 bool operator<=(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
1287  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b)
1288 {
1289  return !(a > b);
1290 }
1291 
1292 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1293 bool operator>(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
1294  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b)
1295 {
1296  if(a.data() == b.data()) { return a.size() > b.size(); }
1297  return a.data() > b.data();
1298 }
1299 
1300 template<access_mode AccessMode, typename ByteT>
1301 bool operator>=(const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& a,
1302  const basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>& b)
1303 {
1304  return !(a < b);
1305 }
1306 
1307 } // namespace mio
1308 
1309 #endif // MIO_BASIC_MMAP_IMPL
1310 
1311 
1312 #endif // MIO_MMAP_HEADER

1333 #ifndef MIO_PAGE_HEADER
1334 #define MIO_PAGE_HEADER
1335 
1336 #ifdef _WIN32
1337 # include <windows.h>
1338 #else
1339 # include <unistd.h>
1340 #endif
1341 
1342 namespace mio {
1343 
1348 enum class access_mode
1349 {
1350  read,
1351  write
1352 };
1353 
1361 inline size_t page_size()
1362 {
1363  static const size_t page_size = []
1364  {
1365 #ifdef _WIN32
1366  SYSTEM_INFO SystemInfo;
1367  GetSystemInfo(&SystemInfo);
1368  return SystemInfo.dwAllocationGranularity;
1369 #else
1370  return sysconf(_SC_PAGE_SIZE);
1371 #endif
1372  }();
1373  return page_size;
1374 }
1375 
1381 inline size_t make_offset_page_aligned(size_t offset) noexcept
1382 {
1383  const size_t page_size_ = page_size();
1384  // Use integer division to round down to the nearest page alignment.
1385  return offset / page_size_ * page_size_;
1386 }
1387 
1388 } // namespace mio
1389 
1390 #endif // MIO_PAGE_HEADER

1392  *
1393  * Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this
1394  * software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in the Software
1395  * without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify,
1396  * merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to
1397  * permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following
1398  * conditions:
1399  *
1400  * The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies
1401  * or substantial portions of the Software.
1402  *
1403  * THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED,
1404  * INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A
1405  * PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT
1406  * HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF
1407  * CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE
1408  * OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.
1409  */

1411 #ifndef MIO_SHARED_MMAP_HEADER
1412 #define MIO_SHARED_MMAP_HEADER
1413 
1414 // #include "mio/mmap.hpp"
1415 
1416 
1417 #include <system_error> // std::error_code
1418 #include <memory> // std::shared_ptr
1419 
1420 namespace mio {
1421 
1429 template<
1430  access_mode AccessMode,
1431  typename ByteT
1432 > class basic_shared_mmap
1433 {
1434  using impl_type = basic_mmap<AccessMode, ByteT>;
1435  std::shared_ptr<impl_type> pimpl_;
1436 
1437 public:
1438  using value_type = typename impl_type::value_type;
1439  using size_type = typename impl_type::size_type;
1440  using reference = typename impl_type::reference;
1441  using const_reference = typename impl_type::const_reference;
1442  using pointer = typename impl_type::pointer;
1443  using const_pointer = typename impl_type::const_pointer;
1444  using difference_type = typename impl_type::difference_type;
1445  using iterator = typename impl_type::iterator;
1446  using const_iterator = typename impl_type::const_iterator;
1447  using reverse_iterator = typename impl_type::reverse_iterator;
1448  using const_reverse_iterator = typename impl_type::const_reverse_iterator;
1449  using iterator_category = typename impl_type::iterator_category;
1450  using handle_type = typename impl_type::handle_type;
1451  using mmap_type = impl_type;
1452 
1453  basic_shared_mmap() = default;
1454  basic_shared_mmap(const basic_shared_mmap&) = default;
1455  basic_shared_mmap& operator=(const basic_shared_mmap&) = default;
1456  basic_shared_mmap(basic_shared_mmap&&) = default;
1457  basic_shared_mmap& operator=(basic_shared_mmap&&) = default;
1458 
1460  basic_shared_mmap(mmap_type&& mmap)
1461  : pimpl_(std::make_shared<mmap_type>(std::move(mmap)))
1462  {}
1463 
1465  basic_shared_mmap& operator=(mmap_type&& mmap)
1466  {
1467  pimpl_ = std::make_shared<mmap_type>(std::move(mmap));
1468  return *this;
1469  }
1470 
1472  basic_shared_mmap(std::shared_ptr<mmap_type> mmap) : pimpl_(std::move(mmap)) {}
1473 
1475  basic_shared_mmap& operator=(std::shared_ptr<mmap_type> mmap)
1476  {
1477  pimpl_ = std::move(mmap);
1478  return *this;
1479  }
1480 
1481 #ifdef __cpp_exceptions
1487  template<typename String>
1488  basic_shared_mmap(const String& path, const size_type offset = 0, const size_type length = map_entire_file)
1489  {
1490  std::error_code error;
1491  map(path, offset, length, error);
1492  if(error) { throw std::system_error(error); }
1493  }
1494 
1500  basic_shared_mmap(const handle_type handle, const size_type offset = 0, const size_type length = map_entire_file)
1501  {
1502  std::error_code error;
1503  map(handle, offset, length, error);
1504  if(error) { throw std::system_error(error); }
1505  }
1506 #endif // __cpp_exceptions
1507 
1513  ~basic_shared_mmap() = default;
1514 
1516  std::shared_ptr<mmap_type> get_shared_ptr() { return pimpl_; }
1517 
1523  handle_type file_handle() const noexcept
1524  {
1525  return pimpl_ ? pimpl_->file_handle() : invalid_handle;
1526  }
1527 
1528  handle_type mapping_handle() const noexcept
1529  {
1530  return pimpl_ ? pimpl_->mapping_handle() : invalid_handle;
1531  }
1532 
1534  bool is_open() const noexcept { return pimpl_ && pimpl_->is_open(); }
1535 
1541  bool empty() const noexcept { return !pimpl_ || pimpl_->empty(); }
1542 
1549  size_type size() const noexcept { return pimpl_ ? pimpl_->length() : 0; }
1550  size_type length() const noexcept { return pimpl_ ? pimpl_->length() : 0; }
1551  size_type mapped_length() const noexcept
1552  {
1553  return pimpl_ ? pimpl_->mapped_length() : 0;
1554  }
1555 
1560  template<
1561  access_mode A = AccessMode,
1562  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
1563  > pointer data() noexcept { return pimpl_->data(); }
1564  const_pointer data() const noexcept { return pimpl_ ? pimpl_->data() : nullptr; }
1565 
1570  iterator begin() noexcept { return pimpl_->begin(); }
1571  const_iterator begin() const noexcept { return pimpl_->begin(); }
1572  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept { return pimpl_->cbegin(); }
1573 
1578  template<
1579  access_mode A = AccessMode,
1580  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
1581  > iterator end() noexcept { return pimpl_->end(); }
1582  const_iterator end() const noexcept { return pimpl_->end(); }
1583  const_iterator cend() const noexcept { return pimpl_->cend(); }
1584 
1590  template<
1591  access_mode A = AccessMode,
1592  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
1593  > reverse_iterator rbegin() noexcept { return pimpl_->rbegin(); }
1594  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept { return pimpl_->rbegin(); }
1595  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept { return pimpl_->crbegin(); }
1596 
1601  template<
1602  access_mode A = AccessMode,
1603  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
1604  > reverse_iterator rend() noexcept { return pimpl_->rend(); }
1605  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept { return pimpl_->rend(); }
1606  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept { return pimpl_->crend(); }
1607 
1613  reference operator[](const size_type i) noexcept { return (*pimpl_)[i]; }
1614  const_reference operator[](const size_type i) const noexcept { return (*pimpl_)[i]; }
1615 
1636  template<typename String>
1637  void map(const String& path, const size_type offset,
1638  const size_type length, std::error_code& error)
1639  {
1640  map_impl(path, offset, length, error);
1641  }
1642 
1655  template<typename String>
1656  void map(const String& path, std::error_code& error)
1657  {
1658  map_impl(path, 0, map_entire_file, error);
1659  }
1660 
1680  void map(const handle_type handle, const size_type offset,
1681  const size_type length, std::error_code& error)
1682  {
1683  map_impl(handle, offset, length, error);
1684  }
1685 
1697  void map(const handle_type handle, std::error_code& error)
1698  {
1699  map_impl(handle, 0, map_entire_file, error);
1700  }
1701 
1711  void unmap() { if(pimpl_) pimpl_->unmap(); }
1712 
1713  void swap(basic_shared_mmap& other) { pimpl_.swap(other.pimpl_); }
1714 
1716  template<
1717  access_mode A = AccessMode,
1718  typename = typename std::enable_if<A == access_mode::write>::type
1719  > void sync(std::error_code& error) { if(pimpl_) pimpl_->sync(error); }
1720 
1723  friend bool operator==(const basic_shared_mmap& a, const basic_shared_mmap& b)
1724  {
1725  return a.pimpl_ == b.pimpl_;
1726  }
1727 
1728  friend bool operator!=(const basic_shared_mmap& a, const basic_shared_mmap& b)
1729  {
1730  return !(a == b);
1731  }
1732 
1733  friend bool operator<(const basic_shared_mmap& a, const basic_shared_mmap& b)
1734  {
1735  return a.pimpl_ < b.pimpl_;
1736  }
1737 
1738  friend bool operator<=(const basic_shared_mmap& a, const basic_shared_mmap& b)
1739  {
1740  return a.pimpl_ <= b.pimpl_;
1741  }
1742 
1743  friend bool operator>(const basic_shared_mmap& a, const basic_shared_mmap& b)
1744  {
1745  return a.pimpl_ > b.pimpl_;
1746  }
1747 
1748  friend bool operator>=(const basic_shared_mmap& a, const basic_shared_mmap& b)
1749  {
1750  return a.pimpl_ >= b.pimpl_;
1751  }
1752 
1753 private:
1754  template<typename MappingToken>
1755  void map_impl(const MappingToken& token, const size_type offset,
1756  const size_type length, std::error_code& error)
1757  {
1758  if(!pimpl_)
1759  {
1760  mmap_type mmap = make_mmap<mmap_type>(token, offset, length, error);
1761  if(error) { return; }
1762  pimpl_ = std::make_shared<mmap_type>(std::move(mmap));
1763  }
1764  else
1765  {
1766  pimpl_->map(token, offset, length, error);
1767  }
1768  }
1769 };
1770 
1775 template<typename ByteT>
1776 using basic_shared_mmap_source = basic_shared_mmap<access_mode::read, ByteT>;
1777 
1782 template<typename ByteT>
1783 using basic_shared_mmap_sink = basic_shared_mmap<access_mode::write, ByteT>;
1784 
1789 using shared_mmap_source = basic_shared_mmap_source<char>;
1790 using shared_ummap_source = basic_shared_mmap_source<unsigned char>;
1791 
1792 using shared_mmap_sink = basic_shared_mmap_sink<char>;
1793 using shared_ummap_sink = basic_shared_mmap_sink<unsigned char>;
1794 
1795 } // namespace mio
1796 
1797 #endif // MIO_SHARED_MMAP_HEADER
1798 
1803 #include <algorithm>
1804 #include <array>
1805 #include <condition_variable>
1806 #include <deque>
1807 #include <fstream>

1809 #include <mutex>
1810 #include <unordered_map>
1811 #include <unordered_set>
1812 #include <thread>
1813 #include <vector>
1814 
1815 #include <memory>
1816 #include <unordered_map>
1817 #include <string>
1818 #include <vector>
1819 
1824 #include <algorithm>
1825 #include <array>
1826 #include <cmath>
1827 #include <cstdlib>
1828 #include <deque>
1829 
1830 #if defined(_WIN32)
1831 # ifndef WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
1832 # define WIN32_LEAN_AND_MEAN
1833 # endif
1834 # include <Windows.h>
1835 # undef max
1836 # undef min
1837 #elif defined(__linux__)
1838 # include <unistd.h>
1839 #endif
1840 
1844 #define CSV_INLINE inline
1845 
1846 #include <type_traits>

1851 // For more information see https://github.com/martinmoene/string-view-lite
1852 //

1854 // (See accompanying file LICENSE.txt or copy at http://www.boost.org/LICENSE_1_0.txt)

1857 #ifndef NONSTD_SV_LITE_H_INCLUDED
1858 #define NONSTD_SV_LITE_H_INCLUDED
1859 
1860 #define string_view_lite_MAJOR 1
1861 #define string_view_lite_MINOR 1
1862 #define string_view_lite_PATCH 0
1863 
1864 #define string_view_lite_VERSION nssv_STRINGIFY(string_view_lite_MAJOR) "." nssv_STRINGIFY(string_view_lite_MINOR) "." nssv_STRINGIFY(string_view_lite_PATCH)
1865 
1866 #define nssv_STRINGIFY( x ) nssv_STRINGIFY_( x )
1867 #define nssv_STRINGIFY_( x ) #x
1868 
1869 // string-view lite configuration:
1870 
1871 #define nssv_STRING_VIEW_DEFAULT 0
1872 #define nssv_STRING_VIEW_NONSTD 1
1873 #define nssv_STRING_VIEW_STD 2
1874 
1875 #if !defined( nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_STRING_VIEW )
1876 # define nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_STRING_VIEW ( nssv_HAVE_STD_STRING_VIEW ? nssv_STRING_VIEW_STD : nssv_STRING_VIEW_NONSTD )
1877 #endif
1878 
1879 #if defined( nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_STD_STRING_VIEW ) || defined( nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_NONSTD_STRING_VIEW )
1880 # error nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_STD_STRING_VIEW and nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_NONSTD_STRING_VIEW are deprecated and removed, please use nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_STRING_VIEW=nssv_STRING_VIEW_...
1881 #endif
1882 
1883 #ifndef nssv_CONFIG_STD_SV_OPERATOR
1884 # define nssv_CONFIG_STD_SV_OPERATOR 0
1885 #endif
1886 
1887 #ifndef nssv_CONFIG_USR_SV_OPERATOR
1888 # define nssv_CONFIG_USR_SV_OPERATOR 1
1889 #endif
1890 
1891 #ifdef nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING
1892 # define nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_CLASS_METHODS nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING
1893 # define nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_FREE_FUNCTIONS nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING
1894 #endif
1895 
1896 #ifndef nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_CLASS_METHODS
1897 # define nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_CLASS_METHODS 1
1898 #endif
1899 
1900 #ifndef nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_FREE_FUNCTIONS
1901 # define nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_FREE_FUNCTIONS 1
1902 #endif
1903 
1904 // Control presence of exception handling (try and auto discover):
1905 
1906 #ifndef nssv_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
1907 # if defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)
1908 # define nssv_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS 0
1909 # else
1910 # define nssv_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS 1
1911 # endif
1912 #endif
1913 
1914 // C++ language version detection (C++20 is speculative):
1915 // Note: VC14.0/1900 (VS2015) lacks too much from C++14.
1916 
1917 #ifndef nssv_CPLUSPLUS
1918 # if defined(_MSVC_LANG ) && !defined(__clang__)
1919 # define nssv_CPLUSPLUS (_MSC_VER == 1900 ? 201103L : _MSVC_LANG )
1920 # else
1921 # define nssv_CPLUSPLUS __cplusplus
1922 # endif
1923 #endif
1924 
1925 #define nssv_CPP98_OR_GREATER ( nssv_CPLUSPLUS >= 199711L )
1926 #define nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER ( nssv_CPLUSPLUS >= 201103L )
1927 #define nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ ( nssv_CPLUSPLUS >= 201103L )
1928 #define nssv_CPP14_OR_GREATER ( nssv_CPLUSPLUS >= 201402L )
1929 #define nssv_CPP17_OR_GREATER ( nssv_CPLUSPLUS >= 201703L )
1930 #define nssv_CPP20_OR_GREATER ( nssv_CPLUSPLUS >= 202000L )
1931 
1932 // use C++17 std::string_view if available and requested:
1933 
1934 #if nssv_CPP17_OR_GREATER && defined(__has_include )
1935 # if __has_include( <string_view> )
1936 # define nssv_HAVE_STD_STRING_VIEW 1
1937 # else
1938 # define nssv_HAVE_STD_STRING_VIEW 0
1939 # endif
1940 #else
1941 # define nssv_HAVE_STD_STRING_VIEW 0
1942 #endif
1943 
1944 #define nssv_USES_STD_STRING_VIEW ( (nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_STRING_VIEW == nssv_STRING_VIEW_STD) || ((nssv_CONFIG_SELECT_STRING_VIEW == nssv_STRING_VIEW_DEFAULT) && nssv_HAVE_STD_STRING_VIEW) )
1945 
1946 #define nssv_HAVE_STARTS_WITH ( nssv_CPP20_OR_GREATER || !nssv_USES_STD_STRING_VIEW )
1947 #define nssv_HAVE_ENDS_WITH nssv_HAVE_STARTS_WITH
1948 
1949 //
1950 // Use C++17 std::string_view:
1951 //
1952 
1953 #if nssv_USES_STD_STRING_VIEW
1954 
1955 #include <string_view>
1956 
1957 // Extensions for std::string:
1958 
1959 #if nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_FREE_FUNCTIONS
1960 
1961 namespace nonstd {
1962 
1963 template< class CharT, class Traits, class Allocator = std::allocator<CharT> >
1964 std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>
1965 to_string( std::basic_string_view<CharT, Traits> v, Allocator const & a = Allocator() )
1966 {
1967  return std::basic_string<CharT,Traits, Allocator>( v.begin(), v.end(), a );
1968 }
1969 
1970 template< class CharT, class Traits, class Allocator >
1971 std::basic_string_view<CharT, Traits>
1972 to_string_view( std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator> const & s )
1973 {
1974  return std::basic_string_view<CharT, Traits>( s.data(), s.size() );
1975 }
1976 
1977 // Literal operators sv and _sv:
1978 
1979 #if nssv_CONFIG_STD_SV_OPERATOR
1980 
1981 using namespace std::literals::string_view_literals;
1982 
1983 #endif
1984 
1985 #if nssv_CONFIG_USR_SV_OPERATOR
1986 
1987 inline namespace literals {
1988 inline namespace string_view_literals {
1989 
1990 
1991 constexpr std::string_view operator "" _sv( const char* str, size_t len ) noexcept // (1)
1992 {
1993  return std::string_view{ str, len };
1994 }
1995 
1996 constexpr std::u16string_view operator "" _sv( const char16_t* str, size_t len ) noexcept // (2)
1997 {
1998  return std::u16string_view{ str, len };
1999 }
2000 
2001 constexpr std::u32string_view operator "" _sv( const char32_t* str, size_t len ) noexcept // (3)
2002 {
2003  return std::u32string_view{ str, len };
2004 }
2005 
2006 constexpr std::wstring_view operator "" _sv( const wchar_t* str, size_t len ) noexcept // (4)
2007 {
2008  return std::wstring_view{ str, len };
2009 }
2010 
2011 }} // namespace literals::string_view_literals
2012 
2013 #endif // nssv_CONFIG_USR_SV_OPERATOR
2014 
2015 } // namespace nonstd
2016 
2017 #endif // nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_FREE_FUNCTIONS
2018 
2019 namespace nonstd {
2020

2022 using std::wstring_view;
2023 using std::u16string_view;
2024 using std::u32string_view;

2040 #else // nssv_HAVE_STD_STRING_VIEW
2041 
2042 //
2043 // Before C++17: use string_view lite:
2044 //
2045 
2046 // Compiler versions:
2047 //
2048 // MSVC++ 6.0 _MSC_VER == 1200 (Visual Studio 6.0)
2049 // MSVC++ 7.0 _MSC_VER == 1300 (Visual Studio .NET 2002)
2050 // MSVC++ 7.1 _MSC_VER == 1310 (Visual Studio .NET 2003)
2051 // MSVC++ 8.0 _MSC_VER == 1400 (Visual Studio 2005)
2052 // MSVC++ 9.0 _MSC_VER == 1500 (Visual Studio 2008)
2053 // MSVC++ 10.0 _MSC_VER == 1600 (Visual Studio 2010)
2054 // MSVC++ 11.0 _MSC_VER == 1700 (Visual Studio 2012)
2055 // MSVC++ 12.0 _MSC_VER == 1800 (Visual Studio 2013)
2056 // MSVC++ 14.0 _MSC_VER == 1900 (Visual Studio 2015)
2057 // MSVC++ 14.1 _MSC_VER >= 1910 (Visual Studio 2017)
2058 
2059 #if defined(_MSC_VER ) && !defined(__clang__)
2060 # define nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER (_MSC_VER )
2061 # define nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION (_MSC_VER / 10 - 10 * ( 5 + (_MSC_VER < 1900 ) ) )
2062 #else
2063 # define nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER 0
2064 # define nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION 0
2065 #endif
2066 
2067 #define nssv_COMPILER_VERSION( major, minor, patch ) (10 * ( 10 * major + minor) + patch)
2068 
2069 #if defined(__clang__)
2070 # define nssv_COMPILER_CLANG_VERSION nssv_COMPILER_VERSION(__clang_major__, __clang_minor__, __clang_patchlevel__)
2071 #else
2072 # define nssv_COMPILER_CLANG_VERSION 0
2073 #endif
2074 
2075 #if defined(__GNUC__) && !defined(__clang__)
2076 # define nssv_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION nssv_COMPILER_VERSION(__GNUC__, __GNUC_MINOR__, __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)
2077 #else
2078 # define nssv_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION 0
2079 #endif
2080 
2081 // half-open range [lo..hi):
2082 #define nssv_BETWEEN( v, lo, hi ) ( (lo) <= (v) && (v) < (hi) )
2083 
2084 // Presence of language and library features:
2085 
2086 #ifdef _HAS_CPP0X
2087 # define nssv_HAS_CPP0X _HAS_CPP0X
2088 #else
2089 # define nssv_HAS_CPP0X 0
2090 #endif
2091 
2092 // Unless defined otherwise below, consider VC14 as C++11 for variant-lite:
2093 
2094 #if nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1900
2095 # undef nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2096 # define nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER 1
2097 #endif
2098 
2099 #define nssv_CPP11_90 (nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1500)
2100 #define nssv_CPP11_100 (nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1600)
2101 #define nssv_CPP11_110 (nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1700)
2102 #define nssv_CPP11_120 (nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1800)
2103 #define nssv_CPP11_140 (nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1900)
2104 #define nssv_CPP11_141 (nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER_ || nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VER >= 1910)
2105 
2106 #define nssv_CPP14_000 (nssv_CPP14_OR_GREATER)
2107 #define nssv_CPP17_000 (nssv_CPP17_OR_GREATER)
2108 
2109 // Presence of C++11 language features:
2110 
2111 #define nssv_HAVE_CONSTEXPR_11 nssv_CPP11_140
2112 #define nssv_HAVE_EXPLICIT_CONVERSION nssv_CPP11_140
2113 #define nssv_HAVE_INLINE_NAMESPACE nssv_CPP11_140
2114 #define nssv_HAVE_NOEXCEPT nssv_CPP11_140
2115 #define nssv_HAVE_NULLPTR nssv_CPP11_100
2116 #define nssv_HAVE_REF_QUALIFIER nssv_CPP11_140
2117 #define nssv_HAVE_UNICODE_LITERALS nssv_CPP11_140
2118 #define nssv_HAVE_USER_DEFINED_LITERALS nssv_CPP11_140
2119 #define nssv_HAVE_WCHAR16_T nssv_CPP11_100
2120 #define nssv_HAVE_WCHAR32_T nssv_CPP11_100
2121 
2122 #if ! ( ( nssv_CPP11 && nssv_COMPILER_CLANG_VERSION ) || nssv_BETWEEN( nssv_COMPILER_CLANG_VERSION, 300, 400 ) )
2123 # define nssv_HAVE_STD_DEFINED_LITERALS nssv_CPP11_140
2124 #endif
2125 
2126 // Presence of C++14 language features:
2127 
2128 #define nssv_HAVE_CONSTEXPR_14 nssv_CPP14_000
2129 
2130 // Presence of C++17 language features:
2131

2135

2139
