2142 #else
2143 # define nssv_constexpr /*constexpr*/
2144 #endif
2145 
2146 #if nssv_HAVE_CONSTEXPR_14
2147 # define nssv_constexpr14 constexpr
2148 #else
2149 # define nssv_constexpr14 /*constexpr*/
2150 #endif
2151 
2152 #if nssv_HAVE_EXPLICIT_CONVERSION
2153 # define nssv_explicit explicit
2154 #else
2155 # define nssv_explicit /*explicit*/
2156 #endif
2157 
2158 #if nssv_HAVE_INLINE_NAMESPACE
2159 # define nssv_inline_ns inline
2160 #else
2161 # define nssv_inline_ns /*inline*/
2162 #endif
2163 
2164 #if nssv_HAVE_NOEXCEPT
2165 # define nssv_noexcept noexcept
2166 #else
2167 # define nssv_noexcept /*noexcept*/
2168 #endif
2169 
2170 //#if nssv_HAVE_REF_QUALIFIER
2171 //# define nssv_ref_qual &
2172 //# define nssv_refref_qual &&
2173 //#else
2174 //# define nssv_ref_qual /*&*/
2175 //# define nssv_refref_qual /*&&*/
2176 //#endif
2177 
2178 #if nssv_HAVE_NULLPTR
2179 # define nssv_nullptr nullptr
2180 #else
2181 # define nssv_nullptr NULL
2182 #endif
2183 
2184 #if nssv_HAVE_NODISCARD
2185 # define nssv_nodiscard [[nodiscard]]
2186 #else
2187 # define nssv_nodiscard /*[[nodiscard]]*/
2188 #endif
2189 
2190 // Additional includes:
2191 
2192 #include <algorithm>
2193 #include <cassert>
2194 #include <iterator>
2195 #include <limits>
2196 #include <ostream>
2197 #include <string> // std::char_traits<>
2198 
2199 #if ! nssv_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
2200 # include <stdexcept>
2201 #endif
2202 
2203 #if nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2204 # include <type_traits>
2205 #endif
2206 
2207 // Clang, GNUC, MSVC warning suppression macros:
2208 
2209 #if defined(__clang__)
2210 # pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wreserved-user-defined-literal"
2211 # pragma clang diagnostic push
2212 # pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wuser-defined-literals"
2213 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
2214 # pragma GCC diagnostic push
2215 # pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wliteral-suffix"
2216 #endif // __clang__
2217 
2218 #if nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION >= 140
2219 # define nssv_SUPPRESS_MSGSL_WARNING(expr) [[gsl::suppress(expr)]]
2220 # define nssv_SUPPRESS_MSVC_WARNING(code, descr) __pragma(warning(suppress: code) )
2221 # define nssv_DISABLE_MSVC_WARNINGS(codes) __pragma(warning(push)) __pragma(warning(disable: codes))
2222 #else
2223 # define nssv_SUPPRESS_MSGSL_WARNING(expr)
2224 # define nssv_SUPPRESS_MSVC_WARNING(code, descr)
2225 # define nssv_DISABLE_MSVC_WARNINGS(codes)
2226 #endif
2227 
2228 #if defined(__clang__)
2229 # define nssv_RESTORE_WARNINGS() _Pragma("clang diagnostic pop")
2230 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
2231 # define nssv_RESTORE_WARNINGS() _Pragma("GCC diagnostic pop")
2232 #elif nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION >= 140
2233 # define nssv_RESTORE_WARNINGS() __pragma(warning(pop ))
2234 #else
2235 # define nssv_RESTORE_WARNINGS()
2236 #endif
2237 
2238 // Suppress the following MSVC (GSL) warnings:
2239 // - C4455, non-gsl : 'operator ""sv': literal suffix identifiers that do not
2240 // start with an underscore are reserved
2241 // - C26472, gsl::t.1 : don't use a static_cast for arithmetic conversions;
2242 // use brace initialization, gsl::narrow_cast or gsl::narow
2243 // - C26481: gsl::b.1 : don't use pointer arithmetic. Use span instead
2244 
2245 nssv_DISABLE_MSVC_WARNINGS( 4455 26481 26472 )
2246 //nssv_DISABLE_CLANG_WARNINGS( "-Wuser-defined-literals" )
2247 //nssv_DISABLE_GNUC_WARNINGS( -Wliteral-suffix )
2248 
2249 namespace nonstd { namespace sv_lite {
2250 
2251 template
2252 <
2253  class CharT,
2254  class Traits = std::char_traits<CharT>
2255 >
2256 class basic_string_view;
2257 
2258 //
2259 // basic_string_view:
2260 //
2261 
2262 template
2263 <
2264  class CharT,
2265  class Traits /* = std::char_traits<CharT> */
2266 >
2267 class basic_string_view
2268 {
2269 public:
2270  // Member types:
2271 
2272  typedef Traits traits_type;
2273  typedef CharT value_type;
2274 
2275  typedef CharT * pointer;
2276  typedef CharT const * const_pointer;
2277  typedef CharT & reference;
2278  typedef CharT const & const_reference;
2279 
2280  typedef const_pointer iterator;
2281  typedef const_pointer const_iterator;
2282  typedef std::reverse_iterator< const_iterator > reverse_iterator;
2283  typedef std::reverse_iterator< const_iterator > const_reverse_iterator;
2284 
2285  typedef std::size_t size_type;
2286  typedef std::ptrdiff_t difference_type;
2287 
2288  // 24.4.2.1 Construction and assignment:
2289 
2290  nssv_constexpr basic_string_view() nssv_noexcept
2291  : data_( nssv_nullptr )
2292  , size_( 0 )
2293  {}
2294 
2295 #if nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2296  nssv_constexpr basic_string_view( basic_string_view const & other ) nssv_noexcept = default;
2297 #else
2298  nssv_constexpr basic_string_view( basic_string_view const & other ) nssv_noexcept
2299  : data_( other.data_)
2300  , size_( other.size_)
2301  {}
2302 #endif
2303 
2304  nssv_constexpr basic_string_view( CharT const * s, size_type count )
2305  : data_( s )
2306  , size_( count )
2307  {}
2308 
2309  nssv_constexpr basic_string_view( CharT const * s)
2310  : data_( s )
2311  , size_( Traits::length(s) )
2312  {}
2313 
2314  // Assignment:
2315 
2316 #if nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2317  nssv_constexpr14 basic_string_view & operator=( basic_string_view const & other ) nssv_noexcept = default;
2318 #else
2319  nssv_constexpr14 basic_string_view & operator=( basic_string_view const & other ) nssv_noexcept
2320  {
2321  data_ = other.data_;
2322  size_ = other.size_;
2323  return *this;
2324  }
2325 #endif
2326 
2327  // 24.4.2.2 Iterator support:
2328 
2329  nssv_constexpr const_iterator begin() const nssv_noexcept { return data_; }
2330  nssv_constexpr const_iterator end() const nssv_noexcept { return data_ + size_; }
2331 
2332  nssv_constexpr const_iterator cbegin() const nssv_noexcept { return begin(); }
2333  nssv_constexpr const_iterator cend() const nssv_noexcept { return end(); }
2334 
2335  nssv_constexpr const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const nssv_noexcept { return const_reverse_iterator( end() ); }
2336  nssv_constexpr const_reverse_iterator rend() const nssv_noexcept { return const_reverse_iterator( begin() ); }
2337 
2338  nssv_constexpr const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const nssv_noexcept { return rbegin(); }
2339  nssv_constexpr const_reverse_iterator crend() const nssv_noexcept { return rend(); }
2340 
2341  // 24.4.2.3 Capacity:
2342 
2343  nssv_constexpr size_type size() const nssv_noexcept { return size_; }
2344  nssv_constexpr size_type length() const nssv_noexcept { return size_; }
2345  nssv_constexpr size_type max_size() const nssv_noexcept { return (std::numeric_limits< size_type >::max)(); }
2346 
2347  // since C++20
2348  nssv_nodiscard nssv_constexpr bool empty() const nssv_noexcept
2349  {
2350  return 0 == size_;
2351  }
2352 
2353  // 24.4.2.4 Element access:
2354 
2355  nssv_constexpr const_reference operator[]( size_type pos ) const
2356  {
2357  return data_at( pos );
2358  }
2359 
2360  nssv_constexpr14 const_reference at( size_type pos ) const
2361  {
2362 #if nssv_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
2363  assert( pos < size() );
2364 #else
2365  if ( pos >= size() )
2366  {
2367  throw std::out_of_range("nonst::string_view::at()");
2368  }
2369 #endif
2370  return data_at( pos );
2371  }
2372 
2373  nssv_constexpr const_reference front() const { return data_at( 0 ); }
2374  nssv_constexpr const_reference back() const { return data_at( size() - 1 ); }
2375 
2376  nssv_constexpr const_pointer data() const nssv_noexcept { return data_; }
2377 
2378  // 24.4.2.5 Modifiers:
2379 
2380  nssv_constexpr14 void remove_prefix( size_type n )
2381  {
2382  assert( n <= size() );
2383  data_ += n;
2384  size_ -= n;
2385  }
2386 
2387  nssv_constexpr14 void remove_suffix( size_type n )
2388  {
2389  assert( n <= size() );
2390  size_ -= n;
2391  }
2392 
2393  nssv_constexpr14 void swap( basic_string_view & other ) nssv_noexcept
2394  {
2395  using std::swap;
2396  swap( data_, other.data_ );
2397  swap( size_, other.size_ );
2398  }
2399 
2400  // 24.4.2.6 String operations:
2401 
2402  size_type copy( CharT * dest, size_type n, size_type pos = 0 ) const
2403  {
2404 #if nssv_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
2405  assert( pos <= size() );
2406 #else
2407  if ( pos > size() )
2408  {
2409  throw std::out_of_range("nonst::string_view::copy()");
2410  }
2411 #endif
2412  const size_type rlen = (std::min)( n, size() - pos );
2413 
2414  (void) Traits::copy( dest, data() + pos, rlen );
2415 
2416  return rlen;
2417  }
2418 
2419  nssv_constexpr14 basic_string_view substr( size_type pos = 0, size_type n = npos ) const
2420  {
2421 #if nssv_CONFIG_NO_EXCEPTIONS
2422  assert( pos <= size() );
2423 #else
2424  if ( pos > size() )
2425  {
2426  throw std::out_of_range("nonst::string_view::substr()");
2427  }
2428 #endif
2429  return basic_string_view( data() + pos, (std::min)( n, size() - pos ) );
2430  }
2431 
2432  // compare(), 6x:
2433 
2434  nssv_constexpr14 int compare( basic_string_view other ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2435  {
2436  if ( const int result = Traits::compare( data(), other.data(), (std::min)( size(), other.size() ) ) )
2437  return result;
2438 
2439  return size() == other.size() ? 0 : size() < other.size() ? -1 : 1;
2440  }
2441 
2442  nssv_constexpr int compare( size_type pos1, size_type n1, basic_string_view other ) const // (2)
2443  {
2444  return substr( pos1, n1 ).compare( other );
2445  }
2446 
2447  nssv_constexpr int compare( size_type pos1, size_type n1, basic_string_view other, size_type pos2, size_type n2 ) const // (3)
2448  {
2449  return substr( pos1, n1 ).compare( other.substr( pos2, n2 ) );
2450  }
2451 
2452  nssv_constexpr int compare( CharT const * s ) const // (4)
2453  {
2454  return compare( basic_string_view( s ) );
2455  }
2456 
2457  nssv_constexpr int compare( size_type pos1, size_type n1, CharT const * s ) const // (5)
2458  {
2459  return substr( pos1, n1 ).compare( basic_string_view( s ) );
2460  }
2461 
2462  nssv_constexpr int compare( size_type pos1, size_type n1, CharT const * s, size_type n2 ) const // (6)
2463  {
2464  return substr( pos1, n1 ).compare( basic_string_view( s, n2 ) );
2465  }
2466 
2467  // 24.4.2.7 Searching:
2468 
2469  // starts_with(), 3x, since C++20:
2470 
2471  nssv_constexpr bool starts_with( basic_string_view v ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2472  {
2473  return size() >= v.size() && compare( 0, v.size(), v ) == 0;
2474  }
2475 
2476  nssv_constexpr bool starts_with( CharT c ) const nssv_noexcept // (2)
2477  {
2478  return starts_with( basic_string_view( &c, 1 ) );
2479  }
2480 
2481  nssv_constexpr bool starts_with( CharT const * s ) const // (3)
2482  {
2483  return starts_with( basic_string_view( s ) );
2484  }
2485 
2486  // ends_with(), 3x, since C++20:
2487 
2488  nssv_constexpr bool ends_with( basic_string_view v ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2489  {
2490  return size() >= v.size() && compare( size() - v.size(), npos, v ) == 0;
2491  }
2492 
2493  nssv_constexpr bool ends_with( CharT c ) const nssv_noexcept // (2)
2494  {
2495  return ends_with( basic_string_view( &c, 1 ) );
2496  }
2497 
2498  nssv_constexpr bool ends_with( CharT const * s ) const // (3)
2499  {
2500  return ends_with( basic_string_view( s ) );
2501  }
2502 
2503  // find(), 4x:
2504 
2505  nssv_constexpr14 size_type find( basic_string_view v, size_type pos = 0 ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2506  {
2507  return assert( v.size() == 0 || v.data() != nssv_nullptr )
2508  , pos >= size()
2509  ? npos
2510  : to_pos( std::search( cbegin() + pos, cend(), v.cbegin(), v.cend(), Traits::eq ) );
2511  }
2512 
2513  nssv_constexpr14 size_type find( CharT c, size_type pos = 0 ) const nssv_noexcept // (2)
2514  {
2515  return find( basic_string_view( &c, 1 ), pos );
2516  }
2517 
2518  nssv_constexpr14 size_type find( CharT const * s, size_type pos, size_type n ) const // (3)
2519  {
2520  return find( basic_string_view( s, n ), pos );
2521  }
2522 
2523  nssv_constexpr14 size_type find( CharT const * s, size_type pos = 0 ) const // (4)
2524  {
2525  return find( basic_string_view( s ), pos );
2526  }
2527 
2528  // rfind(), 4x:
2529 
2530  nssv_constexpr14 size_type rfind( basic_string_view v, size_type pos = npos ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2531  {
2532  if ( size() < v.size() )
2533  return npos;
2534 
2535  if ( v.empty() )
2536  return (std::min)( size(), pos );
2537 
2538  const_iterator last = cbegin() + (std::min)( size() - v.size(), pos ) + v.size();
2539  const_iterator result = std::find_end( cbegin(), last, v.cbegin(), v.cend(), Traits::eq );
2540 
2541  return result != last ? size_type( result - cbegin() ) : npos;
2542  }
2543 
2544  nssv_constexpr14 size_type rfind( CharT c, size_type pos = npos ) const nssv_noexcept // (2)
2545  {
2546  return rfind( basic_string_view( &c, 1 ), pos );
2547  }
2548 
2549  nssv_constexpr14 size_type rfind( CharT const * s, size_type pos, size_type n ) const // (3)
2550  {
2551  return rfind( basic_string_view( s, n ), pos );
2552  }
2553 
2554  nssv_constexpr14 size_type rfind( CharT const * s, size_type pos = npos ) const // (4)
2555  {
2556  return rfind( basic_string_view( s ), pos );
2557  }
2558 
2559  // find_first_of(), 4x:
2560 
2561  nssv_constexpr size_type find_first_of( basic_string_view v, size_type pos = 0 ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2562  {
2563  return pos >= size()
2564  ? npos
2565  : to_pos( std::find_first_of( cbegin() + pos, cend(), v.cbegin(), v.cend(), Traits::eq ) );
2566  }
2567 
2568  nssv_constexpr size_type find_first_of( CharT c, size_type pos = 0 ) const nssv_noexcept // (2)
2569  {
2570  return find_first_of( basic_string_view( &c, 1 ), pos );
2571  }
2572 
2573  nssv_constexpr size_type find_first_of( CharT const * s, size_type pos, size_type n ) const // (3)
2574  {
2575  return find_first_of( basic_string_view( s, n ), pos );
2576  }
2577 
2578  nssv_constexpr size_type find_first_of( CharT const * s, size_type pos = 0 ) const // (4)
2579  {
2580  return find_first_of( basic_string_view( s ), pos );
2581  }
2582 
2583  // find_last_of(), 4x:
2584 
2585  nssv_constexpr size_type find_last_of( basic_string_view v, size_type pos = npos ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2586  {
2587  return empty()
2588  ? npos
2589  : pos >= size()
2590  ? find_last_of( v, size() - 1 )
2591  : to_pos( std::find_first_of( const_reverse_iterator( cbegin() + pos + 1 ), crend(), v.cbegin(), v.cend(), Traits::eq ) );
2592  }
2593 
2594  nssv_constexpr size_type find_last_of( CharT c, size_type pos = npos ) const nssv_noexcept // (2)
2595  {
2596  return find_last_of( basic_string_view( &c, 1 ), pos );
2597  }
2598 
2599  nssv_constexpr size_type find_last_of( CharT const * s, size_type pos, size_type count ) const // (3)
2600  {
2601  return find_last_of( basic_string_view( s, count ), pos );
2602  }
2603 
2604  nssv_constexpr size_type find_last_of( CharT const * s, size_type pos = npos ) const // (4)
2605  {
2606  return find_last_of( basic_string_view( s ), pos );
2607  }
2608 
2609  // find_first_not_of(), 4x:
2610 
2611  nssv_constexpr size_type find_first_not_of( basic_string_view v, size_type pos = 0 ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2612  {
2613  return pos >= size()
2614  ? npos
2615  : to_pos( std::find_if( cbegin() + pos, cend(), not_in_view( v ) ) );
2616  }
2617 
2618  nssv_constexpr size_type find_first_not_of( CharT c, size_type pos = 0 ) const nssv_noexcept // (2)
2619  {
2620  return find_first_not_of( basic_string_view( &c, 1 ), pos );
2621  }
2622 
2623  nssv_constexpr size_type find_first_not_of( CharT const * s, size_type pos, size_type count ) const // (3)
2624  {
2625  return find_first_not_of( basic_string_view( s, count ), pos );
2626  }
2627 
2628  nssv_constexpr size_type find_first_not_of( CharT const * s, size_type pos = 0 ) const // (4)
2629  {
2630  return find_first_not_of( basic_string_view( s ), pos );
2631  }
2632 
2633  // find_last_not_of(), 4x:
2634 
2635  nssv_constexpr size_type find_last_not_of( basic_string_view v, size_type pos = npos ) const nssv_noexcept // (1)
2636  {
2637  return empty()
2638  ? npos
2639  : pos >= size()
2640  ? find_last_not_of( v, size() - 1 )
2641  : to_pos( std::find_if( const_reverse_iterator( cbegin() + pos + 1 ), crend(), not_in_view( v ) ) );
2642  }
2643 
2644  nssv_constexpr size_type find_last_not_of( CharT c, size_type pos = npos ) const nssv_noexcept // (2)
2645  {
2646  return find_last_not_of( basic_string_view( &c, 1 ), pos );
2647  }
2648 
2649  nssv_constexpr size_type find_last_not_of( CharT const * s, size_type pos, size_type count ) const // (3)
2650  {
2651  return find_last_not_of( basic_string_view( s, count ), pos );
2652  }
2653 
2654  nssv_constexpr size_type find_last_not_of( CharT const * s, size_type pos = npos ) const // (4)
2655  {
2656  return find_last_not_of( basic_string_view( s ), pos );
2657  }
2658 
2659  // Constants:
2660 
2661 #if nssv_CPP17_OR_GREATER
2662  static nssv_constexpr size_type npos = size_type(-1);
2663 #elif nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2664  enum : size_type { npos = size_type(-1) };
2665 #else
2666  enum { npos = size_type(-1) };
2667 #endif
2668 
2669 private:
2670  struct not_in_view
2671  {
2672  const basic_string_view v;
2673 
2674  nssv_constexpr not_in_view( basic_string_view v ) : v( v ) {}
2675 
2676  nssv_constexpr bool operator()( CharT c ) const
2677  {
2678  return npos == v.find_first_of( c );
2679  }
2680  };
2681 
2682  nssv_constexpr size_type to_pos( const_iterator it ) const
2683  {
2684  return it == cend() ? npos : size_type( it - cbegin() );
2685  }
2686 
2687  nssv_constexpr size_type to_pos( const_reverse_iterator it ) const
2688  {
2689  return it == crend() ? npos : size_type( crend() - it - 1 );
2690  }
2691 
2692  nssv_constexpr const_reference data_at( size_type pos ) const
2693  {
2694 #if nssv_BETWEEN( nssv_COMPILER_GNUC_VERSION, 1, 500 )
2695  return data_[pos];
2696 #else
2697  return assert( pos < size() ), data_[pos];
2698 #endif
2699  }
2700 
2701 private:
2702  const_pointer data_;
2703  size_type size_;
2704 
2705 public:
2706 #if nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_CLASS_METHODS
2707 
2708  template< class Allocator >
2709  basic_string_view( std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator> const & s ) nssv_noexcept
2710  : data_( s.data() )
2711  , size_( s.size() )
2712  {}
2713 
2714 #if nssv_HAVE_EXPLICIT_CONVERSION
2715 
2716  template< class Allocator >
2717  explicit operator std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>() const
2718  {
2719  return to_string( Allocator() );
2720  }
2721 
2722 #endif // nssv_HAVE_EXPLICIT_CONVERSION
2723 
2724 #if nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2725 
2726  template< class Allocator = std::allocator<CharT> >
2727  std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>
2728  to_string( Allocator const & a = Allocator() ) const
2729  {
2730  return std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>( begin(), end(), a );
2731  }
2732 
2733 #else
2734 
2735  std::basic_string<CharT, Traits>
2736  to_string() const
2737  {
2738  return std::basic_string<CharT, Traits>( begin(), end() );
2739  }
2740 
2741  template< class Allocator >
2742  std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>
2743  to_string( Allocator const & a ) const
2744  {
2745  return std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>( begin(), end(), a );
2746  }
2747 
2748 #endif // nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2749 
2750 #endif // nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_CLASS_METHODS
2751 };
2752 
2753 //
2754 // Non-member functions:
2755 //
2756 
2757 // 24.4.3 Non-member comparison functions:
2758 // lexicographically compare two string views (function template):
2759 
2760 template< class CharT, class Traits >
2761 nssv_constexpr bool operator== (
2762  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> lhs,
2763  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2764 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) == 0 ; }
2765 
2766 template< class CharT, class Traits >
2767 nssv_constexpr bool operator!= (
2768  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> lhs,
2769  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2770 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) != 0 ; }
2771 
2772 template< class CharT, class Traits >
2773 nssv_constexpr bool operator< (
2774  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> lhs,
2775  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2776 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) < 0 ; }
2777 
2778 template< class CharT, class Traits >
2779 nssv_constexpr bool operator<= (
2780  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> lhs,
2781  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2782 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) <= 0 ; }
2783 
2784 template< class CharT, class Traits >
2785 nssv_constexpr bool operator> (
2786  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> lhs,
2787  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2788 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) > 0 ; }
2789 
2790 template< class CharT, class Traits >
2791 nssv_constexpr bool operator>= (
2792  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> lhs,
2793  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2794 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) >= 0 ; }
2795 
2796 // Let S be basic_string_view<CharT, Traits>, and sv be an instance of S.
2797 // Implementations shall provide sufficient additional overloads marked
2798 // constexpr and noexcept so that an object t with an implicit conversion
2799 // to S can be compared according to Table 67.
2800 
2801 #if nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER && ! nssv_BETWEEN( nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION, 100, 141 )
2802 
2803 #define nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I(T,U) typename std::decay< basic_string_view<T,U> >::type
2804 
2805 #if nssv_BETWEEN( nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION, 140, 150 )
2806 # define nssv_MSVC_ORDER(x) , int=x
2807 #else
2808 # define nssv_MSVC_ORDER(x) /*, int=x*/
2809 #endif
2810 
2811 // ==
2812 
2813 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(1) >
2814 nssv_constexpr bool operator==(
2815  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> lhs,
2816  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I(CharT, Traits) rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2817 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) == 0; }
2818 
2819 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(2) >
2820 nssv_constexpr bool operator==(
2821  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I(CharT, Traits) lhs,
2822  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2823 { return lhs.size() == rhs.size() && lhs.compare( rhs ) == 0; }
2824 
2825 // !=
2826 
2827 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(1) >
2828 nssv_constexpr bool operator!= (
2829  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > lhs,
2830  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2831 { return lhs.size() != rhs.size() || lhs.compare( rhs ) != 0 ; }
2832 
2833 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(2) >
2834 nssv_constexpr bool operator!= (
2835  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) lhs,
2836  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2837 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) != 0 ; }
2838 
2839 // <
2840 
2841 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(1) >
2842 nssv_constexpr bool operator< (
2843  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > lhs,
2844  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2845 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) < 0 ; }
2846 
2847 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(2) >
2848 nssv_constexpr bool operator< (
2849  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) lhs,
2850  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2851 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) < 0 ; }
2852 
2853 // <=
2854 
2855 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(1) >
2856 nssv_constexpr bool operator<= (
2857  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > lhs,
2858  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2859 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) <= 0 ; }
2860 
2861 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(2) >
2862 nssv_constexpr bool operator<= (
2863  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) lhs,
2864  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2865 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) <= 0 ; }
2866 
2867 // >
2868 
2869 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(1) >
2870 nssv_constexpr bool operator> (
2871  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > lhs,
2872  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2873 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) > 0 ; }
2874 
2875 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(2) >
2876 nssv_constexpr bool operator> (
2877  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) lhs,
2878  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2879 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) > 0 ; }
2880 
2881 // >=
2882 
2883 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(1) >
2884 nssv_constexpr bool operator>= (
2885  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > lhs,
2886  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2887 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) >= 0 ; }
2888 
2889 template< class CharT, class Traits nssv_MSVC_ORDER(2) >
2890 nssv_constexpr bool operator>= (
2891  nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I( CharT, Traits ) lhs,
2892  basic_string_view < CharT, Traits > rhs ) nssv_noexcept
2893 { return lhs.compare( rhs ) >= 0 ; }
2894 
2895 #undef nssv_MSVC_ORDER
2896 #undef nssv_BASIC_STRING_VIEW_I
2897 
2898 #endif // nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
2899 
2900 // 24.4.4 Inserters and extractors:
2901 
2902 namespace detail {
2903 
2904 template< class Stream >
2905 void write_padding( Stream & os, std::streamsize n )
2906 {
2907  for ( std::streamsize i = 0; i < n; ++i )
2908  os.rdbuf()->sputc( os.fill() );
2909 }
2910 
2911 template< class Stream, class View >
2912 Stream & write_to_stream( Stream & os, View const & sv )
2913 {
2914  typename Stream::sentry sentry( os );
2915 
2916  if ( !os )
2917  return os;
2918 
2919  const std::streamsize length = static_cast<std::streamsize>( sv.length() );
2920 
2921  // Whether, and how, to pad:
2922  const bool pad = ( length < os.width() );
2923  const bool left_pad = pad && ( os.flags() & std::ios_base::adjustfield ) == std::ios_base::right;
2924 
2925  if ( left_pad )
2926  write_padding( os, os.width() - length );
2927 
2928  // Write span characters:
2929  os.rdbuf()->sputn( sv.begin(), length );
2930 
2931  if ( pad && !left_pad )
2932  write_padding( os, os.width() - length );
2933 
2934  // Reset output stream width:
2935  os.width( 0 );
2936 
2937  return os;
2938 }
2939 
2940 } // namespace detail
2941 
2942 template< class CharT, class Traits >
2943 std::basic_ostream<CharT, Traits> &
2944 operator<<(
2945  std::basic_ostream<CharT, Traits>& os,
2946  basic_string_view <CharT, Traits> sv )
2947 {
2948  return detail::write_to_stream( os, sv );
2949 }
2950 
2951 // Several typedefs for common character types are provided:
2952 
2953 typedef basic_string_view<char> string_view;
2954 typedef basic_string_view<wchar_t> wstring_view;
2955 #if nssv_HAVE_WCHAR16_T
2956 typedef basic_string_view<char16_t> u16string_view;
2957 typedef basic_string_view<char32_t> u32string_view;
2958 #endif
2959 
2960 }} // namespace nonstd::sv_lite
2961 
2962 //
2963 // 24.4.6 Suffix for basic_string_view literals:
2964 //
2965 
2966 #if nssv_HAVE_USER_DEFINED_LITERALS
2967 
2968 namespace nonstd {
2969 nssv_inline_ns namespace literals {
2970 nssv_inline_ns namespace string_view_literals {
2971 
2972 #if nssv_CONFIG_STD_SV_OPERATOR && nssv_HAVE_STD_DEFINED_LITERALS
2973 
2974 nssv_constexpr nonstd::sv_lite::string_view operator "" sv( const char* str, size_t len ) nssv_noexcept // (1)
2975 {
2976  return nonstd::sv_lite::string_view{ str, len };
2977 }
2978 
2979 nssv_constexpr nonstd::sv_lite::u16string_view operator "" sv( const char16_t* str, size_t len ) nssv_noexcept // (2)
2980 {
2981  return nonstd::sv_lite::u16string_view{ str, len };
2982 }
2983 
2984 nssv_constexpr nonstd::sv_lite::u32string_view operator "" sv( const char32_t* str, size_t len ) nssv_noexcept // (3)
2985 {
2986  return nonstd::sv_lite::u32string_view{ str, len };
2987 }
2988 
2989 nssv_constexpr nonstd::sv_lite::wstring_view operator "" sv( const wchar_t* str, size_t len ) nssv_noexcept // (4)
2990 {
2991  return nonstd::sv_lite::wstring_view{ str, len };
2992 }
2993 
2994 #endif // nssv_CONFIG_STD_SV_OPERATOR && nssv_HAVE_STD_DEFINED_LITERALS
2995 
2996 #if nssv_CONFIG_USR_SV_OPERATOR
2997 
2998 nssv_constexpr nonstd::sv_lite::string_view operator "" _sv( const char* str, size_t len ) nssv_noexcept // (1)
2999 {
3000  return nonstd::sv_lite::string_view{ str, len };
3001 }
3002 
3003 nssv_constexpr nonstd::sv_lite::u16string_view operator "" _sv( const char16_t* str, size_t len ) nssv_noexcept // (2)
3004 {
3005  return nonstd::sv_lite::u16string_view{ str, len };
3006 }
3007 
3008 nssv_constexpr nonstd::sv_lite::u32string_view operator "" _sv( const char32_t* str, size_t len ) nssv_noexcept // (3)
3009 {
3010  return nonstd::sv_lite::u32string_view{ str, len };
3011 }
3012 
3013 nssv_constexpr nonstd::sv_lite::wstring_view operator "" _sv( const wchar_t* str, size_t len ) nssv_noexcept // (4)
3014 {
3015  return nonstd::sv_lite::wstring_view{ str, len };
3016 }
3017 
3018 #endif // nssv_CONFIG_USR_SV_OPERATOR
3019 
3020 }}} // namespace nonstd::literals::string_view_literals
3021 
3022 #endif
3023 
3024 //
3025 // Extensions for std::string:
3026 //
3027 
3028 #if nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_FREE_FUNCTIONS
3029 
3030 namespace nonstd {
3031 namespace sv_lite {
3032 
3033 // Exclude MSVC 14 (19.00): it yields ambiguous to_string():
3034 
3035 #if nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER && nssv_COMPILER_MSVC_VERSION != 140
3036 
3037 template< class CharT, class Traits, class Allocator = std::allocator<CharT> >
3038 std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>
3039 to_string( basic_string_view<CharT, Traits> v, Allocator const & a = Allocator() )
3040 {
3041  return std::basic_string<CharT,Traits, Allocator>( v.begin(), v.end(), a );
3042 }
3043 
3044 #else
3045 
3046 template< class CharT, class Traits >
3047 std::basic_string<CharT, Traits>
3048 to_string( basic_string_view<CharT, Traits> v )
3049 {
3050  return std::basic_string<CharT, Traits>( v.begin(), v.end() );
3051 }
3052 
3053 template< class CharT, class Traits, class Allocator >
3054 std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>
3055 to_string( basic_string_view<CharT, Traits> v, Allocator const & a )
3056 {
3057  return std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator>( v.begin(), v.end(), a );
3058 }
3059 
3060 #endif // nssv_CPP11_OR_GREATER
3061 
3062 template< class CharT, class Traits, class Allocator >
3063 basic_string_view<CharT, Traits>
3064 to_string_view( std::basic_string<CharT, Traits, Allocator> const & s )
3065 {
3066  return basic_string_view<CharT, Traits>( s.data(), s.size() );
3067 }
3068 
3069 }} // namespace nonstd::sv_lite
3070 
3071 #endif // nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_FREE_FUNCTIONS
3072 
3073 //
3074 // make types and algorithms available in namespace nonstd:
3075 //
3076 
3077 namespace nonstd {
3078 
3079 using sv_lite::basic_string_view;
3080 using sv_lite::string_view;
3081 using sv_lite::wstring_view;
3082 
3083 #if nssv_HAVE_WCHAR16_T
3084 using sv_lite::u16string_view;
3085 #endif
3086 #if nssv_HAVE_WCHAR32_T
3087 using sv_lite::u32string_view;
3088 #endif
3089 
3090 // literal "sv"
3091 
3092 using sv_lite::operator==;
3093 using sv_lite::operator!=;
3094 using sv_lite::operator<;
3095 using sv_lite::operator<=;
3096 using sv_lite::operator>;
3097 using sv_lite::operator>=;
3098 
3099 using sv_lite::operator<<;
3100 
3101 #if nssv_CONFIG_CONVERSION_STD_STRING_FREE_FUNCTIONS
3102 using sv_lite::to_string;
3103 using sv_lite::to_string_view;
3104 #endif
3105 
3106 } // namespace nonstd
3107 
3108 // 24.4.5 Hash support (C++11):
3109 
3110 // Note: The hash value of a string view object is equal to the hash value of
3111 // the corresponding string object.
3112 
3113 #if nssv_HAVE_STD_HASH
3114 
3115 #include <functional>
3116 
3117 namespace std {
3118 
3119 template<>
3120 struct hash< nonstd::string_view >
3121 {
3122 public:
3123  std::size_t operator()( nonstd::string_view v ) const nssv_noexcept
3124  {
3125  return std::hash<std::string>()( std::string( v.data(), v.size() ) );
3126  }
3127 };
3128 
3129 template<>
3130 struct hash< nonstd::wstring_view >
3131 {
3132 public:
3133  std::size_t operator()( nonstd::wstring_view v ) const nssv_noexcept
3134  {
3135  return std::hash<std::wstring>()( std::wstring( v.data(), v.size() ) );
3136  }
3137 };
3138 
3139 template<>
3140 struct hash< nonstd::u16string_view >
3141 {
3142 public:
3143  std::size_t operator()( nonstd::u16string_view v ) const nssv_noexcept
3144  {
3145  return std::hash<std::u16string>()( std::u16string( v.data(), v.size() ) );
3146  }
3147 };
3148 
3149 template<>
3150 struct hash< nonstd::u32string_view >
3151 {
3152 public:
3153  std::size_t operator()( nonstd::u32string_view v ) const nssv_noexcept
3154  {
3155  return std::hash<std::u32string>()( std::u32string( v.data(), v.size() ) );
3156  }
3157 };
3158 
3159 } // namespace std
3160 
3161 #endif // nssv_HAVE_STD_HASH
3162 
3163 nssv_RESTORE_WARNINGS()
3164 
3165 #endif // nssv_HAVE_STD_STRING_VIEW
3166 #endif // NONSTD_SV_LITE_H_INCLUDED
3167 
3168 
3169  // If there is another version of Hedley, then the newer one
3170  // takes precedence.
3171  // See: https://github.com/nemequ/hedley
3172 /* Hedley - https://nemequ.github.io/hedley
3173  * Created by Evan Nemerson <evan@nemerson.com>
3174  *
3175  * To the extent possible under law, the author(s) have dedicated all
3176  * copyright and related and neighboring rights to this software to
3177  * the public domain worldwide. This software is distributed without
3178  * any warranty.
3179  *
3180  * For details, see <http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/>.
3181  * SPDX-License-Identifier: CC0-1.0
3182  */
3183 
3184 #if !defined(HEDLEY_VERSION) || (HEDLEY_VERSION < 9)
3185 #if defined(HEDLEY_VERSION)
3186 # undef HEDLEY_VERSION
3187 #endif
3188 #define HEDLEY_VERSION 9
3189 
3190 #if defined(HEDLEY_STRINGIFY_EX)
3191 # undef HEDLEY_STRINGIFY_EX
3192 #endif
3193 #define HEDLEY_STRINGIFY_EX(x) #x
3194 
3195 #if defined(HEDLEY_STRINGIFY)
3196 # undef HEDLEY_STRINGIFY
3197 #endif
3198 #define HEDLEY_STRINGIFY(x) HEDLEY_STRINGIFY_EX(x)
3199 
3200 #if defined(HEDLEY_CONCAT_EX)
3201 # undef HEDLEY_CONCAT_EX
3202 #endif
3203 #define HEDLEY_CONCAT_EX(a,b) a##b
3204 
3205 #if defined(HEDLEY_CONCAT)
3206 # undef HEDLEY_CONCAT
3207 #endif
3208 #define HEDLEY_CONCAT(a,b) HEDLEY_CONCAT_EX(a,b)
3209 
3210 #if defined(HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE)
3211 # undef HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE
3212 #endif
3213 #define HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(major,minor,revision) (((major) * 1000000) + ((minor) * 1000) + (revision))
3214 
3215 #if defined(HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_MAJOR)
3216 # undef HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_MAJOR
3217 #endif
3218 #define HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_MAJOR(version) ((version) / 1000000)
3219 
3220 #if defined(HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_MINOR)
3221 # undef HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_MINOR
3222 #endif
3223 #define HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_MINOR(version) (((version) % 1000000) / 1000)
3224 
3225 #if defined(HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_REVISION)
3226 # undef HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_REVISION
3227 #endif
3228 #define HEDLEY_VERSION_DECODE_REVISION(version) ((version) % 1000)
3229 
3230 #if defined(HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION)
3231 # undef HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION
3232 #endif
3233 #if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)
3234 # define HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(__GNUC__, __GNUC_MINOR__, __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)
3235 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
3236 # define HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(__GNUC__, __GNUC_MINOR__, 0)
3237 #endif
3238 
3239 #if defined(HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION_CHECK)
3240 # undef HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION_CHECK
3241 #endif
3242 #if defined(HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION)
3243 # define HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION >= HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(major, minor, patch))
3244 #else
3245 # define HEDLEY_GNUC_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (0)
3246 #endif
3247 
3248 #if defined(HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION)
3249 # undef HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION
3250 #endif
3251 #if defined(_MSC_FULL_VER) && (_MSC_FULL_VER >= 140000000)
3252 # define HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(_MSC_FULL_VER / 10000000, (_MSC_FULL_VER % 10000000) / 100000, (_MSC_FULL_VER % 100000) / 100)
3253 #elif defined(_MSC_FULL_VER)
3254 # define HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(_MSC_FULL_VER / 1000000, (_MSC_FULL_VER % 1000000) / 10000, (_MSC_FULL_VER % 10000) / 10)
3255 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
3256 # define HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(_MSC_VER / 100, _MSC_VER % 100, 0)
3257 #endif
3258 
3259 #if defined(HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK)
3260 # undef HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK
3261 #endif
3262 #if !defined(_MSC_VER)
3263 # define HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (0)
3264 #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1400)
3265 # define HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (_MSC_FULL_VER >= ((major * 10000000) + (minor * 100000) + (patch)))
3266 #elif defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1200)
3267 # define HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (_MSC_FULL_VER >= ((major * 1000000) + (minor * 10000) + (patch)))
3268 #else
3269 # define HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (_MSC_VER >= ((major * 100) + (minor)))
3270 #endif
3271 
3272 #if defined(HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION)
3273 # undef HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION
3274 #endif
3275 #if defined(__INTEL_COMPILER) && defined(__INTEL_COMPILER_UPDATE)
3276 # define HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(__INTEL_COMPILER / 100, __INTEL_COMPILER % 100, __INTEL_COMPILER_UPDATE)
3277 #elif defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
3278 # define HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(__INTEL_COMPILER / 100, __INTEL_COMPILER % 100, 0)
3279 #endif
3280 
3281 #if defined(HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK)
3282 # undef HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK
3283 #endif
3284 #if defined(HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION)
3285 # define HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION >= HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(major, minor, patch))
3286 #else
3287 # define HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (0)
3288 #endif
3289 
3290 #if defined(HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION)
3291 # undef HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION
3292 #endif
3293 #if defined(__PGI) && defined(__PGIC__) && defined(__PGIC_MINOR__) && defined(__PGIC_PATCHLEVEL__)
3294 # define HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(__PGIC__, __PGIC_MINOR__, __PGIC_PATCHLEVEL__)
3295 #endif
3296 
3297 #if defined(HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK)
3298 # undef HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK
3299 #endif
3300 #if defined(HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION)
3301 # define HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION >= HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(major, minor, patch))
3302 #else
3303 # define HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (0)
3304 #endif
3305 
3306 #if defined(HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION)
3307 # undef HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION
3308 #endif
3309 #if defined(__SUNPRO_C) && (__SUNPRO_C > 0x1000)
3310 # define HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE((((__SUNPRO_C >> 16) & 0xf) * 10) + ((__SUNPRO_C >> 12) & 0xf), (((__SUNPRO_C >> 8) & 0xf) * 10) + ((__SUNPRO_C >> 4) & 0xf), (__SUNPRO_C & 0xf) * 10)
3311 #elif defined(__SUNPRO_C)
3312 # define HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE((__SUNPRO_C >> 8) & 0xf, (__SUNPRO_C >> 4) & 0xf, (__SUNPRO_C) & 0xf)
3313 #elif defined(__SUNPRO_CC) && (__SUNPRO_CC > 0x1000)
3314 # define HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE((((__SUNPRO_CC >> 16) & 0xf) * 10) + ((__SUNPRO_CC >> 12) & 0xf), (((__SUNPRO_CC >> 8) & 0xf) * 10) + ((__SUNPRO_CC >> 4) & 0xf), (__SUNPRO_CC & 0xf) * 10)
3315 #elif defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
3316 # define HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE((__SUNPRO_CC >> 8) & 0xf, (__SUNPRO_CC >> 4) & 0xf, (__SUNPRO_CC) & 0xf)
3317 #endif
3318

3321 #endif
3322 #if defined(HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION)

3324 #else

3326 #endif

3333 #endif

3351 #endif

3369 #elif defined(__xlC__)

3380 #endif

3387 #endif

3390 # undef HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK
3391 #endif
3392 #if defined(HEDLEY_TI_VERSION)
3393 # define HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION >= HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(major, minor, patch))
3394 #else
3395 # define HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (0)
3396 #endif
3397 
3398 #if defined(HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION)
3399 # undef HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION
3400 #endif
3401 #if defined(_CRAYC)
3402 # if defined(_RELEASE_PATCHLEVEL)
3403 # define HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(_RELEASE_MAJOR, _RELEASE_MINOR, _RELEASE_PATCHLEVEL)
3404 # else
3405 # define HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(_RELEASE_MAJOR, _RELEASE_MINOR, 0)
3406 # endif
3407 #endif
3408 
3409 #if defined(HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION_CHECK)
3410 # undef HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION_CHECK
3411 #endif
3412 #if defined(HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION)
3413 # define HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION >= HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(major, minor, patch))
3414 #else
3415 # define HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (0)
3416 #endif
3417 
3418 #if defined(HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION)
3419 # undef HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION
3420 #endif
3421 #if defined(__IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__)
3422 # if __VER__ > 1000
3423 # define HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE((__VER__ / 1000000), ((__VER__ / 1000) % 1000), (__VER__ % 1000))
3424 # else
3425 # define HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION HEDLEY_VERSION_ENCODE(VER / 100, __VER__ % 100, 0)
3426 # endif
3427 #endif
3428 
3429 #if defined(HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK)
3430 # undef HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK
3431 #endif

3434 #else
3435 # define HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) (0)
3436 #endif

3440 #endif

3443 #endif

3713 
3714 #if \
3715  (defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L)) || \
3716  defined(__clang__) || \
3717  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,0,0) || \
3718  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
3719  HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
3720  HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(18,4,0) || \
3721  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \
3722  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(6,0,0) || \
3723  HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION_CHECK(5,0,0) || \
3724  HEDLEY_TINYC_VERSION_CHECK(0,9,17) || \
3725  HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
3726  (HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(10,1,0) && defined(__C99_PRAGMA_OPERATOR))
3727 # define HEDLEY_PRAGMA(value) _Pragma(#value)
3728 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(15,0,0)
3729 # define HEDLEY_PRAGMA(value) __pragma(value)
3730 #else
3731 # define HEDLEY_PRAGMA(value)
3732 #endif
3733 
3734 #if defined(HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH)
3735 # undef HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH
3736 #endif
3737 #if defined(HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP)
3738 # undef HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP
3739 #endif
3740 #if defined(__clang__)
3741 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH _Pragma("clang diagnostic push")
3742 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP _Pragma("clang diagnostic pop")
3743 #elif HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
3744 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH _Pragma("warning(push)")
3745 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP _Pragma("warning(pop)")
3746 #elif HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,6,0)
3747 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH _Pragma("GCC diagnostic push")
3748 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP _Pragma("GCC diagnostic pop")
3749 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(15,0,0)
3750 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH __pragma(warning(push))
3751 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP __pragma(warning(pop))
3752 #elif HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(5,6,0)
3753 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH _Pragma("push")
3754 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP _Pragma("pop")
3755 #elif HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,1,0)
3756 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH _Pragma("diag_push")
3757 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP _Pragma("diag_pop")
3758 #elif HEDLEY_PELLES_VERSION_CHECK(2,90,0)
3759 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH _Pragma("warning(push)")
3760 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP _Pragma("warning(pop)")
3761 #else
3762 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH
3763 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP
3764 #endif
3765 
3766 #if defined(HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED)
3767 # undef HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED
3768 #endif
3769 #if HEDLEY_HAS_WARNING("-Wdeprecated-declarations")
3770 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wdeprecated-declarations\"")
3771 #elif HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
3772 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("warning(disable:1478 1786)")
3773 #elif HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(17,10,0)
3774 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("diag_suppress 1215,1444")
3775 #elif HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,3,0)
3776 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wdeprecated-declarations\"")
3777 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(15,0,0)
3778 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED __pragma(warning(disable:4996))
3779 #elif HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
3780 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("diag_suppress 1291,1718")
3781 #elif HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,13,0) && !defined(__cplusplus)
3782 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("error_messages(off,E_DEPRECATED_ATT,E_DEPRECATED_ATT_MESS)")
3783 #elif HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,13,0) && defined(__cplusplus)
3784 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("error_messages(off,symdeprecated,symdeprecated2)")
3785 #elif HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
3786 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("diag_suppress=Pe1444,Pe1215")
3787 #elif HEDLEY_PELLES_VERSION_CHECK(2,90,0)
3788 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED _Pragma("warn(disable:2241)")
3789 #else
3790 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_DEPRECATED
3791 #endif
3792 
3793 #if defined(HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS)
3794 # undef HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS
3795 #endif
3796 #if HEDLEY_HAS_WARNING("-Wunknown-pragmas")
3797 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS _Pragma("clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wunknown-pragmas\"")
3798 #elif HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
3799 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS _Pragma("warning(disable:161)")
3800 #elif HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(17,10,0)
3801 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS _Pragma("diag_suppress 1675")
3802 #elif HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,3,0)
3803 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS _Pragma("GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wunknown-pragmas\"")
3804 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(15,0,0)
3805 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS __pragma(warning(disable:4068))
3806 #elif HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
3807 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS _Pragma("diag_suppress 163")
3808 #elif HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
3809 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS _Pragma("diag_suppress=Pe161")
3810 #else
3811 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS
3812 #endif
3813 
3814 #if defined(HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_CAST_QUAL)
3815 # undef HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_CAST_QUAL
3816 #endif
3817 #if HEDLEY_HAS_WARNING("-Wcast-qual")
3818 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_CAST_QUAL _Pragma("clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wcast-qual\"")
3819 #elif HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
3820 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_CAST_QUAL _Pragma("warning(disable:2203 2331)")
3821 #elif HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,0,0)
3822 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_CAST_QUAL _Pragma("GCC diagnostic ignored \"-Wcast-qual\"")
3823 #else
3824 # define HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_CAST_QUAL
3825 #endif
3826 
3827 #if defined(HEDLEY_DEPRECATED)
3828 # undef HEDLEY_DEPRECATED
3829 #endif
3830 #if defined(HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR)
3831 # undef HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR
3832 #endif
3833 #if defined(__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 201402L)
3834 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED(since) [[deprecated("Since " #since)]]
3835 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR(since, replacement) [[deprecated("Since " #since "; use " #replacement)]]
3836 #elif \
3837  HEDLEY_HAS_EXTENSION(attribute_deprecated_with_message) || \
3838  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,5,0) || \
3839  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
3840  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(5,6,0) || \
3841  HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,13,0) || \
3842  HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(17,10,0) || \
3843  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,3,0)
3844 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED(since) __attribute__((__deprecated__("Since " #since)))
3845 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR(since, replacement) __attribute__((__deprecated__("Since " #since "; use " #replacement)))
3846 #elif \
3847  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(deprecated) || \
3848  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,1,0) || \
3849  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \
3850  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
3851  (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(7,3,0) && defined(__TI_GNU_ATTRIBUTE_SUPPORT__))
3852 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED(since) __attribute__((__deprecated__))
3853 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR(since, replacement) __attribute__((__deprecated__))
3854 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(14,0,0)
3855 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED(since) __declspec(deprecated("Since " # since))
3856 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR(since, replacement) __declspec(deprecated("Since " #since "; use " #replacement))
3857 #elif \
3858  HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(13,10,0) || \
3859  HEDLEY_PELLES_VERSION_CHECK(6,50,0)
3860 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED(since) _declspec(deprecated)
3861 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR(since, replacement) __declspec(deprecated)
3862 #elif HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
3863 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED(since) _Pragma("deprecated")
3864 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR(since, replacement) _Pragma("deprecated")
3865 #else
3866 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED(since)
3867 # define HEDLEY_DEPRECATED_FOR(since, replacement)
3868 #endif
3869

3871 # undef HEDLEY_UNAVAILABLE
3872 #endif

3875  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,3,0) || \
3876  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
3877 # define HEDLEY_UNAVAILABLE(available_since) __attribute__((__warning__("Not available until " #available_since)))
3878 #else
3879 # define HEDLEY_UNAVAILABLE(available_since)
3880 #endif

3887 #elif \
3888  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(warn_unused_result) || \
3889  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,4,0) || \
3890  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
3891  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
3892  (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(7,3,0) && defined(__TI_GNU_ATTRIBUTE_SUPPORT__)) || \
3893  (HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,15,0) && defined(__cplusplus)) || \
3894  HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(17,10,0)

3915 #if defined(HEDLEY_NO_RETURN)
3916 # undef HEDLEY_NO_RETURN
3917 #endif
3918 #if HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
3919 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN __noreturn
3920 #elif HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
3921 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN __attribute__((__noreturn__))
3922 #elif defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && __STDC_VERSION__ >= 201112L
3923 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN _Noreturn
3924 #elif defined(__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 201103L)
3925 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN [[noreturn]]
3926 #elif \
3927  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(noreturn) || \
3928  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,2,0) || \
3929  HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,11,0) || \
3930  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \
3931  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(10,1,0) || \
3932  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(18,0,0) || \
3933  (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(17,3,0) && defined(__TI_GNU_ATTRIBUTE_SUPPORT__))
3934 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN __attribute__((__noreturn__))
3935 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(13,10,0)
3936 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN __declspec(noreturn)
3937 #elif HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(6,0,0) && defined(__cplusplus)
3938 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN _Pragma("FUNC_NEVER_RETURNS;")
3939 #elif HEDLEY_COMPCERT_VERSION_CHECK(3,2,0)
3940 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN __attribute((noreturn))
3941 #elif HEDLEY_PELLES_VERSION_CHECK(9,0,0)
3942 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN __declspec(noreturn)
3943 #else
3944 # define HEDLEY_NO_RETURN
3945 #endif

3947 #if defined(HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE)
3948 # undef HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE
3949 #endif
3950 #if defined(HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE_RETURN)
3951 # undef HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE_RETURN
3952 #endif
3953 #if \
3954  (HEDLEY_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_unreachable) && (!defined(HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION))) || \
3955  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,5,0) || \
3956  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
3957  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(13,1,5)
3958 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE() __builtin_unreachable()
3959 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(13,10,0)
3960 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE() __assume(0)
3961 #elif HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(6,0,0)
3962 # if defined(__cplusplus)
3963 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE() std::_nassert(0)
3964 # else
3965 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE() _nassert(0)
3966 # endif
3967 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE_RETURN(value) return value
3968 #elif defined(EXIT_FAILURE)
3969 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE() abort()
3970 #else
3971 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE()
3972 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE_RETURN(value) return value
3973 #endif
3974 #if !defined(HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE_RETURN)
3975 # define HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE_RETURN(value) HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE()
3976 #endif

3978 #if defined(HEDLEY_ASSUME)
3979 # undef HEDLEY_ASSUME
3980 #endif
3981 #if \
3982  HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(13,10,0) || \
3983  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
3984 # define HEDLEY_ASSUME(expr) __assume(expr)
3985 #elif HEDLEY_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_assume)
3986 # define HEDLEY_ASSUME(expr) __builtin_assume(expr)
3987 #elif HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(6,0,0)
3988 # if defined(__cplusplus)
3989 # define HEDLEY_ASSUME(expr) std::_nassert(expr)
3990 # else
3991 # define HEDLEY_ASSUME(expr) _nassert(expr)
3992 # endif
3993 #elif \
3994  (HEDLEY_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_unreachable) && !defined(HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION)) || \
3995  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,5,0) || \
3996  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
3997  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(13,1,5)
3998 # define HEDLEY_ASSUME(expr) ((void) ((expr) ? 1 : (__builtin_unreachable(), 1)))
3999 #else
4000 # define HEDLEY_ASSUME(expr) ((void) (expr))
4001 #endif

4004 HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH
4005 #if \

4008 # if defined(__clang__)
4009 # pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wvariadic-macros"
4010 # elif defined(HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION)
4011 # pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wvariadic-macros"
4012 # endif
4013 #endif

4028 #if defined(HEDLEY_PRINTF_FORMAT)
4029 # undef HEDLEY_PRINTF_FORMAT
4030 #endif
4031 #if defined(__MINGW32__) && HEDLEY_GCC_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(format,4,4,0) && !defined(__USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO)
4032 # define HEDLEY_PRINTF_FORMAT(string_idx,first_to_check) __attribute__((__format__(ms_printf, string_idx, first_to_check)))
4033 #elif defined(__MINGW32__) && HEDLEY_GCC_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(format,4,4,0) && defined(__USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO)
4034 # define HEDLEY_PRINTF_FORMAT(string_idx,first_to_check) __attribute__((__format__(gnu_printf, string_idx, first_to_check)))
4035 #elif \
4036  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(format) || \
4037  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,1,0) || \
4038  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
4039  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(5,6,0) || \
4040  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(10,1,0) || \
4041  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
4042  (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(7,3,0) && defined(__TI_GNU_ATTRIBUTE_SUPPORT__))
4043 # define HEDLEY_PRINTF_FORMAT(string_idx,first_to_check) __attribute__((__format__(__printf__, string_idx, first_to_check)))
4044 #elif HEDLEY_PELLES_VERSION_CHECK(6,0,0)
4045 # define HEDLEY_PRINTF_FORMAT(string_idx,first_to_check) __declspec(vaformat(printf,string_idx,first_to_check))
4046 #else
4047 # define HEDLEY_PRINTF_FORMAT(string_idx,first_to_check)
4048 #endif

4062 #if defined(HEDLEY_PREDICT)
4063 # undef HEDLEY_PREDICT
4064 #endif
4065 #if defined(HEDLEY_LIKELY)
4066 # undef HEDLEY_LIKELY
4067 #endif
4068 #if defined(HEDLEY_UNLIKELY)
4069 # undef HEDLEY_UNLIKELY
4070 #endif
4071 #if defined(HEDLEY_UNPREDICTABLE)
4072 # undef HEDLEY_UNPREDICTABLE
4073 #endif
4074 #if HEDLEY_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_unpredictable)
4075 # define HEDLEY_UNPREDICTABLE(expr) __builtin_unpredictable(!!(expr))
4076 #endif
4077 #if \
4078  HEDLEY_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_expect_with_probability) || \
4079  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(9,0,0)
4080 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT(expr, value, probability) __builtin_expect_with_probability(expr, value, probability)
4081 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT_TRUE(expr, probability) __builtin_expect_with_probability(!!(expr), 1, probability)
4082 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT_FALSE(expr, probability) __builtin_expect_with_probability(!!(expr), 0, probability)
4083 # define HEDLEY_LIKELY(expr) __builtin_expect(!!(expr), 1)
4084 # define HEDLEY_UNLIKELY(expr) __builtin_expect(!!(expr), 0)
4085 # if !defined(HEDLEY_BUILTIN_UNPREDICTABLE)
4086 # define HEDLEY_BUILTIN_UNPREDICTABLE(expr) __builtin_expect_with_probability(!!(expr), 1, 0.5)
4087 # endif
4088 #elif \
4089  HEDLEY_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_expect) || \
4090  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,0,0) || \
4091  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
4092  (HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,15,0) && defined(__cplusplus)) || \
4093  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \
4094  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(10,1,0) || \
4095  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(6,1,0) || \
4096  HEDLEY_TINYC_VERSION_CHECK(0,9,27)
4097 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT(expr, expected, probability) \
4098  (((probability) >= 0.9) ? __builtin_expect(!!(expr), (expected)) : (((void) (expected)), !!(expr)))
4099 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT_TRUE(expr, probability) \
4100  (__extension__ ({ \
4101  HEDLEY_CONSTEXPR double hedley_probability_ = (probability); \
4102  ((hedley_probability_ >= 0.9) ? __builtin_expect(!!(expr), 1) : ((hedley_probability_ <= 0.1) ? __builtin_expect(!!(expr), 0) : !!(expr))); \
4103  }))
4104 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT_FALSE(expr, probability) \
4105  (__extension__ ({ \
4106  HEDLEY_CONSTEXPR double hedley_probability_ = (probability); \
4107  ((hedley_probability_ >= 0.9) ? __builtin_expect(!!(expr), 0) : ((hedley_probability_ <= 0.1) ? __builtin_expect(!!(expr), 1) : !!(expr))); \
4108  }))
4109 # define HEDLEY_LIKELY(expr) __builtin_expect(!!(expr), 1)
4110 # define HEDLEY_UNLIKELY(expr) __builtin_expect(!!(expr), 0)
4111 #else
4112 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT(expr, expected, probability) (((void) (expected)), !!(expr))
4113 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT_TRUE(expr, probability) (!!(expr))
4114 # define HEDLEY_PREDICT_FALSE(expr, probability) (!!(expr))
4115 # define HEDLEY_LIKELY(expr) (!!(expr))
4116 # define HEDLEY_UNLIKELY(expr) (!!(expr))
4117 #endif
4118 #if !defined(HEDLEY_UNPREDICTABLE)
4119 # define HEDLEY_UNPREDICTABLE(expr) HEDLEY_PREDICT(expr, 1, 0.5)
4120 #endif

4132  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
4133  (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(7,3,0) && defined(__TI_GNU_ATTRIBUTE_SUPPORT__))

4184 #elif \

4186  HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(14,0,0) || \

4188  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \

4209 #elif \

4213 #elif \

4222 #if defined(HEDLEY_ALWAYS_INLINE)

4224 #endif
4225 #if \
4226  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(always_inline) || \
4227  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,0,0) || \
4228  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
4229  HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,11,0) || \
4230  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \
4231  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(10,1,0) || \
4232  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
4233  (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(7,3,0) && defined(__TI_GNU_ATTRIBUTE_SUPPORT__))
4234 # define HEDLEY_ALWAYS_INLINE __attribute__((__always_inline__)) HEDLEY_INLINE
4235 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(12,0,0)
4236 # define HEDLEY_ALWAYS_INLINE __forceinline
4237 #elif HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(7,0,0) && defined(__cplusplus)
4238 # define HEDLEY_ALWAYS_INLINE _Pragma("FUNC_ALWAYS_INLINE;")
4239 #elif HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
4240 # define HEDLEY_ALWAYS_INLINE _Pragma("inline=forced")
4241 #else
4242 # define HEDLEY_ALWAYS_INLINE HEDLEY_INLINE
4243 #endif

4245 #if defined(HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE)
4246 # undef HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE
4247 #endif
4248 #if \
4249  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(noinline) || \
4250  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,0,0) || \
4251  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
4252  HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,11,0) || \
4253  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \
4254  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(10,1,0) || \
4255  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
4256  (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(7,3,0) && defined(__TI_GNU_ATTRIBUTE_SUPPORT__))
4257 # define HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE __attribute__((__noinline__))
4258 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(13,10,0)
4259 # define HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE __declspec(noinline)
4260 #elif HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(10,2,0)
4261 # define HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE _Pragma("noinline")
4262 #elif HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(6,0,0) && defined(__cplusplus)
4263 # define HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE _Pragma("FUNC_CANNOT_INLINE;")
4264 #elif HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
4265 # define HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE _Pragma("inline=never")
4266 #elif HEDLEY_COMPCERT_VERSION_CHECK(3,2,0)
4267 # define HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE __attribute((noinline))
4268 #elif HEDLEY_PELLES_VERSION_CHECK(9,0,0)
4269 # define HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE __declspec(noinline)
4270 #else
4271 # define HEDLEY_NEVER_INLINE
4272 #endif
4273 
4274 #if defined(HEDLEY_PRIVATE)
4275 # undef HEDLEY_PRIVATE
4276 #endif
4277 #if defined(HEDLEY_PUBLIC)
4278 # undef HEDLEY_PUBLIC
4279 #endif
4280 #if defined(HEDLEY_IMPORT)
4281 # undef HEDLEY_IMPORT
4282 #endif
4283 #if defined(_WIN32) || defined(__CYGWIN__)
4284 # define HEDLEY_PRIVATE
4285 # define HEDLEY_PUBLIC __declspec(dllexport)
4286 # define HEDLEY_IMPORT __declspec(dllimport)
4287 #else
4288 # if \
4289  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(visibility) || \
4290  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,3,0) || \
4291  HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,11,0) || \
4292  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
4293  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \
4294  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(13,1,0) || \
4295  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0) || \
4296  (HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(7,3,0) && defined(__TI_EABI__) && defined(__TI_GNU_ATTRIBUTE_SUPPORT__))
4297 # define HEDLEY_PRIVATE __attribute__((__visibility__("hidden")))
4298 # define HEDLEY_PUBLIC __attribute__((__visibility__("default")))
4299 # else
4300 # define HEDLEY_PRIVATE
4301 # define HEDLEY_PUBLIC
4302 # endif
4303 # define HEDLEY_IMPORT extern
4304 #endif
4305 
4306 #if defined(HEDLEY_NO_THROW)
4307 # undef HEDLEY_NO_THROW
4308 #endif
4309 #if \
4310  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(nothrow) || \
4311  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,3,0) || \
4312  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
4313 # define HEDLEY_NO_THROW __attribute__((__nothrow__))
4314 #elif \
4315  HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(13,1,0) || \
4316  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0)
4317 # define HEDLEY_NO_THROW __declspec(nothrow)
4318 #else
4319 # define HEDLEY_NO_THROW
4320 #endif
4321 
4322 #if defined(HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH)
4323 # undef HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH
4324 #endif
4325 #if \
4326  defined(__cplusplus) && \
4327  (!defined(HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION) || HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,15,0)) && \
4328  !defined(HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION)
4329 # if \
4330  (__cplusplus >= 201703L) || \
4331  ((__cplusplus >= 201103L) && HEDLEY_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE(fallthrough))
4332 # define HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH [[fallthrough]]
4333 # elif (__cplusplus >= 201103L) && HEDLEY_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE(clang::fallthrough)
4334 # define HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH [[clang::fallthrough]]
4335 # elif (__cplusplus >= 201103L) && HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(7,0,0)
4336 # define HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH [[gnu::fallthrough]]
4337 # endif
4338 #endif
4339 #if !defined(HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH)
4340 # if HEDLEY_GNUC_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(fallthrough,7,0,0) && !defined(HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION)
4341 # define HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH __attribute__((__fallthrough__))
4342 # elif defined(__fallthrough) /* SAL */
4343 # define HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH __fallthrough
4344 # else
4345 # define HEDLEY_FALL_THROUGH
4346 # endif
4347 #endif
4348 
4349 #if defined(HEDLEY_RETURNS_NON_NULL)
4350 # undef HEDLEY_RETURNS_NON_NULL
4351 #endif
4352 #if \
4353  HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(returns_nonnull) || \
4354  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,9,0)
4355 # define HEDLEY_RETURNS_NON_NULL __attribute__((__returns_nonnull__))
4356 #elif defined(_Ret_notnull_) /* SAL */
4357 # define HEDLEY_RETURNS_NON_NULL _Ret_notnull_
4358 #else
4359 # define HEDLEY_RETURNS_NON_NULL
4360 #endif
4361 
4362 #if defined(HEDLEY_ARRAY_PARAM)
4363 # undef HEDLEY_ARRAY_PARAM
4364 #endif
4365 #if \
4366  defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L) && \
4367  !defined(__STDC_NO_VLA__) && \
4368  !defined(__cplusplus) && \
4369  !defined(HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION) && \
4370  !defined(HEDLEY_TINYC_VERSION)
4371 # define HEDLEY_ARRAY_PARAM(name) (name)
4372 #else
4373 # define HEDLEY_ARRAY_PARAM(name)
4374 #endif
4375 
4376 #if defined(HEDLEY_IS_CONSTANT)
4377 # undef HEDLEY_IS_CONSTANT
4378 #endif
4379 #if defined(HEDLEY_REQUIRE_CONSTEXPR)
4380 # undef HEDLEY_REQUIRE_CONSTEXPR
4381 #endif
4382 /* Note the double-underscore. For internal use only; no API
4383  * guarantees! */
4384 #if defined(HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR)
4385 # undef HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR
4386 #endif
4387 
4388 #if \
4389  HEDLEY_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_constant_p) || \
4390  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,4,0) || \
4391  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
4392  HEDLEY_TINYC_VERSION_CHECK(0,9,19) || \
4393  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(4,1,0) || \
4394  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(13,1,0) || \
4395  HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(6,1,0) || \
4396  HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION_CHECK(5,10,0) || \
4397  HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION_CHECK(8,1,0)
4398 # define HEDLEY_IS_CONSTANT(expr) __builtin_constant_p(expr)
4399 #endif
4400 #if !defined(__cplusplus)
4401 # if \
4402  HEDLEY_HAS_BUILTIN(__builtin_types_compatible_p) || \
4403  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(3,4,0) || \
4404  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
4405  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(13,1,0) || \
4406  HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION_CHECK(8,1,0) || \
4407  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(5,4,0) || \
4408  HEDLEY_TINYC_VERSION_CHECK(0,9,24)
4409 # if defined(__INTPTR_TYPE__)
4410 # define HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR(expr) __builtin_types_compatible_p(__typeof__((1 ? (void*) ((__INTPTR_TYPE__) ((expr) * 0)) : (int*) 0)), int*)
4411 # else
4412 # include <stdint.h>
4413 # define HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR(expr) __builtin_types_compatible_p(__typeof__((1 ? (void*) ((intptr_t) ((expr) * 0)) : (int*) 0)), int*)
4414 # endif
4415 # elif \
4416  (defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 201112L) && !defined(HEDLEY_SUNPRO_VERSION) && !defined(HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION)) || \
4417  HEDLEY_HAS_EXTENSION(c_generic_selections) || \
4418  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,9,0) || \
4419  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(17,0,0) || \
4420  HEDLEY_IBM_VERSION_CHECK(12,1,0) || \
4421  HEDLEY_ARM_VERSION_CHECK(5,3,0)
4422 # if defined(__INTPTR_TYPE__)
4423 # define HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR(expr) _Generic((1 ? (void*) ((__INTPTR_TYPE__) ((expr) * 0)) : (int*) 0), int*: 1, void*: 0)
4424 # else
4425 # include <stdint.h>
4426 # define HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR(expr) _Generic((1 ? (void*) ((intptr_t) * 0) : (int*) 0), int*: 1, void*: 0)
4427 # endif
4428 # elif \
4429  defined(HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION) || \
4430  defined(HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION) || \
4431  defined(HEDLEY_TINYC_VERSION) || \
4432  defined(HEDLEY_TI_VERSION) || \
4433  defined(__clang__)
4434 # define HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR(expr) ( \
4435  sizeof(void) != \
4436  sizeof(*( \
4437  1 ? \
4438  ((void*) ((expr) * 0L) ) : \
4439  ((struct { char v[sizeof(void) * 2]; } *) 1) \
4440  ) \
4441  ) \
4442  )
4443 # endif
4444 #endif
4445 #if defined(HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR)
4446 # if !defined(HEDLEY_IS_CONSTANT)
4447 # define HEDLEY_IS_CONSTANT(expr) HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR(expr)
4448 # endif
4449 # define HEDLEY_REQUIRE_CONSTEXPR(expr) (HEDLEY__IS_CONSTEXPR(expr) ? (expr) : (-1))
4450 #else
4451 # if !defined(HEDLEY_IS_CONSTANT)
4452 # define HEDLEY_IS_CONSTANT(expr) (0)
4453 # endif
4454 # define HEDLEY_REQUIRE_CONSTEXPR(expr) (expr)
4455 #endif
4456 
4457 #if defined(HEDLEY_BEGIN_C_DECLS)
4458 # undef HEDLEY_BEGIN_C_DECLS
4459 #endif
4460 #if defined(HEDLEY_END_C_DECLS)
4461 # undef HEDLEY_END_C_DECLS
4462 #endif
4463 #if defined(HEDLEY_C_DECL)
4464 # undef HEDLEY_C_DECL
4465 #endif
4466 #if defined(__cplusplus)
4467 # define HEDLEY_BEGIN_C_DECLS extern "C" {
4468 # define HEDLEY_END_C_DECLS }
4469 # define HEDLEY_C_DECL extern "C"
4470 #else
4471 # define HEDLEY_BEGIN_C_DECLS
4472 # define HEDLEY_END_C_DECLS
4473 # define HEDLEY_C_DECL
4474 #endif
4475 
4476 #if defined(HEDLEY_STATIC_ASSERT)
4477 # undef HEDLEY_STATIC_ASSERT
4478 #endif
4479 #if \
4480  !defined(__cplusplus) && ( \
4481  (defined(__STDC_VERSION__) && (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 201112L)) || \
4482  HEDLEY_HAS_FEATURE(c_static_assert) || \
4483  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(6,0,0) || \
4484  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0) || \
4485  defined(_Static_assert) \
4486  )
4487 # define HEDLEY_STATIC_ASSERT(expr, message) _Static_assert(expr, message)
4488 #elif \
4489  (defined(__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 201703L)) || \
4490  HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(16,0,0) || \
4491  (defined(__cplusplus) && HEDLEY_TI_VERSION_CHECK(8,3,0))
4492 # define HEDLEY_STATIC_ASSERT(expr, message) static_assert(expr, message)
4493 #elif defined(__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 201103L)
4494 # define HEDLEY_STATIC_ASSERT(expr, message) static_assert(expr)
4495 #else
4496 # define HEDLEY_STATIC_ASSERT(expr, message)
4497 #endif
4498 
4499 #if defined(HEDLEY_CONST_CAST)
4500 # undef HEDLEY_CONST_CAST
4501 #endif
4502 #if defined(__cplusplus)
4503 # define HEDLEY_CONST_CAST(T, expr) (const_cast<T>(expr))
4504 #elif \
4505  HEDLEY_HAS_WARNING("-Wcast-qual") || \
4506  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,6,0) || \
4507  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
4508 # define HEDLEY_CONST_CAST(T, expr) (__extension__ ({ \
4509  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH \
4510  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_CAST_QUAL \
4511  ((T) (expr)); \
4512  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP \
4513  }))
4514 #else
4515 # define HEDLEY_CONST_CAST(T, expr) ((T) (expr))
4516 #endif
4517 
4518 #if defined(HEDLEY_REINTERPRET_CAST)
4519 # undef HEDLEY_REINTERPRET_CAST
4520 #endif
4521 #if defined(__cplusplus)
4522 # define HEDLEY_REINTERPRET_CAST(T, expr) (reinterpret_cast<T>(expr))
4523 #else
4524 # define HEDLEY_REINTERPRET_CAST(T, expr) (*((T*) &(expr)))
4525 #endif
4526 
4527 #if defined(HEDLEY_STATIC_CAST)
4528 # undef HEDLEY_STATIC_CAST
4529 #endif
4530 #if defined(__cplusplus)
4531 # define HEDLEY_STATIC_CAST(T, expr) (static_cast<T>(expr))
4532 #else
4533 # define HEDLEY_STATIC_CAST(T, expr) ((T) (expr))
4534 #endif
4535 
4536 #if defined(HEDLEY_CPP_CAST)
4537 # undef HEDLEY_CPP_CAST
4538 #endif
4539 #if defined(__cplusplus)
4540 # define HEDLEY_CPP_CAST(T, expr) static_cast<T>(expr)
4541 #else
4542 # define HEDLEY_CPP_CAST(T, expr) (expr)
4543 #endif

4545 #if defined(HEDLEY_MESSAGE)
4546 # undef HEDLEY_MESSAGE
4547 #endif
4548 #if HEDLEY_HAS_WARNING("-Wunknown-pragmas")
4549 # define HEDLEY_MESSAGE(msg) \
4550  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH \
4551  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS \
4552  HEDLEY_PRAGMA(message msg) \
4553  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP
4554 #elif \
4555  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,4,0) || \
4556  HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(13,0,0)
4557 # define HEDLEY_MESSAGE(msg) HEDLEY_PRAGMA(message msg)
4558 #elif HEDLEY_CRAY_VERSION_CHECK(5,0,0)
4559 # define HEDLEY_MESSAGE(msg) HEDLEY_PRAGMA(_CRI message msg)
4560 #elif HEDLEY_IAR_VERSION_CHECK(8,0,0)
4561 # define HEDLEY_MESSAGE(msg) HEDLEY_PRAGMA(message(msg))
4562 #elif HEDLEY_PELLES_VERSION_CHECK(2,0,0)
4563 # define HEDLEY_MESSAGE(msg) HEDLEY_PRAGMA(message(msg))
4564 #else
4565 # define HEDLEY_MESSAGE(msg)
4566 #endif
4567 
4568 #if defined(HEDLEY_WARNING)
4569 # undef HEDLEY_WARNING
4570 #endif
4571 #if HEDLEY_HAS_WARNING("-Wunknown-pragmas")
4572 # define HEDLEY_WARNING(msg) \
4573  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH \
4574  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_DISABLE_UNKNOWN_PRAGMAS \
4575  HEDLEY_PRAGMA(clang warning msg) \
4576  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP
4577 #elif \
4578  HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(4,8,0) || \
4579  HEDLEY_PGI_VERSION_CHECK(18,4,0)
4580 # define HEDLEY_WARNING(msg) HEDLEY_PRAGMA(GCC warning msg)
4581 #elif HEDLEY_MSVC_VERSION_CHECK(15,0,0)
4582 # define HEDLEY_WARNING(msg) HEDLEY_PRAGMA(message(msg))
4583 #else
4584 # define HEDLEY_WARNING(msg) HEDLEY_MESSAGE(msg)
4585 #endif
4586 
4587 #if defined(HEDLEY_REQUIRE_MSG)
4588 # undef HEDLEY_REQUIRE_MSG
4589 #endif
4590 #if HEDLEY_HAS_ATTRIBUTE(diagnose_if)
4591 # if HEDLEY_HAS_WARNING("-Wgcc-compat")
4592 # define HEDLEY_REQUIRE_MSG(expr, msg) \
4593  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH \
4594  _Pragma("clang diagnostic ignored \"-Wgcc-compat\"") \
4595  __attribute__((__diagnose_if__(!(expr), msg, "error"))) \
4596  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP
4597 # else
4598 # define HEDLEY_REQUIRE_MSG(expr, msg) __attribute__((__diagnose_if__(!(expr), msg, "error")))
4599 # endif
4600 #else
4601 # define HEDLEY_REQUIRE_MSG(expr, msg)
4602 #endif
4603 
4604 #if defined(HEDLEY_REQUIRE)
4605 # undef HEDLEY_REQUIRE
4606 #endif
4607 #define HEDLEY_REQUIRE(expr) HEDLEY_REQUIRE_MSG(expr, #expr)
4608

4610 # undef HEDLEY_FLAGS
4611 #endif

4613 # define HEDLEY_FLAGS __attribute__((__flag_enum__))
4614 #endif
4615

4617 # undef HEDLEY_FLAGS_CAST
4618 #endif
4619 #if HEDLEY_INTEL_VERSION_CHECK(19,0,0)
4620 # define HEDLEY_FLAGS_CAST(T, expr) (__extension__ ({ \
4621  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_PUSH \
4622  _Pragma("warning(disable:188)") \
4623  ((T) (expr)); \
4624  HEDLEY_DIAGNOSTIC_POP \
4625  }))
4626 #else
4627 # define HEDLEY_FLAGS_CAST(T, expr) HEDLEY_STATIC_CAST(T, expr)
4628 #endif

4631

4633 # undef HEDLEY_GCC_NOT_CLANG_VERSION_CHECK
4634 #endif

4637 #else
4638 # define HEDLEY_GCC_NOT_CLANG_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch) HEDLEY_GCC_VERSION_CHECK(major,minor,patch)
4639 #endif

4645

4647 # undef HEDLEY_CLANG_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE
4648 #endif
4649 #define HEDLEY_CLANG_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE(attribute) HEDLEY_HAS_CPP_ATTRIBUTE(attribute)

4652 # undef HEDLEY_CLANG_HAS_BUILTIN
4653 #endif

4658 #endif

4667 # undef HEDLEY_CLANG_HAS_DECLSPEC_DECLSPEC_ATTRIBUTE
4668 #endif

4679 namespace csv {
4680 #ifdef _MSC_VER
4681 #pragma region Compatibility Macros
4682 #endif
4696 #define STATIC_ASSERT(x) static_assert(x, "Assertion failed")
4697 
4698 #if CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD == 17 || __cplusplus >= 201703L
4699 #define CSV_HAS_CXX17
4700 #endif
4701 
4702 #if CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD >= 14 || __cplusplus >= 201402L
4703 #define CSV_HAS_CXX14
4704 #endif
4705 
4706 #ifdef CSV_HAS_CXX17
4707 #include <string_view>
4711  using string_view = std::string_view;
4712 #else
4716  using string_view = nonstd::string_view;
4717 #endif
4718 
4719 #ifdef CSV_HAS_CXX17
4720  #define IF_CONSTEXPR if constexpr
4721  #define CONSTEXPR_VALUE constexpr
4722 
4723  #define CONSTEXPR_17 constexpr
4724 #else
4725  #define IF_CONSTEXPR if
4726  #define CONSTEXPR_VALUE const
4727 
4728  #define CONSTEXPR_17 inline
4729 #endif
4730 
4731 #ifdef CSV_HAS_CXX14
4732  template<bool B, class T = void>
4733  using enable_if_t = std::enable_if_t<B, T>;
4734 
4735  #define CONSTEXPR_14 constexpr
4736  #define CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 constexpr
4737 #else
4738  template<bool B, class T = void>
4739  using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
4740 
4741  #define CONSTEXPR_14 inline
4742  #define CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 const
4743 #endif
4744 
4745  // Resolves g++ bug with regard to constexpr methods
4746  // See: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/36489369/constexpr-non-static-member-function-with-non-constexpr-constructor-gcc-clang-d
4747 #if defined __GNUC__ && !defined __clang__
4748  #if (__GNUC__ >= 7 &&__GNUC_MINOR__ >= 2) || (__GNUC__ >= 8)
4749  #define CONSTEXPR constexpr
4750  #endif
4751  #else
4752  #ifdef CSV_HAS_CXX17
4753  #define CONSTEXPR constexpr
4754  #endif
4755 #endif
4756 
4757 #ifndef CONSTEXPR
4758 #define CONSTEXPR inline
4759 #endif
4760 
4761 #ifdef _MSC_VER
4762 #pragma endregion
4763 #endif
4764 
4765  namespace internals {
4766  // PAGE_SIZE macro could be already defined by the host system.
4767 #if defined(PAGE_SIZE)
4768 #undef PAGE_SIZE
4769 #endif
4770 
4771 // Get operating system specific details
4772 #if defined(_WIN32)
4773  inline int getpagesize() {
4774  _SYSTEM_INFO sys_info = {};
4775  GetSystemInfo(&sys_info);
4776  return std::max(sys_info.dwPageSize, sys_info.dwAllocationGranularity);
4777  }
4778 
4779  const int PAGE_SIZE = getpagesize();
4780 #elif defined(__linux__)
4781  const int PAGE_SIZE = getpagesize();
4782 #else
4786  const int PAGE_SIZE = 4096;
4787 #endif
4788 
4792  constexpr size_t ITERATION_CHUNK_SIZE = 10000000; // 10MB
4793 
4794  template<typename T>
4795  inline bool is_equal(T a, T b, T epsilon = 0.001) {
4797  static_assert(std::is_floating_point<T>::value, "T must be a floating point type.");
4798  return std::abs(a - b) < epsilon;
4799  }
4800 
4807  enum class ParseFlags {
4808  QUOTE_ESCAPE_QUOTE = 0,
4809  QUOTE = 2 | 1,
4810  NOT_SPECIAL = 4,
4811  DELIMITER = 4 | 2,
4812  NEWLINE = 4 | 2 | 1
4813  };
4814 
4817  constexpr ParseFlags quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags flag, bool quote_escape) noexcept {
4818  return (ParseFlags)((int)flag & ~((int)ParseFlags::QUOTE * quote_escape));
4819  }
4820 
4821  // Assumed to be true by parsing functions: allows for testing
4822  // if an item is DELIMITER or NEWLINE with a >= statement
4823  STATIC_ASSERT(ParseFlags::DELIMITER < ParseFlags::NEWLINE);
4824 
4830  STATIC_ASSERT(quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL, false) == ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL);
4831  STATIC_ASSERT(quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags::QUOTE, false) == ParseFlags::QUOTE);
4832  STATIC_ASSERT(quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags::DELIMITER, false) == ParseFlags::DELIMITER);
4833  STATIC_ASSERT(quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags::NEWLINE, false) == ParseFlags::NEWLINE);
4834 
4835  STATIC_ASSERT(quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL, true) == ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL);
4836  STATIC_ASSERT(quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags::QUOTE, true) == ParseFlags::QUOTE_ESCAPE_QUOTE);
4837  STATIC_ASSERT(quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags::DELIMITER, true) == ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL);
4838  STATIC_ASSERT(quote_escape_flag(ParseFlags::NEWLINE, true) == ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL);
4839 
4841  using ParseFlagMap = std::array<ParseFlags, 256>;
4842 
4844  using WhitespaceMap = std::array<bool, 256>;
4845  }
4846 
4848  constexpr int CSV_NOT_FOUND = -1;
4849 }
4850 
4851 
4852 namespace csv {
4853  namespace internals {
4854  struct ColNames;
4855  using ColNamesPtr = std::shared_ptr<ColNames>;
4856 
4864  struct ColNames {
4865  public:
4866  ColNames() = default;
4867  ColNames(const std::vector<std::string>& names) {
4868  set_col_names(names);
4869  }
4870 
4871  std::vector<std::string> get_col_names() const;
4872  void set_col_names(const std::vector<std::string>&);
4873  int index_of(csv::string_view) const;
4874 
4875  bool empty() const noexcept { return this->col_names.empty(); }
4876  size_t size() const noexcept;
4877 
4878  private:
4879  std::vector<std::string> col_names;
4880  std::unordered_map<std::string, size_t> col_pos;
4881  };
4882  }
4883 }
4888 #include <iterator>
4889 #include <stdexcept>
4890 #include <string>
4891 #include <vector>
4892
