4894 namespace csv {
4895  namespace internals {
4896  class IBasicCSVParser;
4897  }
4898 
4899  class CSVReader;
4900 
4902  enum class VariableColumnPolicy {
4903  THROW = -1,
4904  IGNORE_ROW = 0,
4905  KEEP = 1
4906  };
4907 
4909  struct CSVGuessResult {
4910  char delim;
4911  int header_row;
4912  };
4913 
4917  class CSVFormat {
4918  public:
4920  CSVFormat() = default;
4921 
4926  CSVFormat& delimiter(char delim);
4927 
4933  CSVFormat& delimiter(const std::vector<char> & delim);
4934 
4940  CSVFormat& trim(const std::vector<char> & ws);
4941 
4946  CSVFormat& quote(char quote);
4947 
4952  CSVFormat& column_names(const std::vector<std::string>& names);
4953 
4958  CSVFormat& header_row(int row);
4959 
4965  CSVFormat& no_header() {
4966  this->header_row(-1);
4967  return *this;
4968  }
4969 
4971  CSVFormat& quote(bool use_quote) {
4972  this->no_quote = !use_quote;
4973  return *this;
4974  }
4975 
4977  CONSTEXPR_14 CSVFormat& variable_columns(VariableColumnPolicy policy = VariableColumnPolicy::IGNORE_ROW) {
4978  this->variable_column_policy = policy;
4979  return *this;
4980  }
4981 
4983  CONSTEXPR_14 CSVFormat& variable_columns(bool policy) {
4984  this->variable_column_policy = (VariableColumnPolicy)policy;
4985  return *this;
4986  }
4987 
4988  #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
4989  char get_delim() const {
4990  // This error should never be received by end users.
4991  if (this->possible_delimiters.size() > 1) {
4992  throw std::runtime_error("There is more than one possible delimiter.");
4993  }
4994 
4995  return this->possible_delimiters.at(0);
4996  }
4997 
4998  CONSTEXPR bool is_quoting_enabled() const { return !this->no_quote; }
4999  CONSTEXPR char get_quote_char() const { return this->quote_char; }
5000  CONSTEXPR int get_header() const { return this->header; }
5001  std::vector<char> get_possible_delims() const { return this->possible_delimiters; }
5002  std::vector<char> get_trim_chars() const { return this->trim_chars; }
5003  CONSTEXPR VariableColumnPolicy get_variable_column_policy() const { return this->variable_column_policy; }
5004  #endif
5005 
5007  CSV_INLINE static CSVFormat guess_csv() {
5008  CSVFormat format;
5009  format.delimiter({ ',', '|', '\t', ';', '^' })
5010  .quote('"')
5011  .header_row(0);
5012 
5013  return format;
5014  }
5015 
5016  bool guess_delim() {
5017  return this->possible_delimiters.size() > 1;
5018  }
5019 
5020  friend CSVReader;
5021  friend internals::IBasicCSVParser;
5022 
5023  private:
5025  void assert_no_char_overlap();
5026 
5028  std::vector<char> possible_delimiters = { ',' };
5029 
5031  std::vector<char> trim_chars = {};
5032 
5034  int header = 0;
5035 
5037  bool no_quote = false;
5038 
5040  char quote_char = '"';
5041 
5043  std::vector<std::string> col_names = {};
5044 
5046  VariableColumnPolicy variable_column_policy = VariableColumnPolicy::IGNORE_ROW;
5047  };
5048 }
5053 #include <cmath>
5054 #include <iterator>
5055 #include <memory> // For CSVField
5056 #include <limits> // For CSVField
5057 #include <unordered_map>
5058 #include <unordered_set>
5059 #include <string>
5060 #include <sstream>
5061 #include <vector>
5062 
5067 #include <cmath>
5068 #include <cctype>
5069 #include <string>
5070 #include <cassert>
5071 
5072 
5073 namespace csv {
5080  enum class DataType {
5081  UNKNOWN = -1,
5082  CSV_NULL,
5083  CSV_STRING,
5084  CSV_INT8,
5085  CSV_INT16,
5086  CSV_INT32,
5087  CSV_INT64,
5088  CSV_DOUBLE
5089  };
5090 
5091  static_assert(DataType::CSV_STRING < DataType::CSV_INT8, "String type should come before numeric types.");
5092  static_assert(DataType::CSV_INT8 < DataType::CSV_INT64, "Smaller integer types should come before larger integer types.");
5093  static_assert(DataType::CSV_INT64 < DataType::CSV_DOUBLE, "Integer types should come before floating point value types.");
5094 
5095  namespace internals {
5097  template<typename T>
5098  HEDLEY_CONST CONSTEXPR_14
5099  long double pow10(const T& n) noexcept {
5100  long double multiplicand = n > 0 ? 10 : 0.1,
5101  ret = 1;
5102 
5103  // Make all numbers positive
5104  T iterations = n > 0 ? n : -n;
5105 
5106  for (T i = 0; i < iterations; i++) {
5107  ret *= multiplicand;
5108  }
5109 
5110  return ret;
5111  }
5112 
5114  template<>
5115  HEDLEY_CONST CONSTEXPR_14
5116  long double pow10(const unsigned& n) noexcept {
5117  long double multiplicand = n > 0 ? 10 : 0.1,
5118  ret = 1;
5119 
5120  for (unsigned i = 0; i < n; i++) {
5121  ret *= multiplicand;
5122  }
5123 
5124  return ret;
5125  }
5126 
5127 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
5129  constexpr DataType int_type_arr[8] = {
5130  DataType::CSV_INT8, // 1
5131  DataType::CSV_INT16, // 2
5132  DataType::UNKNOWN,
5133  DataType::CSV_INT32, // 4
5134  DataType::UNKNOWN,
5135  DataType::UNKNOWN,
5136  DataType::UNKNOWN,
5137  DataType::CSV_INT64 // 8
5138  };
5139 
5140  template<typename T>
5141  inline DataType type_num() {
5142  static_assert(std::is_integral<T>::value, "T should be an integral type.");
5143  static_assert(sizeof(T) <= 8, "Byte size must be no greater than 8.");
5144  return int_type_arr[sizeof(T) - 1];
5145  }
5146 
5147  template<> inline DataType type_num<float>() { return DataType::CSV_DOUBLE; }
5148  template<> inline DataType type_num<double>() { return DataType::CSV_DOUBLE; }
5149  template<> inline DataType type_num<long double>() { return DataType::CSV_DOUBLE; }
5150  template<> inline DataType type_num<std::nullptr_t>() { return DataType::CSV_NULL; }
5151  template<> inline DataType type_num<std::string>() { return DataType::CSV_STRING; }
5152 
5153  CONSTEXPR_14 DataType data_type(csv::string_view in, long double* const out = nullptr);
5154 #endif
5155 
5162  template<size_t Bytes>
5163  CONSTEXPR_14 long double get_int_max() {
5164  static_assert(Bytes == 1 || Bytes == 2 || Bytes == 4 || Bytes == 8,
5165  "Bytes must be a power of 2 below 8.");
5166 
5167  IF_CONSTEXPR (sizeof(signed char) == Bytes) {
5168  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<signed char>::max();
5169  }
5170 
5171  IF_CONSTEXPR (sizeof(short) == Bytes) {
5172  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<short>::max();
5173  }
5174 
5175  IF_CONSTEXPR (sizeof(int) == Bytes) {
5176  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<int>::max();
5177  }
5178 
5179  IF_CONSTEXPR (sizeof(long int) == Bytes) {
5180  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<long int>::max();
5181  }
5182 
5183  IF_CONSTEXPR (sizeof(long long int) == Bytes) {
5184  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<long long int>::max();
5185  }
5186 
5187  HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE();
5188  }
5189 
5193  template<size_t Bytes>
5194  CONSTEXPR_14 long double get_uint_max() {
5195  static_assert(Bytes == 1 || Bytes == 2 || Bytes == 4 || Bytes == 8,
5196  "Bytes must be a power of 2 below 8.");
5197 
5198  IF_CONSTEXPR(sizeof(unsigned char) == Bytes) {
5199  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<unsigned char>::max();
5200  }
5201 
5202  IF_CONSTEXPR(sizeof(unsigned short) == Bytes) {
5203  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<unsigned short>::max();
5204  }
5205 
5206  IF_CONSTEXPR(sizeof(unsigned int) == Bytes) {
5207  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<unsigned int>::max();
5208  }
5209 
5210  IF_CONSTEXPR(sizeof(unsigned long int) == Bytes) {
5211  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<unsigned long int>::max();
5212  }
5213 
5214  IF_CONSTEXPR(sizeof(unsigned long long int) == Bytes) {
5215  return (long double)std::numeric_limits<unsigned long long int>::max();
5216  }
5217 
5218  HEDLEY_UNREACHABLE();
5219  }
5220 
5222  CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 long double CSV_INT8_MAX = get_int_max<1>();
5223 
5225  CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 long double CSV_INT16_MAX = get_int_max<2>();
5226 
5228  CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 long double CSV_INT32_MAX = get_int_max<4>();
5229 
5231  CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 long double CSV_INT64_MAX = get_int_max<8>();
5232 
5234  CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 long double CSV_UINT8_MAX = get_uint_max<1>();
5235 
5237  CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 long double CSV_UINT16_MAX = get_uint_max<2>();
5238 
5240  CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 long double CSV_UINT32_MAX = get_uint_max<4>();
5241 
5243  CONSTEXPR_VALUE_14 long double CSV_UINT64_MAX = get_uint_max<8>();
5244 
5249  HEDLEY_PRIVATE CONSTEXPR_14
5250  DataType _process_potential_exponential(
5251  csv::string_view exponential_part,
5252  const long double& coeff,
5253  long double * const out) {
5254  long double exponent = 0;
5255  auto result = data_type(exponential_part, &exponent);
5256 
5257  // Exponents in scientific notation should not be decimal numbers
5258  if (result >= DataType::CSV_INT8 && result < DataType::CSV_DOUBLE) {
5259  if (out) *out = coeff * pow10(exponent);
5260  return DataType::CSV_DOUBLE;
5261  }
5262 
5263  return DataType::CSV_STRING;
5264  }
5265 
5269  HEDLEY_PRIVATE HEDLEY_PURE CONSTEXPR_14
5270  DataType _determine_integral_type(const long double& number) noexcept {
5271  // We can assume number is always non-negative
5272  assert(number >= 0);
5273 
5274  if (number <= internals::CSV_INT8_MAX)
5275  return DataType::CSV_INT8;
5276  else if (number <= internals::CSV_INT16_MAX)
5277  return DataType::CSV_INT16;
5278  else if (number <= internals::CSV_INT32_MAX)
5279  return DataType::CSV_INT32;
5280  else if (number <= internals::CSV_INT64_MAX)
5281  return DataType::CSV_INT64;
5282  else // Conversion to long long will cause an overflow
5283  return DataType::CSV_DOUBLE;
5284  }
5285 
5297  CONSTEXPR_14
5298  DataType data_type(csv::string_view in, long double* const out) {
5299  // Empty string --> NULL
5300  if (in.size() == 0)
5301  return DataType::CSV_NULL;
5302 
5303  bool ws_allowed = true,
5304  neg_allowed = true,
5305  dot_allowed = true,
5306  digit_allowed = true,
5307  has_digit = false,
5308  prob_float = false;
5309 
5310  unsigned places_after_decimal = 0;
5311  long double integral_part = 0,
5312  decimal_part = 0;
5313 
5314  for (size_t i = 0, ilen = in.size(); i < ilen; i++) {
5315  const char& current = in[i];
5316 
5317  switch (current) {
5318  case ' ':
5319  if (!ws_allowed) {
5320  if (isdigit(in[i - 1])) {
5321  digit_allowed = false;
5322  ws_allowed = true;
5323  }
5324  else {
5325  // Ex: '510 123 4567'
5326  return DataType::CSV_STRING;
5327  }
5328  }
5329  break;
5330  case '-':
5331  if (!neg_allowed) {
5332  // Ex: '510-123-4567'
5333  return DataType::CSV_STRING;
5334  }
5335 
5336  neg_allowed = false;
5337  break;
5338  case '.':
5339  if (!dot_allowed) {
5340  return DataType::CSV_STRING;
5341  }
5342 
5343  dot_allowed = false;
5344  prob_float = true;
5345  break;
5346  case 'e':
5347  case 'E':
5348  // Process scientific notation
5349  if (prob_float || (i && i + 1 < ilen && isdigit(in[i - 1]))) {
5350  size_t exponent_start_idx = i + 1;
5351  prob_float = true;
5352 
5353  // Strip out plus sign
5354  if (in[i + 1] == '+') {
5355  exponent_start_idx++;
5356  }
5357 
5358  return _process_potential_exponential(
5359  in.substr(exponent_start_idx),
5360  neg_allowed ? integral_part + decimal_part : -(integral_part + decimal_part),
5361  out
5362  );
5363  }
5364 
5365  return DataType::CSV_STRING;
5366  break;
5367  default:
5368  short digit = static_cast<short>(current - '0');
5369  if (digit >= 0 && digit <= 9) {
5370  // Process digit
5371  has_digit = true;
5372 
5373  if (!digit_allowed)
5374  return DataType::CSV_STRING;
5375  else if (ws_allowed) // Ex: '510 456'
5376  ws_allowed = false;
5377 
5378  // Build current number
5379  if (prob_float)
5380  decimal_part += digit / pow10(++places_after_decimal);
5381  else
5382  integral_part = (integral_part * 10) + digit;
5383  }
5384  else {
5385  return DataType::CSV_STRING;
5386  }
5387  }
5388  }
5389 
5390  // No non-numeric/non-whitespace characters found
5391  if (has_digit) {
5392  long double number = integral_part + decimal_part;
5393  if (out) {
5394  *out = neg_allowed ? number : -number;
5395  }
5396 
5397  return prob_float ? DataType::CSV_DOUBLE : _determine_integral_type(number);
5398  }
5399 
5400  // Just whitespace
5401  return DataType::CSV_NULL;
5402  }
5403  }
5404 }
5405 
5406 namespace csv {
5407  namespace internals {
5408  class IBasicCSVParser;
5409 
5410  static const std::string ERROR_NAN = "Not a number.";
5411  static const std::string ERROR_OVERFLOW = "Overflow error.";
5412  static const std::string ERROR_FLOAT_TO_INT =
5413  "Attempted to convert a floating point value to an integral type.";
5414  static const std::string ERROR_NEG_TO_UNSIGNED = "Negative numbers cannot be converted to unsigned types.";
5415 
5416  std::string json_escape_string(csv::string_view s) noexcept;
5417 
5419  struct RawCSVField {
5420  RawCSVField() = default;
5421  RawCSVField(size_t _start, size_t _length, bool _double_quote = false) {
5422  start = _start;
5423  length = _length;
5424  has_double_quote = _double_quote;
5425  }
5426 
5428  size_t start;
5429 
5431  size_t length;
5432 
5434  bool has_double_quote;
5435  };
5436 
5448  class CSVFieldList {
5449  public:
5451  CSVFieldList(size_t single_buffer_capacity = (size_t)(internals::PAGE_SIZE / sizeof(RawCSVField))) :
5452  _single_buffer_capacity(single_buffer_capacity) {
5453  this->allocate();
5454  }
5455 
5456  // No copy constructor
5457  CSVFieldList(const CSVFieldList& other) = delete;
5458 
5459  // CSVFieldArrays may be moved
5460  CSVFieldList(CSVFieldList&& other) :
5461  _single_buffer_capacity(other._single_buffer_capacity) {
5462  buffers = std::move(other.buffers);
5463  _current_buffer_size = other._current_buffer_size;
5464  _back = other._back;
5465  }
5466 
5467  ~CSVFieldList() {
5468  for (auto& buffer : buffers)
5469  delete[] buffer;
5470  }
5471 
5472  template <class... Args>
5473  void emplace_back(Args&&... args) {
5474  if (this->_current_buffer_size == this->_single_buffer_capacity) {
5475  this->allocate();
5476  }
5477 
5478  *(_back++) = RawCSVField(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
5479  _current_buffer_size++;
5480  }
5481 
5482  size_t size() const noexcept {
5483  return this->_current_buffer_size + ((this->buffers.size() - 1) * this->_single_buffer_capacity);
5484  }
5485 
5486  RawCSVField& operator[](size_t n) const;
5487 
5488  private:
5489  const size_t _single_buffer_capacity;
5490 
5491  std::vector<RawCSVField*> buffers = {};
5492 
5494  size_t _current_buffer_size = 0;
5495 
5497  RawCSVField* _back = nullptr;
5498 
5500  void allocate();
5501  };
5502 
5503 
5505  struct RawCSVData {
5506  std::shared_ptr<void> _data = nullptr;
5507  csv::string_view data = "";
5508 
5509  internals::CSVFieldList fields;
5510 
5511  std::unordered_set<size_t> has_double_quotes = {};
5512 
5513  // TODO: Consider replacing with a more thread-safe structure
5514  std::unordered_map<size_t, std::string> double_quote_fields = {};
5515 
5516  internals::ColNamesPtr col_names = nullptr;
5517  internals::ParseFlagMap parse_flags;
5518  internals::WhitespaceMap ws_flags;
5519  };
5520 
5521  using RawCSVDataPtr = std::shared_ptr<RawCSVData>;
5522  }
5523 
5529  class CSVField {
5530  public:
5532  constexpr explicit CSVField(csv::string_view _sv) noexcept : sv(_sv) { };
5533 
5534  operator std::string() const {
5535  return std::string("<CSVField> ") + std::string(this->sv);
5536  }
5537 
5566  template<typename T = std::string> T get() {
5567  IF_CONSTEXPR(std::is_arithmetic<T>::value) {
5568  // Note: this->type() also converts the CSV value to float
5569  if (this->type() <= DataType::CSV_STRING) {
5570  throw std::runtime_error(internals::ERROR_NAN);
5571  }
5572  }
5573 
5574  IF_CONSTEXPR(std::is_integral<T>::value) {
5575  // Note: this->is_float() also converts the CSV value to float
5576  if (this->is_float()) {
5577  throw std::runtime_error(internals::ERROR_FLOAT_TO_INT);
5578  }
5579 
5580  IF_CONSTEXPR(std::is_unsigned<T>::value) {
5581  if (this->value < 0) {
5582  throw std::runtime_error(internals::ERROR_NEG_TO_UNSIGNED);
5583  }
5584  }
5585  }
5586 
5587  // Allow fallthrough from previous if branch
5588  IF_CONSTEXPR(!std::is_floating_point<T>::value) {
5589  IF_CONSTEXPR(std::is_unsigned<T>::value) {
5590  // Quick hack to perform correct unsigned integer boundary checks
5591  if (this->value > internals::get_uint_max<sizeof(T)>()) {
5592  throw std::runtime_error(internals::ERROR_OVERFLOW);
5593  }
5594  }
5595  else if (internals::type_num<T>() < this->_type) {
5596  throw std::runtime_error(internals::ERROR_OVERFLOW);
5597  }
5598  }
5599 
5600  return static_cast<T>(this->value);
5601  }
5602 
5604  bool try_parse_hex(int& parsedValue);
5605 
5619  template<typename T>
5620  CONSTEXPR_14 bool operator==(T other) const noexcept
5621  {
5622  static_assert(std::is_arithmetic<T>::value,
5623  "T should be a numeric value.");
5624 
5625  if (this->_type != DataType::UNKNOWN) {
5626  if (this->_type == DataType::CSV_STRING) {
5627  return false;
5628  }
5629 
5630  return internals::is_equal(value, static_cast<long double>(other), 0.000001L);
5631  }
5632 
5633  long double out = 0;
5634  if (internals::data_type(this->sv, &out) == DataType::CSV_STRING) {
5635  return false;
5636  }
5637 
5638  return internals::is_equal(out, static_cast<long double>(other), 0.000001L);
5639  }
5640 
5642  CONSTEXPR csv::string_view get_sv() const noexcept { return this->sv; }
5643 
5645  CONSTEXPR_14 bool is_null() noexcept { return type() == DataType::CSV_NULL; }
5646 
5648  CONSTEXPR_14 bool is_str() noexcept { return type() == DataType::CSV_STRING; }
5649 
5651  CONSTEXPR_14 bool is_num() noexcept { return type() >= DataType::CSV_INT8; }
5652 
5654  CONSTEXPR_14 bool is_int() noexcept {
5655  return (type() >= DataType::CSV_INT8) && (type() <= DataType::CSV_INT64);
5656  }
5657 
5659  CONSTEXPR_14 bool is_float() noexcept { return type() == DataType::CSV_DOUBLE; };
5660 
5662  CONSTEXPR_14 DataType type() noexcept {
5663  this->get_value();
5664  return _type;
5665  }
5666 
5667  private:
5668  long double value = 0;
5669  csv::string_view sv = "";
5670  DataType _type = DataType::UNKNOWN;
5671  CONSTEXPR_14 void get_value() noexcept {
5672  /* Check to see if value has been cached previously, if not
5673  * evaluate it
5674  */
5675  if ((int)_type < 0) {
5676  this->_type = internals::data_type(this->sv, &this->value);
5677  }
5678  }
5679  };
5680 
5682  class CSVRow {
5683  public:
5684  friend internals::IBasicCSVParser;
5685 
5686  CSVRow() = default;
5687 
5689  CSVRow(internals::RawCSVDataPtr _data) : data(_data) {}
5690  CSVRow(internals::RawCSVDataPtr _data, size_t _data_start, size_t _field_bounds)
5691  : data(_data), data_start(_data_start), fields_start(_field_bounds) {}
5692 
5694  CONSTEXPR bool empty() const noexcept { return this->size() == 0; }
5695 
5697  CONSTEXPR size_t size() const noexcept { return row_length; }
5698 
5701  CSVField operator[](size_t n) const;
5702  CSVField operator[](const std::string&) const;
5703  std::string to_json(const std::vector<std::string>& subset = {}) const;
5704  std::string to_json_array(const std::vector<std::string>& subset = {}) const;
5705 
5707  std::vector<std::string> get_col_names() const {
5708  return this->data->col_names->get_col_names();
5709  }
5710 
5715  operator std::vector<std::string>() const;
5717 
5721  class iterator {
5722  public:
5723 #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
5724  using value_type = CSVField;
5725  using difference_type = int;
5726 
5727  // Using CSVField * as pointer type causes segfaults in MSVC debug builds
5728  // but using shared_ptr as pointer type won't compile in g++
5729 #ifdef _MSC_BUILD
5730  using pointer = std::shared_ptr<CSVField>;
5731 #else
5732  using pointer = CSVField * ;
5733 #endif
5734 
5735  using reference = CSVField & ;
5736  using iterator_category = std::random_access_iterator_tag;
5737 #endif
5738  iterator(const CSVRow*, int i);
5739 
5740  reference operator*() const;
5741  pointer operator->() const;
5742 
5743  iterator operator++(int);
5744  iterator& operator++();
5745  iterator operator--(int);
5746  iterator& operator--();
5747  iterator operator+(difference_type n) const;
5748  iterator operator-(difference_type n) const;
5749 
5751  CONSTEXPR bool operator==(const iterator& other) const noexcept {
5752  return this->i == other.i;
5753  };
5754 
5755  CONSTEXPR bool operator!=(const iterator& other) const noexcept { return !operator==(other); }
5756 
5757 #ifndef NDEBUG
5758  friend CSVRow;
5759 #endif
5760 
5761  private:
5762  const CSVRow * daddy = nullptr; // Pointer to parent
5763  std::shared_ptr<CSVField> field = nullptr; // Current field pointed at
5764  int i = 0; // Index of current field
5765  };
5766 
5768  using reverse_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<iterator>;
5769 
5774  iterator begin() const;
5775  iterator end() const noexcept;
5776  reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept;
5777  reverse_iterator rend() const;
5779 
5780  private:
5782  csv::string_view get_field(size_t index) const;
5783 
5784  internals::RawCSVDataPtr data;
5785 
5787  size_t data_start = 0;
5788 
5790  size_t fields_start = 0;
5791 
5793  size_t row_length = 0;
5794  };
5795 
5796 #ifdef _MSC_VER
5797 #pragma region CSVField::get Specializations
5798 #endif
5800  template<>
5801  inline std::string CSVField::get<std::string>() {
5802  return std::string(this->sv);
5803  }
5804 
5810  template<>
5811  CONSTEXPR_14 csv::string_view CSVField::get<csv::string_view>() {
5812  return this->sv;
5813  }
5814 
5816  template<>
5817  CONSTEXPR_14 long double CSVField::get<long double>() {
5818  if (!is_num())
5819  throw std::runtime_error(internals::ERROR_NAN);
5820 
5821  return this->value;
5822  }
5823 #ifdef _MSC_VER
5824 #pragma endregion CSVField::get Specializations
5825 #endif
5826 
5828  template<>
5829  CONSTEXPR bool CSVField::operator==(const char * other) const noexcept
5830  {
5831  return this->sv == other;
5832  }
5833 
5835  template<>
5836  CONSTEXPR bool CSVField::operator==(csv::string_view other) const noexcept
5837  {
5838  return this->sv == other;
5839  }
5840 }
5841 
5842 inline std::ostream& operator << (std::ostream& os, csv::CSVField const& value) {
5843  os << std::string(value);
5844  return os;
5845 }
5846 
5847 
5848 namespace csv {
5849  namespace internals {
5854  HEDLEY_CONST CONSTEXPR_17 ParseFlagMap make_parse_flags(char delimiter) {
5855  std::array<ParseFlags, 256> ret = {};
5856  for (int i = -128; i < 128; i++) {
5857  const int arr_idx = i + 128;
5858  char ch = char(i);
5859 
5860  if (ch == delimiter)
5861  ret[arr_idx] = ParseFlags::DELIMITER;
5862  else if (ch == '\r' || ch == '\n')
5863  ret[arr_idx] = ParseFlags::NEWLINE;
5864  else
5865  ret[arr_idx] = ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL;
5866  }
5867 
5868  return ret;
5869  }
5870 
5875  HEDLEY_CONST CONSTEXPR_17 ParseFlagMap make_parse_flags(char delimiter, char quote_char) {
5876  std::array<ParseFlags, 256> ret = make_parse_flags(delimiter);
5877  ret[(size_t)quote_char + 128] = ParseFlags::QUOTE;
5878  return ret;
5879  }
5880 
5885  HEDLEY_CONST CONSTEXPR_17 WhitespaceMap make_ws_flags(const char* ws_chars, size_t n_chars) {
5886  std::array<bool, 256> ret = {};
5887  for (int i = -128; i < 128; i++) {
5888  const int arr_idx = i + 128;
5889  char ch = char(i);
5890  ret[arr_idx] = false;
5891 
5892  for (size_t j = 0; j < n_chars; j++) {
5893  if (ws_chars[j] == ch) {
5894  ret[arr_idx] = true;
5895  }
5896  }
5897  }
5898 
5899  return ret;
5900  }
5901 
5902  inline WhitespaceMap make_ws_flags(const std::vector<char>& flags) {
5903  return make_ws_flags(flags.data(), flags.size());
5904  }
5905 
5906  CSV_INLINE size_t get_file_size(csv::string_view filename);
5907 
5908  CSV_INLINE std::string get_csv_head(csv::string_view filename);
5909 
5911  CSV_INLINE std::string get_csv_head(csv::string_view filename, size_t file_size);
5912 
5917  template<typename T>
5918  class ThreadSafeDeque {
5919  public:
5920  ThreadSafeDeque(size_t notify_size = 100) : _notify_size(notify_size) {};
5921  ThreadSafeDeque(const ThreadSafeDeque& other) {
5922  this->data = other.data;
5923  this->_notify_size = other._notify_size;
5924  }
5925 
5926  ThreadSafeDeque(const std::deque<T>& source) : ThreadSafeDeque() {
5927  this->data = source;
5928  }
5929 
5930  void clear() noexcept { this->data.clear(); }
5931 
5932  bool empty() const noexcept {
5933  return this->data.empty();
5934  }
5935 
5936  T& front() noexcept {
5937  return this->data.front();
5938  }
5939 
5940  T& operator[](size_t n) {
5941  return this->data[n];
5942  }
5943 
5944  void push_back(T&& item) {
5945  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock{ this->_lock };
5946  this->data.push_back(std::move(item));
5947 
5948  if (this->size() >= _notify_size) {
5949  this->_cond.notify_all();
5950  }
5951  }
5952 
5953  T pop_front() noexcept {
5954  std::lock_guard<std::mutex> lock{ this->_lock };
5955  T item = std::move(data.front());
5956  data.pop_front();
5957  return item;
5958  }
5959 
5960  size_t size() const noexcept { return this->data.size(); }
5961 
5963  constexpr bool is_waitable() const noexcept { return this->_is_waitable; }
5964 
5966  void wait() {
5967  if (!is_waitable()) {
5968  return;
5969  }
5970 
5971  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock{ this->_lock };
5972  this->_cond.wait(lock, [this] { return this->size() >= _notify_size || !this->is_waitable(); });
5973  lock.unlock();
5974  }
5975 
5976  typename std::deque<T>::iterator begin() noexcept {
5977  return this->data.begin();
5978  }
5979 
5980  typename std::deque<T>::iterator end() noexcept {
5981  return this->data.end();
5982  }
5983 
5985  void notify_all() {
5986  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock{ this->_lock };
5987  this->_is_waitable = true;
5988  this->_cond.notify_all();
5989  }
5990 
5992  void kill_all() {
5993  std::unique_lock<std::mutex> lock{ this->_lock };
5994  this->_is_waitable = false;
5995  this->_cond.notify_all();
5996  }
5997 
5998  private:
5999  bool _is_waitable = false;
6000  size_t _notify_size;
6001  std::mutex _lock;
6002  std::condition_variable _cond;
6003  std::deque<T> data;
6004  };
6005 
6006  constexpr const int UNINITIALIZED_FIELD = -1;
6007  }
6008 
6010  using RowCollection = internals::ThreadSafeDeque<CSVRow>;
6011 
6012  namespace internals {
6019  class IBasicCSVParser {
6020  public:
6021  IBasicCSVParser() = default;
6022  IBasicCSVParser(const CSVFormat&, const ColNamesPtr&);
6023  IBasicCSVParser(const ParseFlagMap& parse_flags, const WhitespaceMap& ws_flags
6024  ) : _parse_flags(parse_flags), _ws_flags(ws_flags) {};
6025 
6026  virtual ~IBasicCSVParser() {}
6027 
6029  bool eof() { return this->_eof; }
6030 
6032  virtual void next(size_t bytes) = 0;
6033 
6035  void end_feed();
6036 
6037  CONSTEXPR_17 ParseFlags parse_flag(const char ch) const noexcept {
6038  return _parse_flags.data()[ch + 128];
6039  }
6040 
6041  CONSTEXPR_17 ParseFlags compound_parse_flag(const char ch) const noexcept {
6042  return quote_escape_flag(parse_flag(ch), this->quote_escape);
6043  }
6044 
6046  CONSTEXPR bool utf8_bom() const { return this->_utf8_bom; }
6047 
6048  void set_output(RowCollection& rows) { this->_records = &rows; }
6049 
6050  protected:
6053  CSVRow current_row;
6054  RawCSVDataPtr data_ptr = nullptr;
6055  ColNamesPtr _col_names = nullptr;
6056  CSVFieldList* fields = nullptr;
6057  int field_start = UNINITIALIZED_FIELD;
6058  size_t field_length = 0;
6059 
6061  ParseFlagMap _parse_flags;
6063 
6066  bool _eof = false;
6067 
6069  size_t source_size = 0;
6071 
6073  CONSTEXPR bool no_chunk() const { return this->source_size < ITERATION_CHUNK_SIZE; }
6074 
6079  size_t parse();
6080 
6082  void reset_data_ptr();
6083  private:
6087  WhitespaceMap _ws_flags;
6088  bool quote_escape = false;
6089  bool field_has_double_quote = false;
6090 
6092  size_t data_pos = 0;
6093 
6095  bool unicode_bom_scan = false;
6096  bool _utf8_bom = false;
6097 
6099  RowCollection* _records = nullptr;
6100 
6101  CONSTEXPR_17 bool ws_flag(const char ch) const noexcept {
6102  return _ws_flags.data()[ch + 128];
6103  }
6104 
6105  size_t& current_row_start() {
6106  return this->current_row.data_start;
6107  }
6108 
6109  void parse_field() noexcept;
6110 
6112  void push_field();
6113 
6115  void push_row();
6116 
6118  void trim_utf8_bom();
6119  };
6120 
6124  template<typename TStream>
6125  class StreamParser: public IBasicCSVParser {
6126  using RowCollection = ThreadSafeDeque<CSVRow>;
6127 
6128  public:
6129  StreamParser(TStream& source,
6130  const CSVFormat& format,
6131  const ColNamesPtr& col_names = nullptr
6132  ) : IBasicCSVParser(format, col_names), _source(std::move(source)) {};
6133 
6134  StreamParser(
6135  TStream& source,
6136  internals::ParseFlagMap parse_flags,
6137  internals::WhitespaceMap ws_flags) :
6138  IBasicCSVParser(parse_flags, ws_flags),
6139  _source(std::move(source))
6140  {};
6141 
6142  ~StreamParser() {}
6143 
6144  void next(size_t bytes = ITERATION_CHUNK_SIZE) override {
6145  if (this->eof()) return;
6146 
6147  this->reset_data_ptr();
6148  this->data_ptr->_data = std::make_shared<std::string>();
6149 
6150  if (source_size == 0) {
6151  const auto start = _source.tellg();
6152  _source.seekg(0, std::ios::end);
6153  const auto end = _source.tellg();
6154  _source.seekg(0, std::ios::beg);
6155 
6156  source_size = end - start;
6157  }
6158 
6159  // Read data into buffer
6160  size_t length = std::min(source_size - stream_pos, bytes);
6161  std::unique_ptr<char[]> buff(new char[length]);
6162  _source.seekg(stream_pos, std::ios::beg);
6163  _source.read(buff.get(), length);
6164  stream_pos = _source.tellg();
6165  ((std::string*)(this->data_ptr->_data.get()))->assign(buff.get(), length);
6166 
6167  // Create string_view
6168  this->data_ptr->data = *((std::string*)this->data_ptr->_data.get());
6169 
6170  // Parse
6171  this->current_row = CSVRow(this->data_ptr);
6172  size_t remainder = this->parse();
6173 
6174  if (stream_pos == source_size || no_chunk()) {
6175  this->_eof = true;
6176  this->end_feed();
6177  }
6178  else {
6179  this->stream_pos -= (length - remainder);
6180  }
6181  }
6182 
6183  private:
6184  TStream _source;
6185  size_t stream_pos = 0;
6186  };
6187 
6197  class MmapParser : public IBasicCSVParser {
6198  public:
6199  MmapParser(csv::string_view filename,
6200  const CSVFormat& format,
6201  const ColNamesPtr& col_names = nullptr
6202  ) : IBasicCSVParser(format, col_names) {
6203  this->_filename = filename.data();
6204  this->source_size = get_file_size(filename);
6205  };
6206 
6207  ~MmapParser() {}
6208 
6209  void next(size_t bytes) override;
6210 
6211  private:
6212  std::string _filename;
6213  size_t mmap_pos = 0;
6214  };
6215  }
6216 }
6217

6224

6235  }

6238  csv::string_view filename,
6239  const CSVFormat format = CSVFormat::guess_csv());

6243  const std::vector<char>& delims = { ',', '|', '\t', ';', '^', '~' });

6252  class CSVReader {
6253  public:
6264  class iterator {
6265  public:
6266  #ifndef DOXYGEN_SHOULD_SKIP_THIS
6267  using value_type = CSVRow;
6268  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
6269  using pointer = CSVRow * ;
6270  using reference = CSVRow & ;
6271  using iterator_category = std::input_iterator_tag;
6272  #endif
6273 
6274  iterator() = default;
6275  iterator(CSVReader* reader) : daddy(reader) {};
6276  iterator(CSVReader*, CSVRow&&);
6277 
6279  CONSTEXPR_14 reference operator*() { return this->row; }
6280 
6282  CONSTEXPR_14 pointer operator->() { return &(this->row); }
6283 
6284  iterator& operator++();
6285  iterator operator++(int);
6286  iterator& operator--();
6287 
6291  CONSTEXPR bool operator==(const iterator& other) const noexcept {
6292  return (this->daddy == other.daddy) && (this->i == other.i);
6293  }
6294 
6295  CONSTEXPR bool operator!=(const iterator& other) const noexcept { return !operator==(other); }
6296  private:
6297  CSVReader * daddy = nullptr; // Pointer to parent
6298  CSVRow row; // Current row
6299  size_t i = 0; // Index of current row
6300  };
6301 
6306  CSVReader(csv::string_view filename, CSVFormat format = CSVFormat::guess_csv());
6307 
6314  template<typename TStream,
6315  csv::enable_if_t<std::is_base_of<std::istream, TStream>::value, int> = 0>
6316  CSVReader(TStream& source, CSVFormat format = CSVFormat()) : _format(format) {
6317  using Parser = internals::StreamParser<TStream>;
6318 
6319  if (!format.col_names.empty())
6320  this->set_col_names(format.col_names);
6321 
6322  this->parser = std::unique_ptr<Parser>(
6323  new Parser(source, format, col_names)); // For C++11
6324  this->initial_read();
6325  }
6327 
6328  CSVReader(const CSVReader&) = delete; // No copy constructor
6329  CSVReader(CSVReader&&) = default; // Move constructor
6330  CSVReader& operator=(const CSVReader&) = delete; // No copy assignment
6331  CSVReader& operator=(CSVReader&& other) = default;
6332  ~CSVReader() {
6333  if (this->read_csv_worker.joinable()) {
6334  this->read_csv_worker.join();
6335  }
6336  }
6337 
6340  bool read_row(CSVRow &row);
6341  iterator begin();
6342  HEDLEY_CONST iterator end() const noexcept;
6343 
6345  bool eof() const noexcept { return this->parser->eof(); };
6347 
6350  CSVFormat get_format() const;
6351  std::vector<std::string> get_col_names() const;
6352  int index_of(csv::string_view col_name) const;
6354 
6357 
6363  CONSTEXPR bool empty() const noexcept { return this->n_rows() == 0; }
6364 
6366  CONSTEXPR size_t n_rows() const noexcept { return this->_n_rows; }
6367 
6369  bool utf8_bom() const noexcept { return this->parser->utf8_bom(); }
6371 
6372  protected:
6381  void set_col_names(const std::vector<std::string>&);
6382 
6385  CSVFormat _format;
6387 
6390 
6391  internals::ColNamesPtr col_names = std::make_shared<internals::ColNames>();
6392 
6394  std::unique_ptr<internals::IBasicCSVParser> parser = nullptr;
6395 
6397  std::unique_ptr<RowCollection> records{new RowCollection(100)};
6398 
6399  size_t n_cols = 0;
6400  size_t _n_rows = 0;
6404  bool read_csv(size_t bytes = internals::ITERATION_CHUNK_SIZE);
6406 
6409  private:
6411  bool header_trimmed = false;
6412 
6415  std::thread read_csv_worker;
6417 
6419  void initial_read() {
6420  this->read_csv_worker = std::thread(&CSVReader::read_csv, this, internals::ITERATION_CHUNK_SIZE);
6421  this->read_csv_worker.join();
6422  }
6423 
6424  void trim_header();
6425  };
6426 }

6432 #include <unordered_map>
6433 #include <sstream>
6434 #include <vector>
6435 
6436 namespace csv {
6443  class CSVStat {
6444  public:
6445  using FreqCount = std::unordered_map<std::string, size_t>;
6446  using TypeCount = std::unordered_map<DataType, size_t>;
6447 
6448  std::vector<long double> get_mean() const;
6449  std::vector<long double> get_variance() const;
6450  std::vector<long double> get_mins() const;
6451  std::vector<long double> get_maxes() const;
6452  std::vector<FreqCount> get_counts() const;
6453  std::vector<TypeCount> get_dtypes() const;
6454 
6455  std::vector<std::string> get_col_names() const {
6456  return this->reader.get_col_names();
6457  }
6458 
6459  CSVStat(csv::string_view filename, CSVFormat format = CSVFormat::guess_csv());
6460  CSVStat(std::stringstream& source, CSVFormat format = CSVFormat());
6461  private:
6462  // An array of rolling averages
6463  // Each index corresponds to the rolling mean for the column at said index
6464  std::vector<long double> rolling_means;
6465  std::vector<long double> rolling_vars;
6466  std::vector<long double> mins;
6467  std::vector<long double> maxes;
6468  std::vector<FreqCount> counts;
6469  std::vector<TypeCount> dtypes;
6470  std::vector<long double> n;
6471 
6472  // Statistic calculators
6473  void variance(const long double&, const size_t&);
6474  void count(CSVField&, const size_t&);
6475  void min_max(const long double&, const size_t&);
6476  void dtype(CSVField&, const size_t&);
6477 
6478  void calc();
6479  void calc_chunk();
6480  void calc_worker(const size_t&);
6481 
6482  CSVReader reader;
6483  std::deque<CSVRow> records = {};
6484  };
6485 }

6499  };
