6523 #include <fstream>
6524 #include <iostream>
6525 #include <string>
6526 #include <tuple>
6527 #include <type_traits>
6528 #include <vector>
6529 
6530 
6531 namespace csv {
6532  namespace internals {
6533  static int DECIMAL_PLACES = 5;
6534 
6536  template<typename T,
6537  csv::enable_if_t<std::is_unsigned<T>::value, int> = 0>
6538  inline std::string to_string(T value) {
6539  std::string digits_reverse = "";
6540 
6541  if (value == 0) return "0";
6542 
6543  while (value > 0) {
6544  digits_reverse += (char)('0' + (value % 10));
6545  value /= 10;
6546  }
6547 
6548  return std::string(digits_reverse.rbegin(), digits_reverse.rend());
6549  }
6550 
6552  template<
6553  typename T,
6554  csv::enable_if_t<std::is_integral<T>::value && std::is_signed<T>::value, int> = 0
6555  >
6556  inline std::string to_string(T value) {
6557  if (value >= 0)
6558  return to_string((size_t)value);
6559 
6560  return "-" + to_string((size_t)(value * -1));
6561  }
6562 
6564  template<
6565  typename T,
6566  csv::enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<T>::value, int> = 0
6567  >
6568  inline std::string to_string(T value) {
6569  std::string result;
6570 
6571  T integral_part;
6572  T fractional_part = std::abs(std::modf(value, &integral_part));
6573  integral_part = std::abs(integral_part);
6574 
6575  // Integral part
6576  if (value < 0) result = "-";
6577 
6578  if (integral_part == 0) {
6579  result = "0";
6580  }
6581  else {
6582  for (int n_digits = (int)(std::log(integral_part) / std::log(10));
6583  n_digits + 1 > 0; n_digits --) {
6584  int digit = (int)(std::fmod(integral_part, pow10(n_digits + 1)) / pow10(n_digits));
6585  result += (char)('0' + digit);
6586  }
6587  }
6588 
6589  // Decimal part
6590  result += ".";
6591 
6592  if (fractional_part > 0) {
6593  fractional_part *= (T)(pow10(DECIMAL_PLACES));
6594  for (int n_digits = DECIMAL_PLACES; n_digits > 0; n_digits--) {
6595  int digit = (int)(std::fmod(fractional_part, pow10(n_digits)) / pow10(n_digits - 1));
6596  result += (char)('0' + digit);
6597  }
6598  }
6599  else {
6600  result += "0";
6601  }
6602 
6603  return result;
6604  }
6605  }
6606 
6611  inline static void set_decimal_places(int precision) {
6612  internals::DECIMAL_PLACES = precision;
6613  }
6614 
6617 
6642  template<class OutputStream, char Delim, char Quote, bool Flush>
6643  class DelimWriter {
6644  public:
6651  DelimWriter(OutputStream& _out, bool _quote_minimal = true)
6652  : out(_out), quote_minimal(_quote_minimal) {};
6653 
6658  DelimWriter(const std::string& filename) : DelimWriter(std::ifstream(filename)) {};
6659 
6663  ~DelimWriter() {
6664  out.flush();
6665  }
6666 
6675  template<typename T, size_t Size>
6676  DelimWriter& operator<<(const std::array<T, Size>& record) {
6677  for (size_t i = 0; i < Size; i++) {
6678  out << csv_escape(record[i]);
6679  if (i + 1 != Size) out << Delim;
6680  }
6681 
6682  end_out();
6683  return *this;
6684  }
6685 
6687  template<typename... T>
6688  DelimWriter& operator<<(const std::tuple<T...>& record) {
6689  this->write_tuple<0, T...>(record);
6690  return *this;
6691  }
6692 
6698  template<
6699  typename T, typename Alloc, template <typename, typename> class Container,
6700 
6701  // Avoid conflicting with tuples with two elements
6702  csv::enable_if_t<std::is_class<Alloc>::value, int> = 0
6703  >
6704  DelimWriter& operator<<(const Container<T, Alloc>& record) {
6705  const size_t ilen = record.size();
6706  size_t i = 0;
6707  for (const auto& field : record) {
6708  out << csv_escape(field);
6709  if (i + 1 != ilen) out << Delim;
6710  i++;
6711  }
6712 
6713  end_out();
6714  return *this;
6715  }
6716 
6720  void flush() {
6721  out.flush();
6722  }
6723 
6724  private:
6725  template<
6726  typename T,
6727  csv::enable_if_t<
6728  !std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value
6729  && !std::is_convertible<T, csv::string_view>::value
6730  , int> = 0
6731  >
6732  std::string csv_escape(T in) {
6733  return internals::to_string(in);
6734  }
6735 
6736  template<
6737  typename T,
6738  csv::enable_if_t<
6739  std::is_convertible<T, std::string>::value
6740  || std::is_convertible<T, csv::string_view>::value
6741  , int> = 0
6742  >
6743  std::string csv_escape(T in) {
6744  IF_CONSTEXPR(std::is_convertible<T, csv::string_view>::value) {
6745  return _csv_escape(in);
6746  }
6747 
6748  return _csv_escape(std::string(in));
6749  }
6750 
6751  std::string _csv_escape(csv::string_view in) {
6758  // Do we need a quote escape
6759  bool quote_escape = false;
6760 
6761  for (auto ch : in) {
6762  if (ch == Quote || ch == Delim || ch == '\r' || ch == '\n') {
6763  quote_escape = true;
6764  break;
6765  }
6766  }
6767 
6768  if (!quote_escape) {
6769  if (quote_minimal) return std::string(in);
6770  else {
6771  std::string ret(1, Quote);
6772  ret += in.data();
6773  ret += Quote;
6774  return ret;
6775  }
6776  }
6777 
6778  // Start initial quote escape sequence
6779  std::string ret(1, Quote);
6780  for (auto ch: in) {
6781  if (ch == Quote) ret += std::string(2, Quote);
6782  else ret += ch;
6783  }
6784 
6785  // Finish off quote escape
6786  ret += Quote;
6787  return ret;
6788  }
6789 
6791  template<size_t Index = 0, typename... T>
6792  typename std::enable_if<Index < sizeof...(T), void>::type write_tuple(const std::tuple<T...>& record) {
6793  out << csv_escape(std::get<Index>(record));
6794 
6795  IF_CONSTEXPR (Index + 1 < sizeof...(T)) out << Delim;
6796 
6797  this->write_tuple<Index + 1>(record);
6798  }
6799 
6801  template<size_t Index = 0, typename... T>
6802  typename std::enable_if<Index == sizeof...(T), void>::type write_tuple(const std::tuple<T...>& record) {
6803  (void)record;
6804  end_out();
6805  }
6806 
6808  void end_out() {
6809  out << '\n';
6810  IF_CONSTEXPR(Flush) out.flush();
6811  }
6812 
6813  OutputStream & out;
6814  bool quote_minimal;
6815  };
6816 
6824  template<class OutputStream, bool Flush = true>
6825  using CSVWriter = DelimWriter<OutputStream, ',', '"', Flush>;
6826 
6835  template<class OutputStream, bool Flush = true>
6836  using TSVWriter = DelimWriter<OutputStream, '\t', '"', Flush>;
6837 
6839  template<class OutputStream>
6840  inline CSVWriter<OutputStream> make_csv_writer(OutputStream& out, bool quote_minimal=true) {
6841  return CSVWriter<OutputStream>(out, quote_minimal);
6842  }
6843 
6845  template<class OutputStream>
6846  inline CSVWriter<OutputStream, false> make_csv_writer_buffered(OutputStream& out, bool quote_minimal=true) {
6847  return CSVWriter<OutputStream, false>(out, quote_minimal);
6848  }
6849 
6851  template<class OutputStream>
6852  inline TSVWriter<OutputStream> make_tsv_writer(OutputStream& out, bool quote_minimal=true) {
6853  return TSVWriter<OutputStream>(out, quote_minimal);
6854  }
6855 
6857  template<class OutputStream>
6858  inline TSVWriter<OutputStream, false> make_tsv_writer_buffered(OutputStream& out, bool quote_minimal=true) {
6859  return TSVWriter<OutputStream, false>(out, quote_minimal);
6860  }
6862 }
6863 
6864 
6865 namespace csv {
6866  namespace internals {
6867  CSV_INLINE size_t get_file_size(csv::string_view filename) {
6868  std::ifstream infile(std::string(filename), std::ios::binary);
6869  const auto start = infile.tellg();
6870  infile.seekg(0, std::ios::end);
6871  const auto end = infile.tellg();
6872 
6873  return end - start;
6874  }
6875 
6876  CSV_INLINE std::string get_csv_head(csv::string_view filename) {
6877  return get_csv_head(filename, get_file_size(filename));
6878  }
6879 
6880  CSV_INLINE std::string get_csv_head(csv::string_view filename, size_t file_size) {
6881  const size_t bytes = 500000;
6882 
6883  std::error_code error;
6884  size_t length = std::min((size_t)file_size, bytes);
6885  auto mmap = mio::make_mmap_source(std::string(filename), 0, length, error);
6886 
6887  if (error) {
6888  throw std::runtime_error("Cannot open file " + std::string(filename));
6889  }
6890 
6891  return std::string(mmap.begin(), mmap.end());
6892  }
6893 
6894 #ifdef _MSC_VER
6895 #pragma region IBasicCVParser
6896 #endif
6897  CSV_INLINE IBasicCSVParser::IBasicCSVParser(
6898  const CSVFormat& format,
6899  const ColNamesPtr& col_names
6900  ) : _col_names(col_names) {
6901  if (format.no_quote) {
6902  _parse_flags = internals::make_parse_flags(format.get_delim());
6903  }
6904  else {
6905  _parse_flags = internals::make_parse_flags(format.get_delim(), format.quote_char);
6906  }
6907 
6908  _ws_flags = internals::make_ws_flags(
6909  format.trim_chars.data(), format.trim_chars.size()
6910  );
6911  }
6912 
6913  CSV_INLINE void IBasicCSVParser::end_feed() {
6914  using internals::ParseFlags;
6915 
6916  bool empty_last_field = this->data_ptr
6917  && this->data_ptr->_data
6918  && !this->data_ptr->data.empty()
6919  && parse_flag(this->data_ptr->data.back()) == ParseFlags::DELIMITER;
6920 
6921  // Push field
6922  if (this->field_length > 0 || empty_last_field) {
6923  this->push_field();
6924  }
6925 
6926  // Push row
6927  if (this->current_row.size() > 0)
6928  this->push_row();
6929  }
6930 
6931  CSV_INLINE void IBasicCSVParser::parse_field() noexcept {
6932  using internals::ParseFlags;
6933  auto& in = this->data_ptr->data;
6934 
6935  // Trim off leading whitespace
6936  while (data_pos < in.size() && ws_flag(in[data_pos]))
6937  data_pos++;
6938 
6939  if (field_start == UNINITIALIZED_FIELD)
6940  field_start = (int)(data_pos - current_row_start());
6941 
6942  // Optimization: Since NOT_SPECIAL characters tend to occur in contiguous
6943  // sequences, use the loop below to avoid having to go through the outer
6944  // switch statement as much as possible
6945  while (data_pos < in.size() && compound_parse_flag(in[data_pos]) == ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL)
6946  data_pos++;
6947 
6948  field_length = data_pos - (field_start + current_row_start());
6949 
6950  // Trim off trailing whitespace, this->field_length constraint matters
6951  // when field is entirely whitespace
6952  for (size_t j = data_pos - 1; ws_flag(in[j]) && this->field_length > 0; j--)
6953  this->field_length--;
6954  }
6955 
6956  CSV_INLINE void IBasicCSVParser::push_field()
6957  {
6958  // Update
6959  if (field_has_double_quote) {
6960  fields->emplace_back(
6961  field_start == UNINITIALIZED_FIELD ? 0 : (unsigned int)field_start,
6962  field_length,
6963  true
6964  );
6965  field_has_double_quote = false;
6966 
6967  }
6968  else {
6969  fields->emplace_back(
6970  field_start == UNINITIALIZED_FIELD ? 0 : (unsigned int)field_start,
6971  field_length
6972  );
6973  }
6974 
6975  current_row.row_length++;
6976 
6977  // Reset field state
6978  field_start = UNINITIALIZED_FIELD;
6979  field_length = 0;
6980  }
6981 
6983  CSV_INLINE size_t IBasicCSVParser::parse()
6984  {
6985  using internals::ParseFlags;
6986 
6987  this->quote_escape = false;
6988  this->data_pos = 0;
6989  this->current_row_start() = 0;
6990  this->trim_utf8_bom();
6991 
6992  auto& in = this->data_ptr->data;
6993  while (this->data_pos < in.size()) {
6994  switch (compound_parse_flag(in[this->data_pos])) {
6995  case ParseFlags::DELIMITER:
6996  this->push_field();
6997  this->data_pos++;
6998  break;
6999 
7000  case ParseFlags::NEWLINE:
7001  this->data_pos++;
7002 
7003  // Catches CRLF (or LFLF)
7004  if (this->data_pos < in.size() && parse_flag(in[this->data_pos]) == ParseFlags::NEWLINE)
7005  this->data_pos++;
7006 
7007  // End of record -> Write record
7008  this->push_field();
7009  this->push_row();
7010 
7011  // Reset
7012  this->current_row = CSVRow(data_ptr, this->data_pos, fields->size());
7013  break;
7014 
7015  case ParseFlags::NOT_SPECIAL:
7016  this->parse_field();
7017  break;
7018 
7019  case ParseFlags::QUOTE_ESCAPE_QUOTE:
7020  if (data_pos + 1 == in.size()) return this->current_row_start();
7021  else if (data_pos + 1 < in.size()) {
7022  auto next_ch = parse_flag(in[data_pos + 1]);
7023  if (next_ch >= ParseFlags::DELIMITER) {
7024  quote_escape = false;
7025  data_pos++;
7026  break;
7027  }
7028  else if (next_ch == ParseFlags::QUOTE) {
7029  // Case: Escaped quote
7030  data_pos += 2;
7031  this->field_length += 2;
7032  this->field_has_double_quote = true;
7033  break;
7034  }
7035  }
7036 
7037  // Case: Unescaped single quote => not strictly valid but we'll keep it
7038  this->field_length++;
7039  data_pos++;
7040 
7041  break;
7042 
7043  default: // Quote (currently not quote escaped)
7044  if (this->field_length == 0) {
7045  quote_escape = true;
7046  data_pos++;
7047  if (field_start == UNINITIALIZED_FIELD && data_pos < in.size() && !ws_flag(in[data_pos]))
7048  field_start = (int)(data_pos - current_row_start());
7049  break;
7050  }
7051 
7052  // Case: Unescaped quote
7053  this->field_length++;
7054  data_pos++;
7055 
7056  break;
7057  }
7058  }
7059 
7060  return this->current_row_start();
7061  }
7062 
7063  CSV_INLINE void IBasicCSVParser::push_row() {
7064  current_row.row_length = fields->size() - current_row.fields_start;
7065  this->_records->push_back(std::move(current_row));
7066  }
7067 
7068  CSV_INLINE void IBasicCSVParser::reset_data_ptr() {
7069  this->data_ptr = std::make_shared<RawCSVData>();
7070  this->data_ptr->parse_flags = this->_parse_flags;
7071  this->data_ptr->col_names = this->_col_names;
7072  this->fields = &(this->data_ptr->fields);
7073  }
7074 
7075  CSV_INLINE void IBasicCSVParser::trim_utf8_bom() {
7076  auto& data = this->data_ptr->data;
7077 
7078  if (!this->unicode_bom_scan && data.size() >= 3) {
7079  if (data[0] == '\xEF' && data[1] == '\xBB' && data[2] == '\xBF') {
7080  this->data_pos += 3; // Remove BOM from input string
7081  this->_utf8_bom = true;
7082  }
7083 
7084  this->unicode_bom_scan = true;
7085  }
7086  }
7087 #ifdef _MSC_VER
7088 #pragma endregion
7089 #endif
7090 
7091 #ifdef _MSC_VER
7092 #pragma region Specializations
7093 #endif
7094  CSV_INLINE void MmapParser::next(size_t bytes = ITERATION_CHUNK_SIZE) {
7095  // Reset parser state
7096  this->field_start = UNINITIALIZED_FIELD;
7097  this->field_length = 0;
7098  this->reset_data_ptr();
7099 
7100  // Create memory map
7101  size_t length = std::min(this->source_size - this->mmap_pos, bytes);
7102  std::error_code error;
7103  this->data_ptr->_data = std::make_shared<mio::basic_mmap_source<char>>(mio::make_mmap_source(this->_filename, this->mmap_pos, length, error));
7104  this->mmap_pos += length;
7105  if (error) throw error;
7106 
7107  auto mmap_ptr = (mio::basic_mmap_source<char>*)(this->data_ptr->_data.get());
7108 
7109  // Create string view
7110  this->data_ptr->data = csv::string_view(mmap_ptr->data(), mmap_ptr->length());
7111 
7112  // Parse
7113  this->current_row = CSVRow(this->data_ptr);
7114  size_t remainder = this->parse();
7115 
7116  if (this->mmap_pos == this->source_size || no_chunk()) {
7117  this->_eof = true;
7118  this->end_feed();
7119  }
7120 
7121  this->mmap_pos -= (length - remainder);
7122  }
7123 #ifdef _MSC_VER
7124 #pragma endregion
7125 #endif
7126  }
7127 }
7128 
7129 
7130 namespace csv {
7131  namespace internals {
7132  CSV_INLINE std::vector<std::string> ColNames::get_col_names() const {
7133  return this->col_names;
7134  }
7135 
7136  CSV_INLINE void ColNames::set_col_names(const std::vector<std::string>& cnames) {
7137  this->col_names = cnames;
7138 
7139  for (size_t i = 0; i < cnames.size(); i++) {
7140  this->col_pos[cnames[i]] = i;
7141  }
7142  }
7143 
7144  CSV_INLINE int ColNames::index_of(csv::string_view col_name) const {
7145  auto pos = this->col_pos.find(col_name.data());
7146  if (pos != this->col_pos.end())
7147  return (int)pos->second;
7148 
7149  return CSV_NOT_FOUND;
7150  }
7151 
7152  CSV_INLINE size_t ColNames::size() const noexcept {
7153  return this->col_names.size();
7154  }
7155 
7156  }
7157 }
7162 #include <algorithm>
7163 #include <set>
7164 
7165 
7166 namespace csv {
7167  CSV_INLINE CSVFormat& CSVFormat::delimiter(char delim) {
7168  this->possible_delimiters = { delim };
7169  this->assert_no_char_overlap();
7170  return *this;
7171  }
7172 
7173  CSV_INLINE CSVFormat& CSVFormat::delimiter(const std::vector<char> & delim) {
7174  this->possible_delimiters = delim;
7175  this->assert_no_char_overlap();
7176  return *this;
7177  }
7178 
7179  CSV_INLINE CSVFormat& CSVFormat::quote(char quote) {
7180  this->no_quote = false;
7181  this->quote_char = quote;
7182  this->assert_no_char_overlap();
7183  return *this;
7184  }
7185 
7186  CSV_INLINE CSVFormat& CSVFormat::trim(const std::vector<char> & chars) {
7187  this->trim_chars = chars;
7188  this->assert_no_char_overlap();
7189  return *this;
7190  }
7191 
7192  CSV_INLINE CSVFormat& CSVFormat::column_names(const std::vector<std::string>& names) {
7193  this->col_names = names;
7194  this->header = -1;
7195  return *this;
7196  }
7197 
7198  CSV_INLINE CSVFormat& CSVFormat::header_row(int row) {
7199  if (row < 0) this->variable_column_policy = VariableColumnPolicy::KEEP;
7200 
7201  this->header = row;
7202  this->col_names = {};
7203  return *this;
7204  }
7205 
7206  CSV_INLINE void CSVFormat::assert_no_char_overlap()
7207  {
7208  auto delims = std::set<char>(
7209  this->possible_delimiters.begin(), this->possible_delimiters.end()),
7210  trims = std::set<char>(
7211  this->trim_chars.begin(), this->trim_chars.end());
7212 
7213  // Stores intersection of possible delimiters and trim characters
7214  std::vector<char> intersection = {};
7215 
7216  // Find which characters overlap, if any
7217  std::set_intersection(
7218  delims.begin(), delims.end(),
7219  trims.begin(), trims.end(),
7220  std::back_inserter(intersection));
7221 
7222  // Make sure quote character is not contained in possible delimiters
7223  // or whitespace characters
7224  if (delims.find(this->quote_char) != delims.end() ||
7225  trims.find(this->quote_char) != trims.end()) {
7226  intersection.push_back(this->quote_char);
7227  }
7228 
7229  if (!intersection.empty()) {
7230  std::string err_msg = "There should be no overlap between the quote character, "
7231  "the set of possible delimiters "
7232  "and the set of whitespace characters. Offending characters: ";
7233 
7234  // Create a pretty error message with the list of overlapping
7235  // characters
7236  for (size_t i = 0; i < intersection.size(); i++) {
7237  err_msg += "'";
7238  err_msg += intersection[i];
7239  err_msg += "'";
7240 
7241  if (i + 1 < intersection.size())
7242  err_msg += ", ";
7243  }
7244 
7245  throw std::runtime_error(err_msg + '.');
7246  }
7247  }
7248 }
7254 namespace csv {
7255  namespace internals {
7256  CSV_INLINE std::string format_row(const std::vector<std::string>& row, csv::string_view delim) {
7258  std::stringstream ret;
7259  for (size_t i = 0; i < row.size(); i++) {
7260  ret << row[i];
7261  if (i + 1 < row.size()) ret << delim;
7262  else ret << '\n';
7263  }
7264  ret.flush();
7265 
7266  return ret.str();
7267  }
7268 
7275  CSV_INLINE std::vector<std::string> _get_col_names(csv::string_view head, CSVFormat format) {
7276  // Parse the CSV
7277  auto trim_chars = format.get_trim_chars();
7278  std::stringstream source(head.data());
7279  RowCollection rows;
7280 
7281  StreamParser<std::stringstream> parser(source, format);
7282  parser.set_output(rows);
7283  parser.next();
7284 
7285  return CSVRow(std::move(rows[format.get_header()]));
7286  }
7287 
7288  CSV_INLINE GuessScore calculate_score(csv::string_view head, CSVFormat format) {
7289  // Frequency counter of row length
7290  std::unordered_map<size_t, size_t> row_tally = { { 0, 0 } };
7291 
7292  // Map row lengths to row num where they first occurred
7293  std::unordered_map<size_t, size_t> row_when = { { 0, 0 } };
7294 
7295  // Parse the CSV
7296  std::stringstream source(head.data());
7297  RowCollection rows;
7298 
7299  StreamParser<std::stringstream> parser(source, format);
7300  parser.set_output(rows);
7301  parser.next();
7302 
7303  for (size_t i = 0; i < rows.size(); i++) {
7304  auto& row = rows[i];
7305 
7306  // Ignore zero-length rows
7307  if (row.size() > 0) {
7308  if (row_tally.find(row.size()) != row_tally.end()) {
7309  row_tally[row.size()]++;
7310  }
7311  else {
7312  row_tally[row.size()] = 1;
7313  row_when[row.size()] = i;
7314  }
7315  }
7316  }
7317 
7318  double final_score = 0;
7319  size_t header_row = 0;
7320 
7321  // Final score is equal to the largest
7322  // row size times rows of that size
7323  for (auto& pair : row_tally) {
7324  auto row_size = pair.first;
7325  auto row_count = pair.second;
7326  double score = (double)(row_size * row_count);
7327  if (score > final_score) {
7328  final_score = score;
7329  header_row = row_when[row_size];
7330  }
7331  }
7332 
7333  return {
7334  final_score,
7335  header_row
7336  };
7337  }
7338 
7340  CSV_INLINE CSVGuessResult _guess_format(csv::string_view head, const std::vector<char>& delims) {
7347  CSVFormat format;
7348  size_t max_score = 0,
7349  header = 0;
7350  char current_delim = delims[0];
7351 
7352  for (char cand_delim : delims) {
7353  auto result = calculate_score(head, format.delimiter(cand_delim));
7354 
7355  if ((size_t)result.score > max_score) {
7356  max_score = (size_t)result.score;
7357  current_delim = cand_delim;
7358  header = result.header;
7359  }
7360  }
7361 
7362  return { current_delim, (int)header };
7363  }
7364  }
7365 
7372  CSV_INLINE std::vector<std::string> get_col_names(csv::string_view filename, CSVFormat format) {
7373  auto head = internals::get_csv_head(filename);
7374 
7376  if (format.guess_delim()) {
7377  auto guess_result = guess_format(filename, format.get_possible_delims());
7378  format.delimiter(guess_result.delim).header_row(guess_result.header_row);
7379  }
7380 
7381  return internals::_get_col_names(head, format);
7382  }
7383 
7385  CSV_INLINE CSVGuessResult guess_format(csv::string_view filename, const std::vector<char>& delims) {
7386  auto head = internals::get_csv_head(filename);
7387  return internals::_guess_format(head, delims);
7388  }
7389 
7401  CSV_INLINE CSVReader::CSVReader(csv::string_view filename, CSVFormat format) : _format(format) {
7402  auto head = internals::get_csv_head(filename);
7403  using Parser = internals::MmapParser;
7404 
7406  if (format.guess_delim()) {
7407  auto guess_result = internals::_guess_format(head, format.possible_delimiters);
7408  format.delimiter(guess_result.delim);
7409  format.header = guess_result.header_row;
7410  this->_format = format;
7411  }
7412 
7413  if (!format.col_names.empty())
7414  this->set_col_names(format.col_names);
7415 
7416  this->parser = std::unique_ptr<Parser>(new Parser(filename, format, this->col_names)); // For C++11
7417  this->initial_read();
7418  }
7419 
7421  CSV_INLINE CSVFormat CSVReader::get_format() const {
7422  CSVFormat new_format = this->_format;
7423 
7424  // Since users are normally not allowed to set
7425  // column names and header row simulatenously,
7426  // we will set the backing variables directly here
7427  new_format.col_names = this->col_names->get_col_names();
7428  new_format.header = this->_format.header;
7429 
7430  return new_format;
7431  }
7432 
7434  CSV_INLINE std::vector<std::string> CSVReader::get_col_names() const {
7435  if (this->col_names) {
7436  return this->col_names->get_col_names();
7437  }
7438 
7439  return std::vector<std::string>();
7440  }
7441 
7445  CSV_INLINE int CSVReader::index_of(csv::string_view col_name) const {
7446  auto _col_names = this->get_col_names();
7447  for (size_t i = 0; i < _col_names.size(); i++)
7448  if (_col_names[i] == col_name) return (int)i;
7449 
7450  return CSV_NOT_FOUND;
7451  }
7452 
7453  CSV_INLINE void CSVReader::trim_header() {
7454  if (!this->header_trimmed) {
7455  for (int i = 0; i <= this->_format.header && !this->records->empty(); i++) {
7456  if (i == this->_format.header && this->col_names->empty()) {
7457  this->set_col_names(this->records->pop_front());
7458  }
7459  else {
7460  this->records->pop_front();
7461  }
7462  }
7463 
7464  this->header_trimmed = true;
7465  }
7466  }
7467 
7471  CSV_INLINE void CSVReader::set_col_names(const std::vector<std::string>& names)
7472  {
7473  this->col_names->set_col_names(names);
7474  this->n_cols = names.size();
7475  }
7476 
7488  CSV_INLINE bool CSVReader::read_csv(size_t bytes) {
7489  // Tell read_row() to listen for CSV rows
7490  this->records->notify_all();
7491 
7492  this->parser->set_output(*this->records);
7493  this->parser->next(bytes);
7494 
7495  if (!this->header_trimmed) {
7496  this->trim_header();
7497  }
7498 
7499  // Tell read_row() to stop waiting
7500  this->records->kill_all();
7501 
7502  return true;
7503  }
7504 
7519  CSV_INLINE bool CSVReader::read_row(CSVRow &row) {
7520  while (true) {
7521  if (this->records->empty()) {
7522  if (this->records->is_waitable())
7523  // Reading thread is currently active => wait for it to populate records
7524  this->records->wait();
7525  else if (this->parser->eof())
7526  // End of file and no more records
7527  return false;
7528  else {
7529  // Reading thread is not active => start another one
7530  if (this->read_csv_worker.joinable())
7531  this->read_csv_worker.join();
7532 
7533  this->read_csv_worker = std::thread(&CSVReader::read_csv, this, internals::ITERATION_CHUNK_SIZE);
7534  }
7535  }
7536  else if (this->records->front().size() != this->n_cols &&
7537  this->_format.variable_column_policy != VariableColumnPolicy::KEEP) {
7538  auto errored_row = this->records->pop_front();
7539 
7540  if (this->_format.variable_column_policy == VariableColumnPolicy::THROW) {
7541  if (errored_row.size() < this->n_cols)
7542  throw std::runtime_error("Line too short " + internals::format_row(errored_row));
7543 
7544  throw std::runtime_error("Line too long " + internals::format_row(errored_row));
7545  }
7546  }
7547  else {
7548  row = this->records->pop_front();
7549  this->_n_rows++;
7550  return true;
7551  }
7552  }
7553 
7554  return false;
7555  }
7556 }
7557 
7563 namespace csv {
7565  CSV_INLINE CSVReader::iterator CSVReader::begin() {
7566  if (this->records->empty()) {
7567  this->read_csv_worker = std::thread(&CSVReader::read_csv, this, internals::ITERATION_CHUNK_SIZE);
7568  this->read_csv_worker.join();
7569 
7570  // Still empty => return end iterator
7571  if (this->records->empty()) return this->end();
7572  }
7573 
7574  CSVReader::iterator ret(this, this->records->pop_front());
7575  return ret;
7576  }
7577 
7581  CSV_INLINE HEDLEY_CONST CSVReader::iterator CSVReader::end() const noexcept {
7582  return CSVReader::iterator();
7583  }
7584 
7586  // CSVReader::iterator //
7588 
7589  CSV_INLINE CSVReader::iterator::iterator(CSVReader* _daddy, CSVRow&& _row) :
7590  daddy(_daddy) {
7591  row = std::move(_row);
7592  }
7593 
7601  CSV_INLINE CSVReader::iterator& CSVReader::iterator::operator++() {
7602  if (!daddy->read_row(this->row)) {
7603  this->daddy = nullptr; // this == end()
7604  }
7605 
7606  return *this;
7607  }
7608 
7610  CSV_INLINE CSVReader::iterator CSVReader::iterator::operator++(int) {
7611  auto temp = *this;
7612  if (!daddy->read_row(this->row)) {
7613  this->daddy = nullptr; // this == end()
7614  }
7615 
7616  return temp;
7617  }
7618 }
7619 
7624 #include <cassert>
7625 #include <functional>
7626 
7627 namespace csv {
7628  namespace internals {
7629  CSV_INLINE RawCSVField& CSVFieldList::operator[](size_t n) const {
7630  const size_t page_no = n / _single_buffer_capacity;
7631  const size_t buffer_idx = (page_no < 1) ? n : n % _single_buffer_capacity;
7632  return this->buffers[page_no][buffer_idx];
7633  }
7634 
7635  CSV_INLINE void CSVFieldList::allocate() {
7636  RawCSVField * buffer = new RawCSVField[_single_buffer_capacity];
7637  buffers.push_back(buffer);
7638  _current_buffer_size = 0;
7639  _back = &(buffers.back()[0]);
7640  }
7641  }
7642 
7652  CSV_INLINE CSVField CSVRow::operator[](size_t n) const {
7653  return CSVField(this->get_field(n));
7654  }
7655 
7665  CSV_INLINE CSVField CSVRow::operator[](const std::string& col_name) const {
7666  auto & col_names = this->data->col_names;
7667  auto col_pos = col_names->index_of(col_name);
7668  if (col_pos > -1) {
7669  return this->operator[](col_pos);
7670  }
7671 
7672  throw std::runtime_error("Can't find a column named " + col_name);
7673  }
7674 
7675  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::operator std::vector<std::string>() const {
7676  std::vector<std::string> ret;
7677  for (size_t i = 0; i < size(); i++)
7678  ret.push_back(std::string(this->get_field(i)));
7679 
7680  return ret;
7681  }
7682 
7683  CSV_INLINE csv::string_view CSVRow::get_field(size_t index) const
7684  {
7685  using internals::ParseFlags;
7686 
7687  if (index >= this->size())
7688  throw std::runtime_error("Index out of bounds.");
7689 
7690  const size_t field_index = this->fields_start + index;
7691  auto& field = this->data->fields[field_index];
7692  auto field_str = csv::string_view(this->data->data).substr(this->data_start + field.start);
7693 
7694  if (field.has_double_quote) {
7695  auto& value = this->data->double_quote_fields[field_index];
7696  if (value.empty()) {
7697  bool prev_ch_quote = false;
7698  for (size_t i = 0; i < field.length; i++) {
7699  if (this->data->parse_flags[field_str[i] + 128] == ParseFlags::QUOTE) {
7700  if (prev_ch_quote) {
7701  prev_ch_quote = false;
7702  continue;
7703  }
7704  else {
7705  prev_ch_quote = true;
7706  }
7707  }
7708 
7709  value += field_str[i];
7710  }
7711  }
7712 
7713  return csv::string_view(value);
7714  }
7715 
7716  return field_str.substr(0, field.length);
7717  }
7718 
7719  CSV_INLINE bool CSVField::try_parse_hex(int& parsedValue) {
7720  size_t start = 0, end = 0;
7721 
7722  // Trim out whitespace chars
7723  for (; start < this->sv.size() && this->sv[start] == ' '; start++);
7724  for (end = start; end < this->sv.size() && this->sv[end] != ' '; end++);
7725 
7726  unsigned long long int value = 0;
7727 
7728  size_t digits = (end - start);
7729  size_t base16_exponent = digits - 1;
7730 
7731  if (digits == 0) return false;
7732 
7733  for (const auto& ch : this->sv.substr(start, digits)) {
7734  int digit = 0;
7735 
7736  switch (ch) {
7737  case '0':
7738  case '1':
7739  case '2':
7740  case '3':
7741  case '4':
7742  case '5':
7743  case '6':
7744  case '7':
7745  case '8':
7746  case '9':
7747  digit = static_cast<int>(ch - '0');
7748  break;
7749  case 'a':
7750  case 'A':
7751  digit = 10;
7752  break;
7753  case 'b':
7754  case 'B':
7755  digit = 11;
7756  break;
7757  case 'c':
7758  case 'C':
7759  digit = 12;
7760  break;
7761  case 'd':
7762  case 'D':
7763  digit = 13;
7764  break;
7765  case 'e':
7766  case 'E':
7767  digit = 14;
7768  break;
7769  case 'f':
7770  case 'F':
7771  digit = 15;
7772  break;
7773  default:
7774  return false;
7775  }
7776 
7777  value += digit * pow(16, base16_exponent);
7778  base16_exponent--;
7779  }
7780 
7781  parsedValue = value;
7782  return true;
7783  }
7784 
7785 #ifdef _MSC_VER
7786 #pragma region CSVRow Iterator
7787 #endif
7789  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator CSVRow::begin() const {
7790  return CSVRow::iterator(this, 0);
7791  }
7792 
7798  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator CSVRow::end() const noexcept {
7799  return CSVRow::iterator(this, (int)this->size());
7800  }
7801 
7802  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::reverse_iterator CSVRow::rbegin() const noexcept {
7803  return std::reverse_iterator<CSVRow::iterator>(this->end());
7804  }
7805 
7806  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::reverse_iterator CSVRow::rend() const {
7807  return std::reverse_iterator<CSVRow::iterator>(this->begin());
7808  }
7809 
7810  CSV_INLINE HEDLEY_NON_NULL(2)
7811  CSVRow::iterator::iterator(const CSVRow* _reader, int _i)
7812  : daddy(_reader), i(_i) {
7813  if (_i < (int)this->daddy->size())
7814  this->field = std::make_shared<CSVField>(
7815  this->daddy->operator[](_i));
7816  else
7817  this->field = nullptr;
7818  }
7819 
7820  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator::reference CSVRow::iterator::operator*() const {
7821  return *(this->field.get());
7822  }
7823 
7824  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator::pointer CSVRow::iterator::operator->() const {
7825  // Using CSVField * as pointer type causes segfaults in MSVC debug builds
7826  #ifdef _MSC_BUILD
7827  return this->field;
7828  #else
7829  return this->field.get();
7830  #endif
7831  }
7832 
7833  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator& CSVRow::iterator::operator++() {
7834  // Pre-increment operator
7835  this->i++;
7836  if (this->i < (int)this->daddy->size())
7837  this->field = std::make_shared<CSVField>(
7838  this->daddy->operator[](i));
7839  else // Reached the end of row
7840  this->field = nullptr;
7841  return *this;
7842  }
7843 
7844  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator CSVRow::iterator::operator++(int) {
7845  // Post-increment operator
7846  auto temp = *this;
7847  this->operator++();
7848  return temp;
7849  }
7850 
7851  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator& CSVRow::iterator::operator--() {
7852  // Pre-decrement operator
7853  this->i--;
7854  this->field = std::make_shared<CSVField>(
7855  this->daddy->operator[](this->i));
7856  return *this;
7857  }
7858 
7859  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator CSVRow::iterator::operator--(int) {
7860  // Post-decrement operator
7861  auto temp = *this;
7862  this->operator--();
7863  return temp;
7864  }
7865 
7866  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator CSVRow::iterator::operator+(difference_type n) const {
7867  // Allows for iterator arithmetic
7868  return CSVRow::iterator(this->daddy, i + (int)n);
7869  }
7870 
7871  CSV_INLINE CSVRow::iterator CSVRow::iterator::operator-(difference_type n) const {
7872  // Allows for iterator arithmetic
7873  return CSVRow::iterator::operator+(-n);
7874  }
7875 #ifdef _MSC_VER
7876 #pragma endregion CSVRow Iterator
7877 #endif
7878 }
7879 
7885 namespace csv {
7886  /*
7887  The implementations for json_extra_space() and json_escape_string()
7888  were modified from source code for JSON for Modern C++.
7889 
7890  The respective license is below:
7891 
7892  The code is licensed under the [MIT
7893  License](http://opensource.org/licenses/MIT):
7894 
7895  Copyright &copy; 2013-2015 Niels Lohmann.
7896 
7897  Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person
7898  obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation files
7899  (the "Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction,
7900  including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge,
7901  publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software,
7902  and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so,
7903  subject to the following conditions:
7904 
7905  The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be
7906  included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.
7907 
7908  THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND,
7909  EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF
7910  MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND
7911  NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS
7912  BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN
7913  ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN
7914  CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
7915  SOFTWARE.
7916  */
7917 
7918  namespace internals {
7927  static std::size_t json_extra_space(csv::string_view& s) noexcept
7928  {
7929  std::size_t result = 0;
7930 
7931 
7932  for (const auto& c : s)
7933  {
7934  switch (c)
7935  {
7936  case '"':
7937  case '\\':
7938  case '\b':
7939  case '\f':
7940  case '\n':
7941  case '\r':
7942  case '\t':
7943  {
7944  // from c (1 byte) to \x (2 bytes)
7945  result += 1;
7946  break;
7947  }
7948 
7949 
7950  default:
7951  {
7952  if (c >= 0x00 && c <= 0x1f)
7953  {
7954  // from c (1 byte) to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
7955  result += 5;
7956  }
7957  break;
7958  }
7959  }
7960  }
7961 
7962 
7963  return result;
7964  }
7965 
7966  CSV_INLINE std::string json_escape_string(csv::string_view s) noexcept
7967  {
7968  const auto space = json_extra_space(s);
7969  if (space == 0)
7970  {
7971  return std::string(s);
7972  }
7973 
7974  // create a result string of necessary size
7975  std::string result(s.size() + space, '\\');
7976  std::size_t pos = 0;
7977 
7978  for (const auto& c : s)
7979  {
7980  switch (c)
7981  {
7982  // quotation mark (0x22)
7983  case '"':
7984  {
7985  result[pos + 1] = '"';
7986  pos += 2;
7987  break;
7988  }
7989 
7990 
7991  // reverse solidus (0x5c)
7992  case '\\':
7993  {
7994  // nothing to change
7995  pos += 2;
7996  break;
7997  }
7998 
7999 
8000  // backspace (0x08)
8001  case '\b':
8002  {
8003  result[pos + 1] = 'b';
8004  pos += 2;
8005  break;
8006  }
8007 
8008 
8009  // formfeed (0x0c)
8010  case '\f':
8011  {
8012  result[pos + 1] = 'f';
8013  pos += 2;
8014  break;
8015  }
8016 
8017 
8018  // newline (0x0a)
8019  case '\n':
8020  {
8021  result[pos + 1] = 'n';
8022  pos += 2;
8023  break;
8024  }
8025 
8026 
8027  // carriage return (0x0d)
8028  case '\r':
8029  {
8030  result[pos + 1] = 'r';
8031  pos += 2;
8032  break;
8033  }
8034 
8035 
8036  // horizontal tab (0x09)
8037  case '\t':
8038  {
8039  result[pos + 1] = 't';
8040  pos += 2;
8041  break;
8042  }
8043 
8044 
8045  default:
8046  {
8047  if (c >= 0x00 && c <= 0x1f)
8048  {
8049  // print character c as \uxxxx
8050  sprintf(&result[pos + 1], "u%04x", int(c));
8051  pos += 6;
8052  // overwrite trailing null character
8053  result[pos] = '\\';
8054  }
8055  else
8056  {
8057  // all other characters are added as-is
8058  result[pos++] = c;
8059  }
8060  break;
8061  }
8062  }
8063  }
8064 
8065  return result;
8066  }
8067  }
8068 
8076  CSV_INLINE std::string CSVRow::to_json(const std::vector<std::string>& subset) const {
8077  std::vector<std::string> col_names = subset;
8078  if (subset.empty()) {
8079  col_names = this->data ? this->get_col_names() : std::vector<std::string>({});
8080  }
8081 
8082  const size_t _n_cols = col_names.size();
8083  std::string ret = "{";
8084 
8085  for (size_t i = 0; i < _n_cols; i++) {
8086  auto& col = col_names[i];
8087  auto field = this->operator[](col);
8088 
8089  // TODO: Possible performance enhancements by caching escaped column names
8090  ret += '"' + internals::json_escape_string(col) + "\":";
8091 
8092  // Add quotes around strings but not numbers
8093  if (field.is_num())
8094  ret += internals::json_escape_string(field.get<csv::string_view>());
8095  else
8096  ret += '"' + internals::json_escape_string(field.get<csv::string_view>()) + '"';
8097 
8098  // Do not add comma after last string
8099  if (i + 1 < _n_cols)
8100  ret += ',';
8101  }
8102 
8103  ret += '}';
8104  return ret;
8105  }
8106 
8114  CSV_INLINE std::string CSVRow::to_json_array(const std::vector<std::string>& subset) const {
8115  std::vector<std::string> col_names = subset;
8116  if (subset.empty())
8117  col_names = this->data ? this->get_col_names() : std::vector<std::string>({});
8118 
8119  const size_t _n_cols = col_names.size();
8120  std::string ret = "[";
8121 
8122  for (size_t i = 0; i < _n_cols; i++) {
8123  auto field = this->operator[](col_names[i]);
8124 
8125  // Add quotes around strings but not numbers
8126  if (field.is_num())
8127  ret += internals::json_escape_string(field.get<csv::string_view>());
8128  else
8129  ret += '"' + internals::json_escape_string(field.get<csv::string_view>()) + '"';
8130 
8131  // Do not add comma after last string
8132  if (i + 1 < _n_cols)
8133  ret += ',';
8134  }
8135 
8136  ret += ']';
8137  return ret;
8138  }
8139 }
8144 #include <string>
8145 
8146 namespace csv {
8151  CSV_INLINE CSVStat::CSVStat(csv::string_view filename, CSVFormat format) :
8152  reader(filename, format) {
8153  this->calc();
8154  }
8155 
8157  CSV_INLINE CSVStat::CSVStat(std::stringstream& stream, CSVFormat format) :
8158  reader(stream, format) {
8159  this->calc();
8160  }
8161 
8163  CSV_INLINE std::vector<long double> CSVStat::get_mean() const {
8164  std::vector<long double> ret;
8165  for (size_t i = 0; i < this->get_col_names().size(); i++) {
8166  ret.push_back(this->rolling_means[i]);
8167  }
8168  return ret;
8169  }
8170 
8172  CSV_INLINE std::vector<long double> CSVStat::get_variance() const {
8173  std::vector<long double> ret;
8174  for (size_t i = 0; i < this->get_col_names().size(); i++) {
8175  ret.push_back(this->rolling_vars[i]/(this->n[i] - 1));
8176  }
8177  return ret;
8178  }
8179 
8181  CSV_INLINE std::vector<long double> CSVStat::get_mins() const {
8182  std::vector<long double> ret;
8183  for (size_t i = 0; i < this->get_col_names().size(); i++) {
8184  ret.push_back(this->mins[i]);
8185  }
8186  return ret;
8187  }
8188 
8190  CSV_INLINE std::vector<long double> CSVStat::get_maxes() const {
8191  std::vector<long double> ret;
8192  for (size_t i = 0; i < this->get_col_names().size(); i++) {
8193  ret.push_back(this->maxes[i]);
8194  }
8195  return ret;
8196  }
8197 
8199  CSV_INLINE std::vector<CSVStat::FreqCount> CSVStat::get_counts() const {
8200  std::vector<FreqCount> ret;
8201  for (size_t i = 0; i < this->get_col_names().size(); i++) {
8202  ret.push_back(this->counts[i]);
8203  }
8204  return ret;
8205  }
8206 
8208  CSV_INLINE std::vector<CSVStat::TypeCount> CSVStat::get_dtypes() const {
8209  std::vector<TypeCount> ret;
8210  for (size_t i = 0; i < this->get_col_names().size(); i++) {
8211  ret.push_back(this->dtypes[i]);
8212  }
8213  return ret;
8214  }
8215 
8216  CSV_INLINE void CSVStat::calc_chunk() {
8218  if (dtypes.empty()) {
8220  for (size_t i = 0; i < this->get_col_names().size(); i++) {
8221  dtypes.push_back({});
8222  counts.push_back({});
8223  rolling_means.push_back(0);
8224  rolling_vars.push_back(0);
8225  mins.push_back(NAN);
8226  maxes.push_back(NAN);
8227  n.push_back(0);
8228  }
8229  }
8230 
8231  // Start threads
8232  std::vector<std::thread> pool;
8233  for (size_t i = 0; i < this->get_col_names().size(); i++)
8234  pool.push_back(std::thread(&CSVStat::calc_worker, this, i));
8235 
8236  // Block until done
8237  for (auto& th : pool)
8238  th.join();
8239 
8240  this->records.clear();
8241  }
8242 
8243  CSV_INLINE void CSVStat::calc() {
8244  constexpr size_t CALC_CHUNK_SIZE = 5000;
8245 
8246  for (auto& row : reader) {
8247  this->records.push_back(std::move(row));
8248 
8250  if (this->records.size() == CALC_CHUNK_SIZE) {
8251  calc_chunk();
8252  }
8253  }
8254 
8255  if (!this->records.empty()) {
8256  calc_chunk();
8257  }
8258  }
8259 
8260  CSV_INLINE void CSVStat::calc_worker(const size_t &i) {
8266  auto current_record = this->records.begin();
8267 
8268  for (size_t processed = 0; current_record != this->records.end(); processed++) {
8269  if (current_record->size() == this->get_col_names().size()) {
8270  auto current_field = (*current_record)[i];
8271 
8272  // Optimization: Don't count() if there's too many distinct values in the first 1000 rows
8273  if (processed < 1000 || this->counts[i].size() <= 500)
8274  this->count(current_field, i);
8275 
8276  this->dtype(current_field, i);
8277 
8278  // Numeric Stuff
8279  if (current_field.is_num()) {
8280  long double x_n = current_field.get<long double>();
8281 
8282  // This actually calculates mean AND variance
8283  this->variance(x_n, i);
8284  this->min_max(x_n, i);
8285  }
8286  }
8287  else if (this->reader.get_format().get_variable_column_policy() == VariableColumnPolicy::THROW) {
8288  throw std::runtime_error("Line has different length than the others " + internals::format_row(*current_record));
8289  }
8290 
8291  ++current_record;
8292  }
8293  }
8294 
8295  CSV_INLINE void CSVStat::dtype(CSVField& data, const size_t &i) {
8301  auto type = data.type();
8302  if (this->dtypes[i].find(type) !=
8303  this->dtypes[i].end()) {
8304  // Increment count
8305  this->dtypes[i][type]++;
8306  } else {
8307  // Initialize count
8308  this->dtypes[i].insert(std::make_pair(type, 1));
8309  }
8310  }
8311 
8312  CSV_INLINE void CSVStat::count(CSVField& data, const size_t &i) {
8318  auto item = data.get<std::string>();
8319 
8320  if (this->counts[i].find(item) !=
8321  this->counts[i].end()) {
8322  // Increment count
8323  this->counts[i][item]++;
8324  } else {
8325  // Initialize count
8326  this->counts[i].insert(std::make_pair(item, 1));
8327  }
8328  }
8329 
8330  CSV_INLINE void CSVStat::min_max(const long double &x_n, const size_t &i) {
8335  if (std::isnan(this->mins[i]))
8336  this->mins[i] = x_n;
8337  if (std::isnan(this->maxes[i]))
8338  this->maxes[i] = x_n;
8339 
8340  if (x_n < this->mins[i])
8341  this->mins[i] = x_n;
8342  else if (x_n > this->maxes[i])
8343  this->maxes[i] = x_n;
8344  }
8345 
8346  CSV_INLINE void CSVStat::variance(const long double &x_n, const size_t &i) {
8352  long double& current_rolling_mean = this->rolling_means[i];
8353  long double& current_rolling_var = this->rolling_vars[i];
8354  long double& current_n = this->n[i];
8355  long double delta;
8356  long double delta2;
8357 
8358  current_n++;
8359 
8360  if (current_n == 1) {
8361  current_rolling_mean = x_n;
8362  } else {
8363  delta = x_n - current_rolling_mean;
8364  current_rolling_mean += delta/current_n;
8365  delta2 = x_n - current_rolling_mean;
8366  current_rolling_var += delta*delta2;
8367  }
8368  }
8369 
8378  CSV_INLINE std::unordered_map<std::string, DataType> csv_data_types(const std::string& filename) {
8379  CSVStat stat(filename);
8380  std::unordered_map<std::string, DataType> csv_dtypes;
8381 
8382  auto col_names = stat.get_col_names();
8383  auto temp = stat.get_dtypes();
8384 
8385  for (size_t i = 0; i < stat.get_col_names().size(); i++) {
8386  auto& col = temp[i];
8387  auto& col_name = col_names[i];
8388 
8389  if (col[DataType::CSV_STRING])
8390  csv_dtypes[col_name] = DataType::CSV_STRING;
8391  else if (col[DataType::CSV_INT64])
8392  csv_dtypes[col_name] = DataType::CSV_INT64;
8393  else if (col[DataType::CSV_INT32])
8394  csv_dtypes[col_name] = DataType::CSV_INT32;
8395  else if (col[DataType::CSV_INT16])
8396  csv_dtypes[col_name] = DataType::CSV_INT16;
8397  else if (col[DataType::CSV_INT8])
8398  csv_dtypes[col_name] = DataType::CSV_INT8;
8399  else
8400  csv_dtypes[col_name] = DataType::CSV_DOUBLE;
8401  }
8402 
8403  return csv_dtypes;
8404  }
8405 }
8406 #include <sstream>
8407 #include <vector>
8408 
8409 
8410 namespace csv {
8418  CSV_INLINE CSVReader parse(csv::string_view in, CSVFormat format) {
8419  std::stringstream stream(in.data());
8420  return CSVReader(stream, format);
8421  }
8422 
8427  CSV_INLINE CSVReader parse_no_header(csv::string_view in) {
8428  CSVFormat format;
8429  format.header_row(-1);
8430 
8431  return parse(in, format);
8432  }
8433 
8441  CSV_INLINE CSVReader operator ""_csv(const char* in, size_t n) {
8442  return parse(csv::string_view(in, n));
8443  }
8444 
8446  CSV_INLINE CSVReader operator ""_csv_no_header(const char* in, size_t n) {
8447  return parse_no_header(csv::string_view(in, n));
8448  }
8449 
8457  CSV_INLINE int get_col_pos(
8458  csv::string_view filename,
8459  csv::string_view col_name,
8460  const CSVFormat& format) {
8461  CSVReader reader(filename, format);
8462  return reader.index_of(col_name);
8463  }
8464 
8468  CSV_INLINE CSVFileInfo get_file_info(const std::string& filename) {
8469  CSVReader reader(filename);
8470  CSVFormat format = reader.get_format();
8471  for (auto it = reader.begin(); it != reader.end(); ++it);
8472 
8473  CSVFileInfo info = {
8474  filename,
8475  reader.get_col_names(),
8476  format.get_delim(),
8477  reader.n_rows(),
8478  reader.get_col_names().size()
8479  };
8480 
8481  return info;
8482  }
8483 }
